My fitness pal Love, love, love, this app I lost weight before with this at 100 pounds and my only problem was with myself I quit the app I gained some weight back and now I‚Äôm back with it again in the white is beginning to come off it helps me to be responsible for what I put in my mouth and I love the emails that I get with recipes and fitness tips overall it‚Äôs a better success to me then weight watchers Jenny Craig or Nutrisystem and the fact that you can‚Äôt eat regular food when I make something I put in the ingredients and adjust the serving size accordingly to someone who has trouble losing weight this is a success thank you to the developers keep up the good work‚ù£Ô∏è‚ù£Ô∏è‚ù£Ô∏èüòÅ

Easy. Simple. Effective I love the app. As long as you keep track of portions the app will do all of your calorie counting. It factors exercise, which is great if you have a Fitbit/smart watch. My only complaint is that I had days that I ate very healthy at significantly higher portions than I was eating junk food and my calorie count wouldn‚Äôt be sufficient. This is not the apps fault obviously, but it wouldn‚Äôt let me close out the day. I was not starving myself- by any means- and it would give me a message as if I was if I was 200 calories short at the end of the day. I worry this could lead to late night eating for people, which is counterintuitive in the terms of weight loss.

Recipes as ingredients never happen. Okay, I‚Äôve lost weight. I lost weight with weight watchers and others. What is bothersome working with this app is that it hamstrings the whole food, non-processed food adherents. For example, I have a recipe that calls for Salsa Verde. I won‚Äôt use store bought Salsa with high sodium content and God knows what else. I will make the stuff myself with tomatillo, garlic, Jalape√±o, onion, and cilantro and save it as a recipe to use in a Chicken Tomatillo Casserole. In a perfect world with perfect apps, maybe. Each time I save a recipe to use in another recipe it is unavailable in my ingredient search. The same would apply to sauces and spice blends that are used in my kitchen. I have a work around for this deficiency: work harder while my dinner gets cold. If you fix this, I may give it a better review.
App is cluttered and a battery hog. The app was much better before UnderArmor took over.

Never is connected This is the second review of any app I‚Äôve ever used, and it‚Äôs mainly for feedback purposes. The apps core functionality of tracking your diet, your macros, your exercise, and even the integration with FitBit is really innovative but so poorly executed. 70% of the time it won‚Äôt execute searches properly. Most of the time it‚Äôs not connected to my Fitbit unless I disconnect and reconnect it. Currently I‚Äôm at work trying to access the desktop version of the app, and it‚Äôs not loading. I can only assume this is because the mobile and desktop apps share the same server.

What happened with this app? I used it for many years and recently got back into it and there are so many bugs and issues!!! I never had issues in the past but now for months, there is always some bug like when adding new foods it jumps and deletes things... or deleting all food entries from day all time... or not being able to find any foods when searching ..or deciding my minimum calorie intake is 0 instead of 1200 ..or one day says total weight loss 15 and next day 54 pounds???? I never weighted that much. The the list is endless, but I do think the commentary can be funny like for exercise ‚Äúmin of walking, pace slow, walking dog‚Äù what dog? Didn‚Äôt know I had one... I‚Äôm sorry my incline walking was not good enough... what‚Äôs next, slow crawling to fridge?? Anyways it‚Äôs very glitchy and each week there is a new problem.

It was good I‚Äôve never written a review for an app, but have enjoyed this one long enough as to get pretty perturbed by the changes. The updates are absolutely god awful and devolve what was once a fantastic app. If you now hit a meal option and go to log calories, it asks you once again what meal you‚Äôre logging. I ALREADY TOLD YOU. (Ex; lunch)

Love premium version I love everything about this app except one thing- I wish the total macros (P/C/F) would default to the bottom of the diary entry page WITHOUT having to click on nutrition button. (In order to hit my #s perfectly I have to go back and forth to my meals and make adjustments to see how it‚Äôll effect my entire days totals- so it just takes longer).

Neat App - Has Potential I have heard some good things about this app so I wanted to try it out for myself. I really like the barcode scanner feature and use it for my meals, however the only drink I seem to be able to add is water. No coffee or tea; very disappointing. I like that I can sync it with my Apple Watch, however you can only track your steps!!! Even if you manually add exercises in that you do, the app cannot track calories burned or sync with the Apple Watch activity app to help get an accurate count for the day. So unless they improve/add this capability this app is pointless. Especially if you pay for a premium membership, so unless something changes in the next 30 days the app will be getting deleted before my free premium access month is up.

Great app-Very poor Support for a paid version! Use the free version.  DON‚ÄôT get a paid subscription.  I‚Äôve been a paid user for over 2 years now.  Three weeks ago when they reported a Data Breach I followed their procedures to reset my password.  I have been unable to get back onto the app with my registered email!  Their customer support either responds with the stock Data Breach clap trap or they apologize that it is taking longer than anticipated.  But nothing further.  As an experiment I created an account with a different email which works fine as an unpaid version!  I can easily change the password and it still works.

Warning: Once you are in, you are stuck I tried Fitness Pal for a few weeks. Once the data breach happened, I tried to delete my account, but no matter how many times I tried, it would not let me. I kept getting an error message. When I tried to reset my password, the email link never arrived. After emailing the company four times to request that my account and personal data be deleted, they finally responded to note that they would review my request. I never received a response, and although I have attempted to contact their customer care team additional times, these requests have gone unanswered. So, just be aware. If you use this app and store personal information about your health and wellness there, it seems almost impossible to undo this action. They have this data and seem unresponsive to their customers.

Continuously Un-Syncs From Fitbit Not sure if it‚Äôs only a problem with FitBit users, or non-premium members, but MyFitnessPal is ALWAYS missing my FitBt steps. Considering I wanted to used this app to track my health and walking is a big part of my daily health goals, having this miss my steps throws off my goals. Although I can still track what I eat and MANUALLY enter my calories burned through exercise, it‚Äôs been such a hassle to go onto the MyFitnessPal website, disconnect my FitBit, reconnect it, and re-sync it in the app. I‚Äôve done it twice just this last week and today it won‚Äôt even update my steps. It‚Äôs been an ongoing problem for this app with many users for at least over a year and still hasn‚Äôt been resolved. There have been many updates to the app but this seems to have not been prioritized. I will likely just stop using this app, it‚Äôs just not worth the trouble.

Wonderful app, unresponsive customer support I have been extremely pleased with my fitness pal for nearly 2 years: huge food data base, syncs with Fitbit, yummy and healthy recipes that one can save . I have been a premium member since day one . I have recommended this app to many . On nov 1st this all changed . I was prompted to sign into my app . I am a paid up premium member but now have ads, there is no acknowledgment of my premium status. I am now unable to sync to my Fitbit as I now have 2 accounts . MFP has not answered my emails for help . I have no idea how to delete this second account !  So an a ideal app for losing my 23 lbs is now dysfunctional and frustrating !

Awesome app! I‚Äôve lost over 100 pounds, lowered my cholesterol and triglycerides, lowered my blood pressure and reversed my type 2 diabetes so I have a little experience in what it takes to get into shape. This app is awesome and I won‚Äôt go without it! I especially like being able to review everything at the end of the day so I can learn what foods work for me and which ones don‚Äôt. I‚Äôm also an actor so weight and health management are super important parts of my life! This is the best app I have found for helping me achieve my goals! I‚Äôve read some of the reviews complaining about it no having enough bells and whistles but I absolutely love it exactly as it is. I think it‚Äôs extremely user-friendly and very well organized.

Runs slow, freezes, doesn‚Äôt sync properly I have had issues with this app since I downloaded it. It hasn‚Äôt been horrible, just annoying enough to make you want to throw your phone.  The app goes very slow, freezes often, and doesn‚Äôt save recipes like it says it will. Also, I have to get a new phone and reinstall the app. When I signed back in, all of my data was lost. Everything! I tried to sync more 20 times over 2 days and it said, ‚Äúfailed. Will try again later.‚Äù Well, after 48+ hours, it still has not synced. I sent a message to Support and haven‚Äôt heard anything back yet.

Overall great, but some critiques: This app is probably to go-to for nutrition tracking. Pretty much any food you can think of is already preselectable in a database, and then the app tracks all your macro and micronutrients, as well as water intake, as you go. It also tracks calories burned and exercises done, but I don‚Äôt mess with that feature too much. Great app, but I have some features that I think should exist, and some general gripes:

They‚Äôve made the app almost useless Foods and recipes I‚Äôve created have completely disappeared, and recently the search function has become unusable. I can type foods exactly as they have appeared in my past diary entries and 99% of the time I only get one food that matches a single word that I‚Äôve typed mixed in with a bunch of completely unrelated items. The only way to enter food for items that I haven‚Äôt eaten in the past few weeks is to manually enter every time or scan the barcode. The search function used to work great, so this is a very recent change. I only switched to MyFitnessPal because of the ease of search and storage of recent foods and recipes. Now that none of these features work and my items have been deleted (along with the weight logs I had dating back eight years) there is absolutely no reason to keep using this app.

Review I love this app!! Within 4 weeks I lost 10lbs !! I‚Äôm on a 1200 calorie a day diet. I‚Äôm trying to lose 2 lbs a week lower my cholesterol and blood pressure. I‚Äôm 58 years old. My blood pressure and cholesterol lowered in 1 month!! I hope to eventually get off my medications. So far so good. I love reading the blogs and tips from others. I‚Äôve tried several of the recipes and to avail were really tasty. I started as a bet with my cousin and two others who also have poor health. By journaling my foods it holds me accountable for everything I eat, exercise and water intake. I will and have recommended this app for others!! Thank you MyFitnessPal!!

Your companion to losing weight This app has it all. I‚Äôve been a user since 2012, and when I need to cut, I always turn to MyFitnessPal. My favorite thing is how the app reminds you if you forget to log a meal. The app also makes it so easy to log your foods. A really cool feature is the calculation it does after you complete your food diary for the day, where it lets you know what your likely weight would be in 5 weeks depending on your eating habits for the day. The app also pairs well with your sports band app so you don‚Äôt have to enter in your workouts. It‚Äôs just a well-rounded, thought-out app and I would never use anything else.

Best app for weight mgmt I lost a few pounds on my own, but my loss accelerated with the use of this app about 3 years ago. After I hit my goal, I stopped using it and gained some of it back. I'm back in it and staying on it as I make much better nutritional choices when I'm logging. I even log my "bad" days just to keep a balance. The ease with which this tracks your food is untouchable compared to other apps. I like the way it tracks some nutritional values.

Better than others I recently have tried out several calorie counting apps and this is far better that the others. It‚Äôs getting easier to use as I get familiar with the app. I would like them to add calories burned for non aerobic work outs that may be too hard to calculate. My wife is going to move to this app too. I have found the power of counting calories is knowing how many calories on has devoured. For example, when I keyed in a Whopper meal it showed 1250 calories. Wow!  1250!!!  Although it‚Äôs hard to stay under or near my daily goal, this app has made me aware of watching what I eat. And it‚Äôs working. Since January I‚Äôve lost 13 pounds. 30 to go to get back to my Marine Corps weight. Ooooh-Raaah!

‚ÄúOffline Mode‚Äù has ruined the app! I used MyFitnessPal for many years on and off when I needed to be really diligent in tracking calories, macros, etc for diet purposes. It was great to create custom foods and it saved commonly eaten foods for meals so that you could add them quickly. It also has a super handy barcode scanner to quickly add nutrition info.

Love it, but... I have used this app for about 10 years on and off. It always helps me lose weight if I use it every day. There are great tips for exercising and delicious recipes. I have recently lost 20 pounds (again) using the app. I decided not to stop even when I lost the weight. I usually stop using the app when I get to goal. I switched my goal to maintenance and my calories went from 1200 to 1900 daily calories!!!!! That is insane! If I eat even 1500 calories I will gain quickly. This has been my only issue. To counteract this I changed my goal to lose 1 pound and my calories were much more reasonable. Overall, I love this app!!!

MyFitness Pal I really think this is the best app on the market for tracking macronutrients. Very user friendly. I would say over 95 percent of the items I scan are found and directly match the labels. You are able to create recipes too which is nice. You can always find a good article to read as well in the blog portion of the app. Tracking weight and progress is supported by a nice line graph to help visualize progress. Occasional crash but no reason to knock the app for that, all apps crash. I do think adding a calculator to the app would do wonders for those tracking food intake very specifically. Is that something that will ever happen?

Tech Issues After Buy Out, Not Keto Friendly Ever since they were bought out by Under Armour it‚Äôs been nothing but technical problem after technical problem. Data will disappear and return inexplicably and the app crashes often. Every time it happens I think, ‚Äúwelp, this is it.‚Äù The issue is there‚Äôs no easy way to export data, so  because the app has reliability issues, I end up logging everything twice, once in MFP and once somewhere else, to ensure I‚Äôll have a backup when MFP finally folds.
9 months with Fitness Pal I started using Fitness Pal when it was suggested by a nutrition service I hired.

Keeps me honest Some say counting calories does not work, but everyone is different, and that‚Äôs what I need to keep me honest about what I eat.  I don‚Äôt think twice about eating those cheese and crackers at night if I have already used up my quota.  On the other hand, if I save calories during the day, I can have that measured treat at night.  I love that I can create meals as I eat the same thing for breakfast every day.  I also like that MFP keeps foods I eat on a list so I don‚Äôt have to search from scratch to add foods.  The articles are also helpful and full of good ideas. Finally, I love that I can sync MFP with my Fitbit.. I can see calories in and calories out.

A good App with poorly thought out font color I‚Äôve used this app for years, I like it.  But when they changed some font colors on the app, those colors are now so close to the background color as to make them difficult to see or in my case, impossible to see.  Rule of thumb, if the font seems to close in contrast to its background, its going to be difficult for those with normal vision and nearly impossible for those with poor color vision.  There is a reason for tests where close color contrasts are used.  Those tests will weed out people with color vision impairments, therefore making your app very difficult to use.  Please go back through the app and increase the color contrast.

Good way to keep basic track of eating I find this app useful and I‚Äôve used if for years. It‚Äôs pretty basic (at least the free version is) but it kinda has everything you need - calorie counter, macro-nutrient break-down, weight tracker, etc. I have never tried but I‚Äôm not sure if you can adjust your macro nutrient goals.

Tracking calories from black coffee makes me want to suicide The interface is blue and like a boys elementary school locker room. The ads are for senior citizens and I‚Äôm not a senior but can‚Äôt get rid of them unless I go premium. I can‚Äôt connect to my scale because that partner app is missing. And then the final straw is that it tracks the protein and calories in my plain black coffee. Apparently 3 cups of black coffee have 7 cal and .1 g of fat. I don‚Äôt want to go to weight watchers again but I feel like I might need to because this is depressing. I want to give it one star but that is not really very nice because obviously a lot went into this. I really really wish it was more likable and user-friendly. Oh and the branded challenge with the cereal company is just weird and sad. Good luck y‚Äôall.

Overly Intrusive Ads I get that you‚Äôve introduced ads to make more money, but now, instead of just running banner ads, you‚Äôve decided to up the ante to force users to switch to premium.  Now, a video pops up EVERY TIME I want to make an entry. For example, if I‚Äôm entering more than one meal or more than one food, I have to deal with a 20-30 second video delay for every entry. That‚Äôs just too much.  Look, the app does a good job of helping me track nutrients, calories, etc. And it works ok with my Fitbit. But I won‚Äôt pay for it. I don‚Äôt believe it‚Äôs worth anywhere near what you‚Äôre charging. Ive been a MFP user for about 5 years and I‚Äôm less and less happy with it each year. There are other apps that do what I want without annoying me videos. Not that you care about losing one user, but I think I‚Äôm done with MFP.

Very dysfunctional for Ketogenic diets This is very disfuncional for a ketogenic diet. I‚Äôm needing to stay below 20g of net carbs per day (carbs - dietary fiber) and this app has no functionality to do this, only total carbs which is irrelevant for Ketogenic diets. So this morning I had 18g grams of dietary fiber and 4g carbs, and since my goal is to stay below 20g of (net) carbs, and the app only considers total carbs, I‚Äôm getting notifications that I‚Äôve surpassed my goal (as if I‚Äôm doing something wrong), except I am completely within my daily net carbs allowance, and am actually doing fantastic in fiber. I have the premium account but I‚Äôm seriously considering cancelling since this is becoming increasingly dysfunctional.

How does this have 5 stars? I thought it was just my phone or the app downloaded incorrectly. I was wrong. I‚Äôve tried to save recipes into my food log and it just says ‚Äúcannot connect to server - saved locally‚Äù. Then I look for said recipe and it‚Äôs no where to be found. Two days later it appears and I can log it. Why bother logging it two days later?

Love this app! Great app to help you see EXACTLY what you‚Äôre putting into your body. Not only is it a great way to keep track of your macros/caloric intake but also what vitamins you‚Äôre lacking and/or getting a surplus of. For me, it‚Äôs so easy to just eat whatever I want and not fully realize how many grams of sugar or total carbs or amount of fat those amazingly delicious items have. This app really breaks it all down and the numbers don‚Äôt lie. If you‚Äôre serious, or even just at all curious, about getting healthy.. track your food. Do it for a week. See what happens. It‚Äôs an eye opener, or at least was for me. Great work MyFitnessPal, keep up the good work!

Flawed Progress photos post upside-down. I notified the developer and they told me to upload from a computer or try saving them upside-down on my iPad and then upload. Uuummmmm wut? Really? I pay $10 per month to use this app, so maybe you should just fix the app.

Disappointed Hopefully they get it fixed bc I‚Äôm trying to use the app and I did love it but all of a sudden it won‚Äôt connect to a server and I uninstalled the app to reinstall and now it won‚Äôt let me log in anymore. I‚Äôm trying to see what else I can eat tonight and it‚Äôs not working. So glad I didn‚Äôt pay for it bc it‚Äôs unreliable. And I almost subscribed for the year.

Great app when it works App seems to have an ongoing problem where are you lose access to the online database and are only able to access the foods that you‚Äôve already used. It‚Äôs been an ongoing problem for over a year. When you do a search and it‚Äôll say off-line mode and only give you choices of food you‚Äôve previously eaten. I am reinstalling now but I have read from others but this does not work but I desperately want to use this app. Just reinstalled and now it only looks up foods from the database and doesn‚Äôt show me items I‚Äôve previously eaten. Seems to me they should be able to fix this they probably have hundreds of thousands of users and make millions of dollars from the advertising they sell.
Missing my steps For the most part I really like My Fitness Pal.

App Review Extra Credit This app lets you track you weight, calories and more. Although I wished it was free it‚Äôs very helpful. All you have to do is put what you ate today or yesterday even a week ago it‚Äôll tell you how many calories you eat and how many you have left for that day. I also tells you if you went over and by how much. I use this app on both my iPhone and laptop both ways were simple and fun. I believe it a step in the right direction but I want help unless you have self motivation. Yes I recommend it for use and I‚Äôll continue to use it but it not being free would be my only complaint.

Too focused on weight LOSS. But great to determine food swaps. I'm preparing to do full keto after my finals so lately I've just been tracking my normal intake. With the premium free trial, it's very easy to see what foods are more problematic than I anticipated so I can do some swaps.

Love this app! Been using for years I have been using MyFitnessPal for years, I have friends and been using with family members, have recommended it and use it daily. I have tried others such as weight watchers and iTrackBites and haven‚Äôt liked them as well; I always come back to this one. I don‚Äôt have premium, just use free version. I log every meal, make recipes to log meals , it‚Äôs easy and quick, I scan foods and it‚Äôs even quicker! Rarely have I had issues with the app, occasionally if IOS has recently updated. I love it and highly recommend it. It has lots of tips and a great community, tools for success.

Keeps me accountable and provide exercise calories feedback I love the information MFP gives me in terms of calories burned especially just by moving around in a day. It was very helpful to me to find out that if I don‚Äôt move much during the day I lose calories! There are many sources that provide you with calorie counts but that is just part of the picture. MFP gives you data to determine how much you need to move, exercise, etc. to justify eating what you eat.

My doctor asked me to use this app I LOVE this app. For just $50 a YEAR I am able to manage my weight loss in a way that my doctor can work alongside me. It is also a very clear measure for me each day as I make decisions on what to eat and what food needs to be bought to have on hand.

Thankful I wrote a comment a while back about how the app was glitching. I immediately contacted my fitness pal and they got right back to me. Meanwhile, I deleted the app from both my cell phone and my iPad and I started a whole new account. What I found is that there was a possible glitch with my actual account and/or having the app on multiple devices caused too much confusion and the connection and was deleting various foods that I had posted. Whatever the case, I only have it on my iPhone now, and it works like a charm! This has been a key ingredient to helping me pull out of a deadly eating disorder and maintain a healthy weight.
Spam and Harassment Edit: I love this app. The splash screen asking for location tracking has gone away. Thanks!!!

This App is Great - But just a Quick Suggestion I'm an active 30-something woman whom was recently diagnosed w/Pulmonary Embolism due to birth control pills. Now that I'm on a blood thinner for 3-6months, I have to watch my Vitamin K intake. I have used this app for a good long while and I love it. My only suggestion: Is there any possible way to get a Vitamin K read on here? I have to use another app (I won't name names) to track my Vitamin K and it's horrible! It's cumbersome, it doesn't keep track of your regular foods so you have to keep entering them manually, etc. It's no where near as user friendly as My Fitness Pal. So, with that being my only "problem," I would certainly recommend this app to anyone!  Thanks for your time.

Great app This app is amazing. I makes you really think about what you are eating and over the five months I‚Äôve been using it I have dramatically changed the way I eat. I can determine ahead of time what I plan to eat and work with it. I can even have cake or a beer and still stay within my calorie intake if I plan it right. If I go over I can earn back the calories through exercise. It links with the step tracker on your phone, you can record activities or link it with your Fitbit. Between MyFitnessPal and Fitbit I‚Äôve lost 20lbs in 5 months! That‚Äôs one pound a week! I love it and find it so easy to use. Highly recommend it!

Difficult for night shift workers I love this app.  It makes tracking my food intake easier.  In fact, when I use it my weight does what I need it too.  When I don‚Äôt, even when I think I‚Äôm doing well eating, my weight fluctuates up or down more than I want it too (gaining fat or loosing too much too quick).

Will I ever be able to connect my Fitbit? I‚Äôve had this app for years but am finally to the point where I‚Äôm focusing super hard on my weight loss goals. Everything has been great until I received a Fitbit and have been unable to connect it. Initially I reached out to support about a month ago and I haven‚Äôt received a response. Every time I go to try and connect my Fitbit on my phone I get stuck in this cycle of trying to log into my account. I‚Äôll log in via Facebook, it‚Äôll flash a screen and take me right back into the Facebook sign in screen again. When I try to log in to Myfitnesspal with my email, it tells me to log in via Facebook. Around and around I go with no resolution. I want to change my review but until they fix this issue, I‚Äôm afraid my review will stay the same.

Apple Watch support/sync is HORRENDOUS I used to swear by this app. And it‚Äôs still amazing in most respects. But the Apple Watch support and integration is just awful. We‚Äôre now in the 3rd generation of Apple Watches - which means plenty of time to fine-tune the integration.

Macros and calories don‚Äôt add up The app has the wrong information for your calories and macros. I just noticed yesterday that my macros did not look like I hit my goal for the day. But the app said I was over on my calorie goal. So I decided to check myself. Carbs and protein count as 4 calories per gram and fats count as 9 calories per gram. If you check your numbers at the end of the day on the app, it is wrong. In my case, I was short about 130 calories. I addressed this with tech help, and they blamed it on the user error of people entering wrong macro and calorie info. This is incorrect and laziness on tech help‚Äôs part. I am canceling my subscription and will not pay for an app that does not do what it is advertised to do. I would not recommend this app if you are serious about your diet and nutrition goals. The margin of error is too high to reach your nutrient goals successfully.

Easy to use I never thought I would need to use an app to keep track of my food but it has definitely helped out so far. Using the barcode scanner to get the right food in is super helpful and makes me trust that it is actually putting the correct amount of calories. Being able to see how many calories I consume has been an eye opener and the app has allowed me to stay motivated to stay at the amount of calories I want to and I have been able to cut out foods that I noticed are not near as healthy as I previously thought. I would definitely recommend this app to anyone who is serious about losing weight(and also works out on a daily basis)

Love MyFitnessPal BUT I use Fitbit for tracking my steps and recently switched from MapMyFitness to Fitbit to track my workouts.   I‚Äôm very disappointed that the workouts from Fitbit do not sync over to myfitnesspal - just about everything else does so why not the workouts?????  I‚Äôve also recently noticed some discrepancies in the exercise calories earned.  I had two days where my steps were almost the same but on the first day I got 0 exercise steps and the next day 68 exercise steps.  ?????

Lost my history! I‚Äôve been using MyFitnessPal for about 4 months now, and recently it logged me out (which unfortunately happens fairly often). It then asked me if I wanted to update my goals. I said yes since I went from lightly active to moderately active. It then proceeded to erase all of my history - from every food diary the last 4 months to all the individual foods that I logged so that I have to go back to barcoding all the foods I had been eating. I have loved the app, but this made me livid. I have had stomach issues in the past, and logging and noting changes in my health has been very important to me and in just a second, I lost all of it. Forget about updating your goals! You‚Äôll lose all the history you had with the app! üò†

Great app...but there is room for improvement I really like this app, but it‚Äôs not very user friendly. It‚Äôs frustrating at times...my first day I didn‚Äôt get home to enter my dinner until after midnight. I wasn‚Äôt paying attention to the time, and when I entered it, it posted for dinner the next day. I could not figure out how to change or delete it. I try to eat on time, but I don‚Äôt always post on time.

Good App but has some glitches Today was my third day using the app and after I had eaten supper I was 134 calories over my goal for the day. Before I left the gym I rode on a stationary bike long enough to make up for the extra calories (21 minutes) and entered the data into the diary for the day to even out the calorie intake. The problem occurred when I went to end my diary for the day about an hour and a half later and the app had jumped from one calorie under my goal to 90 calories above my goal. I had not eaten anymore food or changed anything in the diary since leaving the gym. I‚Äôm not sure what caused the change but I wasn‚Äôt able to fix so it was as if the work I had done to balance it out was all for nothing.

Love it!! I have tried to lose weight multiple times but always bounced back or got stuck at plateaus. This app helped keep me honest and really visualize how much I am eating. Great to work with! Very easy-to-use. Would highly recommend anyone who is starting a diet and or fitness program it would help ensure beginners success. Actually helpful and informative I was skeptical starting this app because I was worried about the amount of time I‚Äôd have to devote to logging my meals. Definitely helps you feel like you‚Äôre in control of how your day goes. All around awesome!

Easy and it works! I gained weight recently and that was while I was already trying to lose weight. I am horrible at exercising and I needed to figure something out. Glitchy now, used to be great I used this app (premium version) for like 3 years straight and I loved it! It was very easy to create recipes and to scan barcodes and add food. The BEST app for weight loss transformations!! I have been using this app for YEARS and it has always been the best I could find on the Apple app store. I figured it was about time to review it, since it's helped me lose almost 60lbs in this past year alone!! üéâ

So Disappointed I have used MFP for years, I very much think that the developers are being overwhelmed by the amount of users.  UNDER NO CIRCUMSTANCE PAY FOR PREMIUM. For the better part of a month, MFP has been having sporadic issues syncing to other apps, last couple of weeks, totally gone.  MFP has absolutely no answer other than ‚Äúplease stop trying it is bogging down system‚Äù. Diary has been sporadically logging duplicates and triplicates of food entries for no reason. Over the past few updates, logging food has grown more & more cumbersome, to where it is now a total pain (frequently paired foods does not work well at all now, everything painfully slow) MFP is a perfect example of a great app going horribly bad. OMG - it‚Äôs a marketing tool I‚Äôm sure the paid version is as good as everyone says but forget taking it for a free spin to check it out first. It won‚Äôt  show the price of joining until you actually sign up for a trial period that automatically renews itself, through your iTunes account. Awesome results (free version) I'm just using the free version for now and it's really really good. My fave feature is the ability to scan products and instantly see the calories and other details. It helps me make wiser feeding choices and stick to my caloric goals for the day. Summary of the story, MyFitnessPal is awesome üíÉ

Look no further My Fitness Pal food and exercise tracking app has all that you need for any way of eating. Oh yeah üòé Great app! I love it because I can easily track what nutrients I‚Äôm getting after each food and also keep my calories in check. Super helpful, now I know what I can and can‚Äôt eat and what amount I‚Äôm able to eat. Just one problemo...

Comprehensive database. Addictive! I started logging in order to maintain a 1500cal diet, now I‚Äôm down to 1200. To accurately gauge your food intake, all you have to do is weigh/measure every single thing you put into your mouth. Do you know how small a 1/4 cup of granola is?! You will now! Helps me stay on track! This really helps me stay on track with my weight loss. I'm more motivated and pleased with my progress.

Great app, but one huge drawback This app works really well for me, but it is so annoying that you can‚Äôt set your macros to reflect net carbs instead of total carbs. This is the holygrail I had struggle losing weight in a healthy manner and putting on good muscle. This kept all my macro and micro nutrient in checks and i could also see my vitamin consumption. Credit for Steps or for Exercises but Not both The App is easy to use & even has Restaurants foods you can pick to list. However, you can only have credit for Steps or your activity but NOT both. Best calorie tracker I‚Äôve ever seen From the hundred of products I‚Äôve scanned so far not even once has this app not recognized any. It‚Äôs amazing! So easy to track your meals! Loved for years! One tip tho.. I have used MyFitnessPal off and on for the last 8 years probably. I love how you can find nearly anything in the system with the scan tool. Complimentary feedback with only slight improvement requested I would like better if there was an ‚Äúeasy‚Äù user friendly detail button that shows: Fitness/ Activity In: # of daily steps, distance in miles, and # of calories burned

App Very Inconsistent I have written customer support about issues with this application multiple times and have received the same ‚Äúplease uninstall and then reinstall‚Äù answer. Top 5 Apps I Use Daily It's true what they say, tracking what you eat keeps you mindful. Something so simple but yet effective has helped me get back on track to lose 90+ pounds of weight. Keeps you accountable When I decided to get serious about my health after a longtime neglect I implemented the use of this app. It was a great way for me to keep an eye on not only my total caloric intake but also on my macros. Because the app also takes into account your daily fitness it encourages the user to also perform more activity/exercise daily as well. The ease of the app is a result of its vast food library which saves time when inputting calories. Before the app I would write down all my daily calories; this has made it sooo much easier. Great app! Since March I have gone from 242lbs to 198lbs.

I wish everything was free! I enjoy using the app. I‚Äôve been on and off with tracking my diet, I like that all my information is saved regardless of having deleted the app many times. This is really the only major downside to the app. One room for improvement is that the app limits itself to track the amount of steps for exercise when the Apple Watch is connected to the app. I believe by connecting to the Apple Watch and the iPhone Activity app it should be able to track heart rate and various other parameters of exercise. Very helpful! I‚Äôve been using this consistently since April 9th and I‚Äôve lost 15lbs in a month! It has 99% of the food I scan in the database, and most exercises though I do have to create some. It works for me! I started out at 127 which means I didn‚Äôt set out to lose a lot of weight. I now weigh 116. I have only been doing this for 2months. I found it so easy to follow. Bugs keep happening When I first got this I was very happy. I could link it to my Fitbit to help and monitor calorie and exercise. For the last two weeks there has been several problems. Too slow to be useful I‚Äôve been using MFP for years now, but enough is enough. This app used to be great. Solid fitness tracker Updated: the last update has not been good. The app keeps hanging when I try to enter food or copy a meal from the previous day. I have to force quit and start over. It is just ‚Äúall around complete‚Äù I have tried various apps over the years, and while all shine at one thing or the other, they are not truly ‚Äúcomplete‚Äù. KISS Myfitnesspal is a system that Keeps It Super Simple!  A user-friendly app that has a lot to offer even without buying the upgrades. Good app with some drawbacks. First of all I believe that the good outweighs the bad as far as how well this app can help me. Friend to friend sharing I love this app very much and it‚Äôs almost perfect in my opinion. My only critique is that you can‚Äôt share meals with other people. The Future of Nutrition Tracking I‚Äôve been using MyFitnessPal for about 5 years now and it‚Äôs always helped me to achieve my goals. It‚Äôs intuitive, accessible, and overall awesome. Counting calories Iam 62 years old and weight 198 . Enjoying pro version My primary interest is counting calories and macronutrients, not fitness tracking ("you lose ounces in the gym and pounds in the kitchen"). Having said that I recently switched from another app and am very pleased with all the functionality here. The constant weight struggle This app is really fantastic, it's like that annoying voice in the back of my head to stop eating so much. I always use it for a couple months, lose the weight I need to, and then stop using it. I then gain the weight all over again and repeat the cycle. It's not really healthy, but without I imagine I would be in worse condition. So thanks. This app is a lifesaver. It makes me feel good when I exercise too and see how it affects my numbers. A Pleasure To Use and Possibly Life Changing My newly skinny friend harassed me to use this app, and now I see why.  It's not much to look at, and does a few simple core functions.  Therein lies the genius.  Commit a week to getting into the habit of recording everything you eat and each time you exercise, and you'll get why it's so great for those who just don't realize how much they stuff in their face. It's amazing how much I was overeating.  Also, you need to buy an accurate scale or the functionality will be severely limited.  UA has fancy ones that can beam your weight to the app but mine cost $15 and works great.

My Fitness Pal Anyone who wants to seriously track and monitor their food intake, exercise output, and breakdown of their protein, carbohydrates and fat intake then The Fitness Pal app is for you! This app has the most extensive food database available. Chances are if a specific food item passes your lips then that food item is contained in The Fitness Pal database. I highly recommend The Fitness Pal App for its ease of use, its robust database and if utilized, its the best way to keep you honest!!

Excellent App to help you lose weight! I have put on a lot of extra weight. Being a doctor I calculated my target of loss per month, but calculating calories intake vs output was difficult for me. This application has been able to search the caloric value of all the weird foods I try. I keep eating and adding it to the list, they application tells me how many calories I have left in my quota for the rest of the day. This helps me plan ahead of the meal & keeps me motivated. So far lost 3kg in 14days, still working towards my remaining target.

Gone down hill I‚Äôve been using my fitness pal since before the app. I joined in 2010 and have used it daily since. Great app ! This is an awesome app. I‚Äôve been logging my foods and activity to help me lose weight, and have been able to lose close to 30 lbs steadily and healthily over the past year. I‚Äôm close to reaching my current goals, greatly due to the help of this app-Thank you MyFitnessPal!  You‚Äôre great!

No barcode scanner I was on the fence about buying the premium version of a different app called my Lifesum and the only reason why I decided to stay with my fitness pal is because it‚Äôs a free app that has a very large database and allows you to change the measurements to suit exactly what you‚Äôre serving size is. Would love a barcode scanner!!!

This is a nice app but a lot of the food entries have incorrect nutrition values the food entries have incorrect nutrition values. Also, it would be awesome on the premium version if when you look at your nutrition for the day and click on say fiber or vitamin A it lists different healthy options for getting more of what you guys suggest we need more of like for fiber prunes for example or berries. It would save me a lot of time because at this point I see what I‚Äôm lacking in, then I have to google what I can eat to get me on track when it would be so much easier and helpful for you guys to add a link to each one showing your healthy suggestions.

I use everyday and have for years I have had a weight problem for many years. It started due to steroids for breathing problems. Doctors would give me diets. I used My Fitness Pal to track. I couldn‚Äôt believe and doctors couldn‚Äôt believe I wasn‚Äôt living. I would look at My Fitness Pal. IT WAS MY WITNESS! Finally after suffering for years with this problem, I found KETO.  That changed my life! I use My Fitness Pal to track. I don‚Äôt count calories so much as I track  percentages of macros. I try to make sure I never fall below 70-80% of my calories being from natural, unprocessed fat. Thank goodness for My Fitness Pal and KETO!

I love it This app is incredibly awesome, I had it long ago and I really didn‚Äôt use it. I guess it was kind of complicated at the time and I ended up removing it. Now I feel I have a better understanding of how to keep track of my daily active life and eating habits. The only thing that bothers me is that as a free app is very limited unless you pay a yearly fee. I would love it more if it could have a one time payment and that‚Äôs it. I personally don‚Äôt enjoy being hooked up to payments of this kind. This is the only reason I‚Äôm giving it a 4 ‚≠êÔ∏è. For the rest is a great start for anyone who wants to track a little about their eating and activity.

Perfect Tool As with any app of this caliber, this app can be appreciated for its great ease of use. The app contains copious amounts of information regarding caloric intake, exercise tips, nutrition, and recipes. I especially enjoy ability to track calories and record them with such ease. Family Share misleading Overall it‚Äôs not a bad app, but I do have a couple of issues with it.

Lost my account After weeks of on/off communication w MFP support they have not been able to help me regain access to my account. It‚Äôs like it never existed. The app and web logins tell me I have entered invalid user/password. A reset email is never received even though I get all other emails from MFP including ones for a new account I created. MFP doesn‚Äôt find my account... only my the new account I created a week ago.  Also I recently purchased the year paid version and no longer have access to it. Because it‚Äôs been over 60 days Apple can refund my money, MFP can‚Äôt transfer to a new account and the only way I may get my money back is to do a dispute with my credit card. Which I will attempt but really I just want my account back with a decade of data (history, meals, recipes etc). Disappointed.

Good but has a lot of glitches. I like this app for tracking my meals, problem is most of my meals are homemade which requires me to create recipes often. It used to be great I‚Äôve had this app for a while. I will admit I used it a lot last year up until fall or so and loved it.
