Now I can‚Äôt get my app to stay logged in, yesterday it synced to my Fitbit and today it won‚Äôt. When I try to contact someone for troubleshooting assistance I get bounced from one window to another and never any way to actually ask a question. I log in using my Facebook and today noticed somehow my user name is different than it‚Äôs been. I‚Äôd love to get contacted so I can get my issues resolved and be able to bump this review to 5 stars. Until then I‚Äôm being generous with 3.

The last update complicates it I‚Äôve always loved and recommended this app. I still do. The only reason I‚Äôm giving it a 4 is because it was better before the last couple updates. I don‚Äôt want to spend all day logging my food. I want it to be quick. It seems like you‚Äôve added an additional step to log food. Kind of like your asking if your really sure you want to log it. When the additional ‚Äúadd‚Äù button was introduced I actually missed logging things because I thought I was finished at the check mark. And by the way, I wrote a great review about this app on my blog. Please go back to the way it was before.

USELESS!!! ü§¨üò°ü§Øüò§üò© Can‚Äôt log in. Can‚Äôt reset password. Can‚Äôt make new account because my email is already attached to the account I can‚Äôt access. Finally got in using an old account that‚Äôs connected to Facebook but I don‚Äôt have access to the email associated with that account. And I can‚Äôt verify my email for that account bc I don‚Äôt have access to that email. I‚Äôm just going to have to wait until I get my new iPhone, set up a whole new iCloud account, & start my entire digital life over. Absolutely ridiculous. Customer service is extremely difficult to get ahold of. Sent an email but doubt I‚Äôll ever hear anything back since I‚Äôve never gotten my reset password email. Starting to think this company has completely gone down hill & is a waste of my time & $. I‚Äôll update if this ever gets resolved.

Could be better Amazing database of food items to look up. Cons - keeps reminding me to log meals when I already have. Apple watch app won't show any data. Too many advertisements. Biggest grievance: Why does it take me to the Home page every time I open the app? It should take me to the meal I want to log depending on the time of day. The main reason for using this app is to log food. It takes way too many clicks to add an item which deters people from logging after a while. I use force touch to add meals but it often pulls up the home page. Way too many things to click through to add a item. Developers need to return to basics and make it easier / quicker to log food.

10 out of 10 recommend! I have been using this tracker for a little over a week. It has typically been a challenge for me to lose weight and to stay in courage to do so. Using this tracker has made it really encouraging for me. Specifically after each day when I submit my daily tracker and it tells me what my weight will be in five weeks if I keep it up. A little over a week and I‚Äôve already lost 5lbs! I also feel like I can eat what I want in the tracker helps me to eat in moderation and encourages me to exercise, especially if I want that ice cream at the end of the day üòä
Keeps me accountable This app helps keep me accountable. I love the way I can scan my food/drinks in rather than having to search for them. I also love that is syncs with my Apple

Best thing ever!! I‚Äôve enjoyed working out for several years which has helped to keep me fit. However, losing weight in particular areas has always been a challenge. My family tends to carry the extra pounds in the lower half of our bodies so buying pants was never fun. Since I‚Äôve been using Fitness Pal (counting calories), my weight started dropping!!  I‚Äôve lost around 15 pounds so far and now I‚Äôm wearing a smaller pants size!!  Of course I also attribute my weight loss to exercising too. I‚Äôm making better food choices and feeling healthier since I‚Äôve started using Fitness Pal!!

Annoying reminder every time I open the app I‚Äôve just upgraded my phone to an iPhone X, and I own an Apple Watch that was previously synced with MFP. Ever since getting my new phone, every time I open the app I get a roadblock asking me to update health permissions to read

Consistent discipline Love the reminders to record my weight and meals. The big blue plus sign on the home page also helps me stay on top of daily water intake, exercise, and my overall status. Appreciate the scan-and-find feature--everything has a barcode. Sometimes frustrating when there are multiple entries for the same food with widely-differing calorie counts. Like how The MapMyWalk syncs to MyFitnessPal. This makes it easy to chart my walks and runs for exercise. And it does all the calculating of energy expenditure, calories to add, etc. Glad I found both these apps!

Great Tracker, Missing 1 Feature MFP is a great tracker app. Once you‚Äôve created a library of your frequent foods, it‚Äôs a breeze to use. My one request is instead of keeping daily goals for days of the week, I‚Äôd like to have a toggle of ‚Äútraining days‚Äù vs ‚Äúnon-training days‚Äù. Then when I could wake up in the morning, I could set if it‚Äôs a gym day, cardio day, or rest (etc). Then my calories and macros for the day could change accordingly. If you operate on a ‚Äúworkout M, W, F‚Äù schedule then this app is awesome. If you‚Äôre like me and do a 3 days on, 1 day off schedule then the daily goals aren‚Äôt as helpful. Will gladly change to 5 stars with that feature addition!

A Bloated, Buggy, Battery-Draining Mess As a long-time user of this app, I am saddened at how little it has improved over the years. The database can rarely be depended on, including the entries that are allegedly verified; and unfortunately there are many weird interface quirks and bugs that make manual data entry unnecessarily difficult. Once you manage to actually make an entry, though, there are constant syncing errors. Then, if the app is open long enough (and it will be if you care about accurately entering data) your phone will overheat or the app will just crash. It‚Äôs weird how this app always seems to have a new update, yet none of these problems are ever fixed. The only reason I still use the app is because it has years of my data. I‚Äôm not sure that is a good enough reason anymore.

Does NOT sync to Fitbit I‚Äôve had this application for 10 days, and the last 6 days it has not linked any information with all Fitbits. I am giving 2 stars for the fact I like how easy it is to update food eaten to track calories eaten. However without seeing the calories burned, steps walked, and weight losses from Fitbit.. this application is useless. I will be finding another app that can do more.

Getting the baby weight off I need to really see the numbers when I am trying to lose weight. I have 20 more lbs to lose and they are the hardest. I signed up for a DietBet and use my fitness pal to help me track my calories so I can lose weight and win my bet! If I come in each day at a deficiency in calories I know I‚Äôm doing a good job. If I go a little heavy at lunch it makes me think again about how big of a dinner I have. When I do a good long workout I feel so good because I pair the app with my Apple Watch and know it‚Äôs accurate. With dedication and patience the weight will come off.

Best dieting and exercise log I have been with a weight loss group for a year and do 90 min of swim 3 days a wk for past 3 years. I had lost 5 pounds.   The second week using free version of this ap I lost 6 pounds. 13 since I started using the ap 3 weeks ago.  It takes a little bit to learn but once you get the hang of it it is fabulous    Best ap   I am so happy.  Thank you under armor   Please  don‚Äôt change anything about the free version.  It is life saving to me right now.   If I had the money though I do think the paid version would be worth every dime and I would get it.

Unbelievable! I wouldn‚Äôt have believed it if it wasn‚Äôt my own body!  I started using this app at the beginning of June. 3 months later I had lost the 20 pounds I wanted to lose and without feeling hungry or tired! In fact, I was energized and slept better than I had in years!  What a change in my body! I had to get rid of most of my clothes as I dropped from size 8 back to size 2, which is where I should be at 5‚Äô1‚Äù. I haven‚Äôt seen this weight since before I had my 2 kids 24 years ago. Thanks to MyFitnessPal, my lifestyle has changed and I love feeling ‚Äúme‚Äù again!

Take control of your life! MyFitnessPal is an amazing app that I would recommend to ANYONE! It helps you learn so much about what you put into your body and allows you to objectively see that you are in track to meet your goals. This app has changed my life forever as it has already helped me lose 30 pounds and 17% body fat! It takes the worry out of the equation and I never wonder if I'm eating the right amount of food or if I'm getting enough protein. Losing weight and body fat is simple if you eat in a calorie deficit. Eating in a calorie deficit is simple if you use MyFitnessPal!
This Free App is Better than my Weight Watchers I can‚Äôt believe the things that this app does that my Weight Watchers App doesn‚Äôt...and I pay good money every month for the Weight Watchers App!

Great app I used this app about 2 years ago and figured I‚Äôd give it a go again. It‚Äôs improved tremendously from what I remember, I love that it has recipe suggestions and fitness tips. I also like that you can input recipes in and it will calculate the calories for you and you can add it to your diary. I also love the scan option it makes things so much easier to input. It is really helpful in keeping myself on track and accountable for what I eat. I definitely recommend it for anyone looking for an easy foolproof way to track your calories, exercise, etc.

Love it Love it üòç Boy how I thought I was eating so well, until I could actually see it on that app. It was mind blowing!! salt Sugar Calories it was an awakening.......and the target ranges my doctor gave me now I feel like I am really in control of the decisions I make when it comes to food.  I'm not starving I'm adding in some of my good stuff, but I'm watch how I'm adding it and calculating if it's worth it to me and the rest of my eating for the day. If you are struggling like I was use this app. It works if you work it üòÉ

Great Features Having used the Fitbit and Noom apps to log meals in the past, MyFitnessPal is definitely the best. I pay for the premium features and they are worth it so far. My favorite feature is the daily reminder that if you are every day like this, you‚Äôd weigh X in five weeks. It really helps keep me on track. The sync with Fitbit is seamless so the app automatically adjusts my calories if I walk more. The ability to track nutrients and protein is very helpful and I use it daily. The only thing I have found missing from the app is the ability to edit a saved meal.

Um... why? I‚Äôm 14 and can‚Äôt use the app?? I mean I get it if the age limit was maybe 13+, but this I don‚Äôt get. There are so many teens out there who want to stay fit. And honestly, it‚Äôs most critical to stay fit and develop good, healthy habits during teen years, especially considering this is when most of the physical and brain development is occurring. I strongly suggest that you rethink your choice of only allowing people 18 and up to sign up. I really hope that you take this into consideration. I was super excited when I found out what this app could be used for and it has such great reviews. However, the excited vanished as soon as I met this sudden issue of not being able to make an account. Please rethink this. Thank you for putting aside time to read this; your response would be greatly appreciated.

Great App, but...could you add this option? Such a user friendly, awesome app to food intake and track macros One suggestion, is it possible to add an option to see nutrition (calories/macros) over a flexible set of days set by the user? Right now the only option is by a given day or adjustable week of seven days by date. I would find it more useful to be able to set it, for example, a set of my last four (or whatever number) of days to see my calories/macro averages rather than being limited to one day or seven days. Thanks for any consideration to this! Love the app!

Updates kill your tracking I love this app and would give it 5 stars, but there are some issues. I hate that with every update all of my previous entries are gone. It‚Äôs so frustrating to know you are taking then time to enter everything and then it disappears. I like to be able to look back and see what my food intake was. It also helps me track migraine triggers. So fixing that would be nice.

Love it! This app is extremely user friendly. I love that they have recipes included, they show nutrition as well as your macros. I think their premium version is extremely overpriced but if you have $80 to kill you can get a years worth for an extremely discounted rate compared to their month-to-month. If you are honest with yourself and record EVERYTHING you eat, you will see results! It has only been a week but i lost 5 pounds and feel really good! It has also shown me what foods to stop eating in order to better balance my meals. Highly recommend!!!!!

I‚Äôm confused. I got this app to help me on my weight loss journey. I thought it would be best for me to track my food as I have trouble of over eating and all. I haven‚Äôt gotten any other apps or gone on any other website to help me yet so I needed to sign up. I put what I need for the first two or three slides of signing up (I signed up with email) but when it comes to the page for me telling my birthday and gender and all I click the arrow and it keeps saying it can‚Äôt make my registration at the moment or something. So I was like okay and tried a few more times and it said the same thing. It is now the next day and I‚Äôm trying to sign up and it won‚Äôt let me. Is it my age? Did I do something wrong? Is it my WiFi? I even turned on my data to see if that would work. I don‚Äôt know what to do. I‚Äôm confused.

Great app. Good solid information In the world of fake news, its nice to know the information in the app, despite being based on user input, is (for the most part) accurate. You should still check any info that seems too goo to be true (12 oreos are NOT 50 calories!), but with a bit if searching you can find what works for you. If you are using it regularly, its gets very easy to use and is GREAT for keeping track of what you REALLY eat- in real time! You can project out your meals for the day, or even a few days ahead and make your goals more attainable!

Great fitness app! I have tried so many apps to help me count calories, track workouts, and monitor nutrition and by far, this app is the best I have ever used. I have lost 10 pounds using this app. It‚Äôs easy to use, straight forward format, and I love that I can scan things and it automatically logs it in. I recommend this for anyone wanting to lose weight or maintain their weight. It also breaks down protein, carbs, and fat. It has really opened my eyes to things I would usually eat on a daily basis that might not be as healthy as I thought. Try this app! You won‚Äôt regret it!

Loved this app until ... Until today. I‚Äôve been using this app for years. In fact, I even upgraded to the paid version. I‚Äôve done a series of fitness competitions and it was great for tracking my macros.

I am addicted to using this app I am trying to trim the body fat, and have used several different fitness and food apps with disappointing results. However, I have found my true love. What I deeply appreciate about this app is (1) it has a huge inventory of foods to track the nutritional information of the foods I eat (like the brand of airplane snacks on my Delta flight, and my favorite red wine), (2) it tracks macros and lets me customize my macro goals, (3) it‚Äôs fairly intuitive to use, and (4) it connects to Apple‚Äôs Health app. And that‚Äôs just after two days of using. Thank you Under Armour.

Safety net for weight loss I have used my fitness pal for three years now and it has been the best for maintaining and losing weight there is literally nothing in its database that you can‚Äôt find to find the calories the amounts and even after you lose enough weight where you‚Äôre happy and helps you feel good that you‚Äôre not deviating keep you honest and it‚Äôs simple and easy to use I love it and I highly recommend it once you get the weight off you can use it more casually and not as strict and it never let you get too far away from your goals

Foods Database! I tried multiple dieting apps before settling on this one. They all have their strengths but this one has the most complete and most accurate database of foods. I have learned that is the most important feature of these apps. In eight months of daily use I have found only three foods with an error. The only three foods I didn‚Äôt find were from Costco, which carries custom versions of products. But almost all Costco foods have been in the database. I have lost 42 pounds since switching to this app, which is exactly on target for meeting my goals.

Notifications are whack This app is great. It helps me so much with tracking my calories as well as goals. And I am so appreciative of that and all of the other great features. Unfortunately, I had to turn notifications off because they don‚Äôt work properly. I get a notification for every meal saying ‚Äúyou haven‚Äôt logged your meal‚Äù. However, most of the time I actually have logged my meal. So, it‚Äôs annoying. It would be helpful in the event I actually forgot to log a meal, but I can‚Äôt stand unnecessary notifications. Hoping this gets resolved so I can use the notifications in the event I do actually forget to log a meal.

Great app I have been using the app for over a year using the premium version. I really enjoy using this app to track my food intake.  Great articles & videos to help you with learning more about food, exercise & more.  App works great on the iPhone & iPad. Also like how it sync with Apple Health app & Activity app. I have had some challenges with the recipes downloading but eventually get them to work. For the app, under the food diary, I wish the column that are titled Calories, Carbs, Fat, etc were static so as you scroll down.  I always have scroll back up to remember which column is which. Hopefully that can be a future update.

Love the app, wish it wouldn‚Äôt crash so often I‚Äôve become very fond of this app over the past few months. It takes the guesswork out of weight loss and puts you in control of all the factors. My only complaint is that it crashes all the time when I‚Äôm using the computer version of the app. This usually happens when I‚Äôve pressed the ‚Äúquick add calories‚Äù button, but it happens other times too. Sometimes I‚Äôll try to start the app on my computer and there‚Äôs a message for several hours that the app is down. I really wish they could fix this problem, because it‚Äôs a great app.

Great for casual weight loss I downloaded the app to help track my exercise and calories while I tried to lose a few pounds this summer.  I was pleasantly surprised by how easy and comprehensive it was.  It has a very large searchable list of foods and a barcode scanner that makes logging meals take seconds.  I don‚Äôt yet fully understand the calorie adjustments but after using the app for 2 months I can say that it really helped me manage what I ate.  For someone like me who‚Äôs just wanting to lose a little weight or gradually get onto a healthier life style, the app is really helpful.

Really works! If you are willing to take the little time it takes to enter what you are eating each day, this app makes losing weight easy. By giving you nutritional information, you can make better choices before eating a meal that throws your calories and nutritional values over the allotted amounts. You still have to decide to eat healthy foods and it helps to add exercise into your lifestyle. But after years of trying to lose weight with no success, I‚Äôve lost 24 pounds in about 6 1/2 months. I highly recommend this app. It really works!
Love it!!! Love this app!  I‚Äôve used others with no real results in weight loss. I‚Äôve seen results in just a week already!

Riddled with bugs - not worth the $9.99/month I only gave it one star because there‚Äôs no option for zero stars. Over the past three months of use, this app continually doubles up my macros and calories in Apple health which affects other apps I‚Äôm using to track my health. This seems to happen on a completely random basis. After submitting multiple reports to tech support I only get a generic reply back thanking me for my feedback and someone will be in touch. Apparently MFP developers have known about this since October 2017 and still haven‚Äôt fixed it. Requires the user to continually double check Apple health data against what is reported in MFP. This app is garbage at the moment and not worth the 9.99 Per month. If you are going to charge me for it, at least make the thing work. Very disappointing.

Glitchy There are some great features to this app, like its extensive database, ability to save meals, and import recipes. Unfortunately it‚Äôs also glitchy and quits communicating with its own server, as well as apps connected to it. The result is a lot of wasted time and data trying to reload the app, log back in, wait for the database to connect again, etc.

Need improvements in nutrients elements list I like this app but I hope they can add more micronutrients like vitamin E, D , zinc, copper, etc‚Äî a more complete list so that we can take them into consideration for food choices. I believe many user would want that. A balanced diet is really important, and  not just those listed necessary elements are enough.

Good app, becoming user-hostile I‚Äôve been using MyFitnessPal for half a decade, and have been a paying customer for several of those. It‚Äôs a solid app which does its job well. However, the most recent release‚Äôs constant pestering about providing fine-grained location services is very user-hostile: if a user tells the app ‚Äúno‚Äù, they should not be prompted again the next day about it. I don‚Äôt want to give that data and don‚Äôt have any use for the features it might enable.

Food count is great other then that confusing. The food app is the best. Although, it randomly stops counting calories and then switches to this confusing negative calorie system they use. When I first started using it, it would count my steps and deduct the amount of calories my steps accrued. It just simply stopped doing that. I have read EVERY instruction they have to offer. I have emailed them as well. It also says it is reading it from my phone. I have switched to me Apple Watch (with cell service so I do not need my phone) several times but it still says ‚ÄúiPhone.‚Äù I am thrilled with the food count. I will continue using it for that and that alone.

Extremely satisfied This is the best dieting app out there. If you are struggling to follow any diet counting macros then this is the app for you! And it does it all for you, you get to type in your goals and then the app will tell you your allotted calories for the day, which can even go up with exercise (and by counting your steps). All you have to do is type in a food and it will take down all of the food‚Äôs nutrition facts itself and you can look at where your macros are at throughout the day. This app has been extremely helpful to me for reaching my fitness goals.

Liked it better before UA bought them. I liked the app more before it was sold. You had more functionality on the Free version and you just had to deal with ads. You could customize your macros more and now you have to pay way too much for it if you want to the same thing you use to be able to do for free. You could print the reports, etc. Even the newsfeed was better before. And now I get notifications 2 hours after logging my food that I haven‚Äôt logged my food yet.

Daughter introduced me to app MyFitnessPal is great!  It‚Äôs relatively simple and intuitive.  I mentioned to my daughter my concern about getting so out of shape because of bad knees.  My doctor suggested swimming laps for cardiovascular exercise and to also do strengthening exercises that don‚Äôt hurt my knees.  I‚Äôve been doing that for about three months, but still need to manage my food and nutrition.  The programs I looked at didn‚Äôt appeal to me, but this app was perfect!  I‚Äôm switching to a more nutritious diet that I like and am figuring out how to reduce unnecessary calories with the help of MyFitnessPal!  And they give great recipes!
MyFitnessPal makes tracking food- super easy and fun A friend of mine told me about MyFitnessPal App and how it helped him lose a bunch of weight, so I figured I'd give it a try.
Somethings wrong and buying pro did not help Until today I would have rated 5 stars. Something has gone terribly wrong with this App

Love the database, need keto options! This app had helped me to lose 100 lbs once! It‚Äôs brilliant and the database is the best I‚Äôve found in order to quickly and accurately track food. Now that I‚Äôm diving into keto meal planning , I hope the development team can put the following into play - 1) net carb tracking [carbs - (fiber + sugar alcohols)] 2) sugar alcohols as a diary item to chart 3) one time purchases for some of the premium options so not all items are  attached to the subscription option. I‚Äôd be willing to pay for some add ons vs paying monthly to unlock all options temporarily.

Cheat Day Feature I love my fitness pal, it‚Äôs the easiest app to use regarding calorie counting and weight loss, that being said though, I think having a cheat day feature for all users (not just premium) would be amazing!! Often times when I‚Äôm at a party or family gathering, tracking my calories takes the fun out of whatever we are celebrating, at the same time, I don‚Äôt want to lose my streak. Having the option to check off if you are having a cheat day while not affecting your streak would be the perfect addition for this app!!

Constant crashing, obstacle course support I‚Äôd been using this for years with no problems. When I started using the apple health app there were some sync bugs, but eventually they got worked out. I stopped using this for a year is so and now using it again. The app constantly crashes on my iPhone X to the point it‚Äôs become useless. I don‚Äôt lose data if I get it in fast enough before it crashes.

Pros and Cons I actually love the app for ease of use to look up specific items and to be able to enter the proportions quickly. I love that it saves your data to make it even easier moving forward. What I don‚Äôt like is that I can‚Äôt label and create as many meals as I want. So the meals that are not ‚Äúbreakfast‚Äù ‚Äúlunch‚Äù and ‚Äúdinner‚Äù I have to add all to ‚Äúsnacks.‚Äù I am a competitor. I eat 5 meals a day but at some point it may switch to 6 or 7x a day depending on my competition schedule. I‚Äôm currently looking into other apps that would work better for my scheduling at the moment. Hoping to find something that‚Äôs as user friendly as this app but also can be adjusted to meet my needs.
This helps a lot Love the app. Gave it 4/5 only because I wish there was multiple levels of accounts. The premium seems too expensive.
Good, could be great!! App is very useful to track calories and nutrition.  A few suggestions to make it even better:

Email already in use vs. email doesn‚Äôt exist. Endless loop I have used FP several years ago and really liked it.  Recently I downloaded the app again and was looking forward to using it but when I tried to log in it says ‚Äúemail doesn't exist‚Äù.  So then I tried signing up again and it says ‚Äúemail already in use‚Äù.  The ‚Äúforgot password‚Äù  button is of no help. I went to the website and tried to contact customer service but guess what.....you have to log in first.  I would love to use this app but they have created an endless loop which you can not escape if you have signed up in the past.  And no, I won‚Äôt create a new email just to use this app.  I can‚Äôt positively rate an app that won‚Äôt let me use it.  If they can get me past this, I‚Äôm sure my review would be glowing.

Bugs and incorrect information Great concept, executed well in some areas, but can be frustrating to use when creating recipes and tracking food. There have been bugs when syncing the app with the Fitbit tracker that render it useless until they resolve, which usually takes days. I find that nearly every time I scan a barcode to log food or create a recipe, the information is inaccurate. I‚Äôm not sure if this is because MyFitnessPal doesn‚Äôt know how to enter the information or because they allow users to ‚Äúcorrect‚Äù nutritional facts and most people are stupid. You‚Äôll want to review each entry carefully before saving. If MyFitnessPal could clean up their nutritional database and permanently resolve the syncing issues with Fitbit, it would move my rating to a five star.

Obsessed I'm not much for calorie counting. I actually think it'd ridiculous. As long as you're eating real food you're fine. However, this is AMAZING for being self aware. I exercise about 4 times a week and then I eat in excess. This just helps me to understand how much food I am putting in my body. Most times I cook and eat without thinking about how many ingredients there are, or how many crackers are in a serving. I love this app. And I love tracking my exercise and feeling good about the fact that I can eat more. :-) I have recommended this app to ALL of my friends.

So slow... I used to love my fitness pal! It helped me lose 30lbs about 2 yrs ago. But now, it‚Äôs so freaking slow and sluggish when running. The app will freeze, not respond, slow down incredibly, and crash all the time.. it‚Äôs to the point that I know I can only be on it for about a minute at a time before it‚Äôs will slow down or freeze. Not to mention it‚Äôs been making my phone heat up on the back when it‚Äôs in use when this app has never made my phone do that before. And I‚Äôve noticed when the app slows or freezes, it causes my whole phone to slow or freeze even when I have cleared the app from running or being open. It‚Äôs super frustrating. I hope the makers fix this huge issue soon.

Good for looking at macros but to many bugs!!! I am a pro member or i was. This app Is only good for looking up the nutritional information but, good luck trying to track your macros because this app Is always changing my specific set macros and It makes It very hard to keep track of them when they are all over the place. The app also has a minor bug to where anytime I‚Äôm trying to figure out the correct measurement of food for my macros It will not adjust the measurement after i change It a couple times so i have to restart my phone and pray that It works because, half of the time that doesn‚Äôt fix the problem. Please fix this because this app would be 5 stars if It did what It was designed to do.

author_name: Really want to use this app
review_body: On The Fence üòê..... Wish I could rate this app at 5 stars. Let me start by saying I Love this app. It has helped me tremendously in tracking what I eat and also losing & maintaining my weight. Just recently it has logged me out and will not let me log back in! Upon my several attempts to log back in, it said that either my email address is incorrect or my password is incorrect... both of which I made sure WERE correct. Upon my additional attempts to log back in, it said that it‚Äôs unable to connect to the server... this has gone on now for almost two days.

My fitness pal I used this app a few years ago and now have recently returned.  It has a huge database of foods, but you have to be careful when logging as many of those choices are provided by users, who may or may not have exercised diligence when measuring.    It is best to do your own measurements and create recipes for your use.  This is a lot of work in the beginning, but increasingly less going forward.  I also like the reminders to log in, which is optional. And... it is free!  I wish you could see the nutrient breakdown by ingredient, but that is only done as a running total of all eaten that day.

Current version, 19.8.0, is buggy I keep getting logged out of the app. Each time I open it to log an exercise or meal I‚Äôm forced to sign in again. Love the app and this is the first time in 6+ years that I‚Äôve encountered any real issues with it. The two stars are for this version only and not indicative of the app as a whole.

Key to weight loss! I‚Äôve been using this app for nearly a year and have done quite well... almost 50 pounds, now! No more work that is typically necessary for food documentation! The app does it all! The search has every food imaginable and even includes restaurant foods. Since I carry my cell on me 24/7, it‚Äôs easy to log my meals and snacks, sometimes AS I‚Äôm eating to encourage more chewing üòä For me, I‚Äôve learned that the key to weight loss is NOT dieting, but a lifestyle change that still includes splurges here and there. It‚Äôs not how much I eat, but WHAT I eat. Major breakthrough!

Don‚Äôt waste your money!! I‚Äôve been a member of MFP long before UA came to the table. Back then it worked great. Now? It is constantly one issue after another. So many bugs. ALL the time. Your answer? Uninstall and reinstall. Why is it MFP is the ONLY app I have in which I‚Äôm constantly deleting and reinstalling. Why can‚Äôt y‚Äôall get it to work properly all the time?
Fantastic app to encourage and help achieve your goals ! EASY TO USE !!!! FUN !!!!
Great App, Just One Suggestion Love the app, been a big help in developing healthy habits.

Love this app but... I would 5-Star this app but my Fitbit sync is really glitchy. Sometimes it subtracts calories based on steps/exercise sometimes it doesn‚Äôt, even though I burned over 1500 calories or more.  It shows the amount of steps but not the adjustment. If I have the app running too long my phone gets too warm.  If these problems were fixed I would 5-Star it. I will probably never upgrade to premium either so it is annoying to see that asked everywhere. I think the price for premium is a ripoff. Just saying.

Borderline Unusable I have used MFP for several years but I have to say the quality of the app has gone way, way done since Under Armour bought it a few years back. Since then the app often has a lot of trouble Loading anything because it is always loading adds (for UA crap) or special blogs that no one wants to read. Just simply logging a cup of water can take 3-4 minutes. Good luck if you had a dinner with multiple ingredients.

Great app I love this app! This app has an exhaustive list of foods so it‚Äôs easy to track what you‚Äôve eaten. Especially for me as a vegetarian who eats a lot of Indian and other ethnic foods, it‚Äôs been hard to tell how many calories I‚Äôve had, but this app is great and makes it so easy to stick with dietary goals. And I love the newsletter it emails to you because it chock full of awesome nutritional and fitness advice. This app also tracks the exercise you do and daily steps, etc. So many good features. Anyone who seriously wants to make a change would benefit greatly with this app!

No happy I‚Äôve bern using this app for a few years now. Since May I‚Äôve been really strict with it, losing 22 pounds. Then your app started constantly asking me to log in. Every time I did it, it claimed the password was wrong. Which I always write down and has been the same for a while now. I‚Äôd have to reset it. Which I‚Äôd type in the one I always use. While... once again it asked me to log in. Once again it declined my password. Only this time! It. Lost. Every. Diary log in! So now I have had to start from the beginning. Type all foods in. And the app no longer syncs with my workout app. Awesome! Thanks!!üò†
There‚Äôs something wrong with prediction of future weight I actually really like the program but noticed there is an error in how it calculates future weight if ‚Äúevery day was like today.‚Äù

Awesome App This is great app!  It allowed me to get back to my college running weight without doing ANY exercising!  Pretty cool, I just tracked my food, kept to my nutrition goals, sat on the couch and the weight came off! Once I got my weight where it was back in high school (I‚Äôm 55 years old now), I decided I needed another goal so I don‚Äôt gain the weight back.  I‚Äôve decided to start doing Spartan obstacle course races.  Now that I‚Äôm back off the couch, I track my exercise through Fitbit and it auto syncs to MyFitnessPal, adjusts my calories as needed, and I‚Äôm maintaining my high school weight.  Pretty cool!

Couldn‚Äôt have done it without you! I have been overweight my entire life! At 33, 5ft tall, 205lbs, size 18/20 I realized it was time for a change. After a year Of eating right and exercise I had lost most of my weight. I was at 156, at a stand still. I needed something more. I discovered MyFitnessPal. ‚ù§Ô∏è it has helped me stay on track and get down to my goal weight! I am proud to say after 2 years of faithfully logging into MFP, I am now at 132lbs, a size 6-8! I have successfully kept the weight off and believe I could not have done this without MFP! So, thank you MFP! üòò

Finally understand calories I have never understood calories and intake of them. I‚Äôve tried to loose weight but just couldn‚Äôt believe a salad with dressing is so many more calories then a reasonable dinner.

Thank you! A friend of mine recommended the app. I have not worked out seriously for over eight years. I still haven‚Äôt picked up a weight but when using this app it makes you see the actual calories you consume and is eye opening. I have used the app for only a week and have lost 7lbs. I‚Äôm a big guy to begin with and not very active but the app helps you see what you consume and drink. My problem was I was drinking a lot of my calories which I have cut out a lot. Thanks to my friend and the staff behind myfirnessapp!! Hopefully I can keep it up!

Great I came into issues on my first day of starting my new fitness program and needing to use this app. It took hours to get it resolved. I was stressing out, because it was my first day of my program and I needed this app. It did get resolved though. Help will come, you just might need to wait longer than you may like. However, the actual is fantastic, and I‚Äôm for sure getting the premium membership. I would like to see the ability to save a list of foods that I typically eat. You can view your history, but only so far.

easy meal entry, buggy sync myfitnesspal is by far one of the easiest apps for quick meal entry, but unfortunately my experience the past few months has been plagued with bugs. I‚Äôm constantly running into ‚Äúunable to sync, saving data locally‚Äù errors, which usually seems to result in meals being saved multiple times (imagine my surprise to see I consumed 10,000 calories one day for lunch). Also, since the release of iOS 11 update I‚Äôve had issues with data being saved multiple times to Apple Health (even after I‚Äôve cleaned up duplicates from sync errors). Hopefully these errors can be addressed, in the meantime I‚Äôll not be renewing my premium membership while I‚Äôm looking for a replacement app for MFP.

Love this app I normally don‚Äôt write reviews but I just had to i went from 175 to 165 to 155 and I‚Äôm still going I‚Äôm 18 and 5‚Äô1 very over weight even though I don‚Äôt look like it but I had to make a change I noticed that I was eat a lot and this app helped me with my eating habits and helped me keep track of my exercise and calories I‚Äôve tried everything to losing weight and finding something to stick to but this app just makes it so much easier I might upgrade from the free version to the paying version but I‚Äôm really not sure yet

Just wonderful. I think the advantages of MyFitnessPal compared to other weight loss apps are the user-friendly nature of the design and the size of the database - the barcode scanner is one of its best features. It really helps make the process of tracking your food less monotonous. While I don‚Äôt read the articles very often, the ones I have read seem like they would be very helpful for someone who is new to weight loss or calorie-counting. I really enjoy using MFP and I hope it doesn‚Äôt change too much in the coming years!

Stay consistent and this will make a difference! Seriously this app changed my life! Just paying attention to what I eat and tracking everything makes me feel in control and has helped me lose over 30 pounds. You just have to stay consistent and it will help you! I don‚Äôt do any of the social part of the app but my dad does and he loves it, I‚Äôm a more private person so I just keep it to myself. This app is super user friendly and helpful, I put all my meals in here and it makes it super easy to stay on track with my macronutrients.
Why is this app going bad. ?? I have had this app for a while now maybe like 2 1/2 years And haven‚Äôt had any problems until this year..

Great for tracking your food input This was a 5 for me, but now it is a 3. I have used this app for several years. I have always liked it and that it linked to Fit Bit. However, when I lost my Fit Bit recently and upgraded to Fit Bit Versa it no longer connects. Both the apps say they are connected to the other, but no data is exchanged anymore. It is a pain to use the Fit Bit Versa to log my food intake and I have always relied on this My Fitness Pal to log my food and water intake daily. Please help me resolve this problem, as I do not want to lose all my current 37 lb. weight loss data, by deleting this program and reloading it.

I used MFP every day! The app itself is great. I have yet to not find an item when scanned by the barcode. It‚Äôs great to see everything in a single column as well as have the tracker for macros up top. The only thing that makes me give this app 4 stars is the lack of the ability to track NET carbs. It‚Äôs a huge pain to have to go through each meal at the end of the day and calculate what I‚Äôve really had. Especially on a day when I may have a Quest bar or something else really high in carbs but also high in fiber or sugar alcohols. I really figured by now MFP would have this as a standard option in the app.
Pretty good but annoying problems First off, I did lose 60 pounds with this app, so it‚Äôs not terrible. The database of foods is pretty extensive and it‚Äôs pretty easy to use.

A Wonderful (But Buggy) App I‚Äôve been using the ‚ÄúPremium‚Äù version of MyFitnessPal for a year. I log in every day to log my food and weight. I use it to keep track of common meals and recipes. Ultimately I have found the service incredibly helpful with my training, but I regularly run into bugs and other quality issues that seem to go unaddressed:

Pregnancy I have been an avid user on and off for years. The day I found out I was pregnant I committed back to using it to maintain a healthy pregnancy and track what I‚Äôm eating in case of any complications to report to the doctor. I love this app and it helped me my entire pregnancy and now will help me lose the minimal weight I did gain. My one complaint about the app, is that it does not have a way to report you‚Äôre pregnant to take additional calories into consideration. Also post pregnancy needs to consider breastfeeding mamas. They can easily update that and should.

Absolutely amazing ‚ù§ This app is so simple to use and has everything I could ever need! I've been logging meals, water, weight, and exercise for 85 days in a row now and thanks to MyFitnessPal I'm down 20 lbs! I had no idea how much I was overeating until I started logging my meals/snacks.

Good tracking app, could be better! Been using this app for several years on my journey to a healthier lifestyle. I‚Äôve lost 25lbs tracking calories and macros. This app does a really good job documenting your food intake with the diary by meal and for the day. I love the barcode scanning feature. This app lacks the ability to share recipes which is frustrating for my wife and I. We find and create recipes to use in the future. Once loading them into ones app it is impossible to share with each other or with friends. This would be a big improvement and win for users.

Messy Syncing between multiple UA apps and gear Syncing between the Gear Tracker, US Record app,MyFitnessPal, MapMyRun, and MapMyRide IS A COMPLICATED MESS.  especially if you are trying to log on with the computer (desktop mode) vs mobile mode / my phone (where I can't "add workouts" or "add miles" to my Gear Tracker if I use my running shoes for a jog without using the app at the same time.)  I had multiple accounts / multiple identities depending on which app or tracker i used at which time in my life and on which device over the last few years.  I asked for help in consolidating these accounts and streamlining the issues four times and customer service via email was never helpful.    it is a mess.  After finally deleting all connection to UA apps, my frustrations have disappeared as well.

Only Thing That Works for Me I have tried loosing weight over the years through a variety of different ways-without long term success. I have been using My Fitness Pal for a few years now. IT WORKS!! Finally. Thank you.

Seriously best app! I‚Äôve never counted calories before I‚Äôve only ever counted carbs and exercise to work out. I started using this app to help keep track of calories and carbs 10days ago. I got on the scale this morning and I‚Äôve lost 5lbs! I love how if I‚Äôm wanting to be bad I can look up how many calories are in what I want and it will keep me from eating it because i see it‚Äôs not in the amount of calories I have left for the day. I highly recommend this app for anyone over weight and struggling with weight loss and wanna track ur calories to help you.

Decent for what you‚Äôre asking for I wanted an app that counted calories for me and was able to scan barcodes to enter nutrition info. This app is fantastic for that, and I‚Äôve been pleased with the free version of it. It‚Äôs been a nice, comparable app to the weight watchers. The reason for 3 stars is because it CONSTANTLY CRASHES. Every single time I open the app, I have to restart it after entering one item in the diary. If it didn‚Äôt crash constantly, and counted the accurate number of calories I burn during workouts, it would be a solid 5. I hope they improve both of these things üôè. Aside from those two things, I‚Äôve been a mostly happy user. Thanks üëçüèº
Lots of options but limited portion sizes Pros:  easy to use, nutritional values given, weight graphs, lots of helpful articles

Average Calories Can you please add options to see average calories eaten for the entire month or year? That‚Äôs the only reason why I knocked a star off. That‚Äôs one of the main things I need to see. Cause when I backslide the entire week gets thrown off but if I could see the entire month or year, I can see that it wasn‚Äôt a major mistake and get back on track. 7 days goes by too quickly for a daily average. Hope that makes sense. I just want mistakes to be factored into the average too because the body counts those. At least my body does. It doesn‚Äôt ignore a single calorie!

Was a huge fan until Apple Watch I diligently used this app with Map My Fitness to lose and maintain a 32 pound weight loss.  Then I got an Apple Watch mostly so that I wouldn‚Äôt have to carry my phone when working out. I use the My Fitness Pal app from the Apple Watch. Immediately had problems with synching the app from the watch to Map My Fitness which creates a problem synching Map My to My Fitness. Without the exercise component the hassle of calorie counting is not worth the effort.

Found a bug (I think) I created a bunch of workout routines to follow that I got out of a book. I‚Äôm entering the weight and reps as I‚Äôm doing them, so I‚Äôm constantly putting the phone down to do my lifts or whatever, then picking up my phone to enter the data. A little over halfway through the workout and the app resets back to the launch screen and everything I‚Äôve entered is gone. I don‚Äôt know why this keeps happening.

Great app! This app is so great as a food journal! 5 stars for that! I love that you can sync it with your Fitbit. I love that it tells you how much you‚Äôll weigh in 5 weeks as you log every day. The only negatives I have about this is sometimes it won‚Äôt sync with my Fitbit app. Another problem I‚Äôm experiencing is in iMessage. When I use the little widget and try to send a friend what I logged for the day it says I haven‚Äôt selected anything to send even when I make sure everything‚Äôs selected. Other than those 2 problems.. this app is so helpful. I‚Äôve lost 35 pounds since I started using it. Lost 80 so far.

See for improvement options! Works great, would be awesome if it had a way to find healthy options at restaurants by using the search for food option.   An example would be if you were going to grab something at say McDonald‚Äôs,....(I know) currently it gives the full menu. If you could have like ‚Äúsmart options‚Äù or something as a category along with breakfast, lunch, burgers etc that would be awesome. Then you could quickly see healthy options vs clicking thru the items to compare.

Premium option I downloaded the app because of all the positive reviews. Unfortunately, the free option doesn‚Äôt give me what I need but the premium supposedly does. They offer a free 1 month trial for premium but it doesn‚Äôt work. You select it, it does nothing. I contacted their customer service which has been 0 help. It takes them a 1-2 days to respond and when they do respond it doesn‚Äôt even make sense and you have to reply back, wait again for them to send an email saying please reply ‚Äústill need help‚Äù. I was nice and gave it 2 starts because I‚Äôm sure the software means well but their level of helping the customer is awful. Mind you, I am still unable to sign up for their Premium.

Lost 100 lbs! Lost 100 pounds and I credit it to this app. If you use this app and follow calorie restrictions you will lose weight. I can almost say that about anyone‚Äôs situation. The foods it offers are sometimes verified and it allows you to copy other peoples meals. It also gives you a very encouraging graph, macro pie charts, and various other simple ways to track your diet and fitness with personalized goals. I owe it al to this app and my life is more active, I‚Äôm happier, and I‚Äôve learned so much about myself. I recommend this app to anyone and everyone. Give it a try!

An okay app, could be better This app has helped me lose weight before and I am starting again after baby. I recently downloaded LOSE IT! and found their visuals more appeasing, and their goals interesting, and they also have badges and rewards for things MFP doesn‚Äôt which makes it more fun and inviting. You also don‚Äôt lose your days logged if you can‚Äôt log a day (like if you‚Äôre camping). Their premium also costs less, but you pay for some of the things that MFP has for free in their basic that I enjoy and use. Also, MFP connects better to my tracker than they do. So in short, if I could transfer my 5 years of MFP to LI! I would be theirs.

I love this app! I love it.. I've tried so many almost all of them. If you pay for the premium it's great. You can customize it how you like.. Like I have a lower calorie budget set on some days. It automatically sets the next day. I can set how many calories I want to consume at breakfast, lunch and dinner. It has a much larger food database then other apps which is super helpful. The food you can customize sizes. I really like the premium it works for me and my needs. Also I have it hooked up with my garmin so I add calories to my budget if I workout.

The app is slow and buggy This app makes it easy to get a general idea of calorie counts and macros for the day. However, the app is often incredibly slow to load. The ad bars and videos work 100% of the time, but the actual useful parts of the app (like the search and scan functions) often fail to return results on the first attempt. Also, many of the foods have incorrect nutritional information so one has to pay special attention when entering food. The ‚Äúreport error‚Äù functionality is useful except the search still finds the incorrect food instead of defaulting to your correction on the next log entry. All these things make the app incredibly annoying.

Issue resolved - thank you customer service! About four days ago I noticed that my fitness pal was no longer counting steps for my Garman watch so I tried reloading my fitness pal and Garman onto my iPhone and the two sides will no longer sync Garman says there‚Äôs nothing wrong on their end and I cannot get MFP to respond to me via email.

Useful but buggy interface This app provides an essential service for anyone trying to lose or gain weight, but it‚Äôs incredibly buggy and the user experience is janky even with core features like quick adding calories, changing your carbs:protein:fats percentages, and viewing your food diary across multiple days. It feels bloated by ads and frankly the UI and UX are just terrible for me. Perhaps it wasn‚Äôt always like this, but based on my last two weeks of consistent use I would recommend an alternative calorie tracker.

New interface is horrible! I have used the app happily for 5 years.   Through all the updates good or not so good, I‚Äôve not complained and eventually gotten used to it.  But the newest update is absolutely horrible.  You changed the interface to ALL BRIGHT WHITE!   Are you kidding?  In a world where almost every application offers a dark mode this is what you came up with? Remove ALL color, and make the screen so bright users are blinded when they open the app unless they dim the screen.  I see no other noticeable changes at all.  Under armor are you listening? The newest update is tanking your rating as we speak.  All 1 star ratings today mention the horrible new interface.  Please give us some color back.  The next update can‚Äôt come fast enough.

Helping me stay on track I love this app. I am on Jenny Craig and it‚Äôs so easy to scan in my food because all their food is stored in the database. Plus, when I stray, it helps me see the damage. For instance, did you know that just 7 tiny gummy fish are 130 calories?! My Fitness Pal knew, and now I can see how each tiny treat adds up to those weight gains we are prone to as we get older. And I especially love how when you close out the food diary at the end of the day, it calculates what you‚Äôd weigh in 5 weeks if you did the same thing every day.

Step/exercise counter severely flawed While the app does a great job helping you track calories consumed, the ‚Äústeps calorie adjustment‚Äù is SEVERELY flawed. I can understand the app trying to avoid double counting calories burnt via steps, but how can you explain this (as an example) - I had 10,000 steps over the course of the day, for which I received 132 calories (which in itself is severely low, but not the point), and then when I go in to add 350 calories burnt doing cardio (for which I DID NOT have my phone in my pocket - so no steps counted), it immediately erases all the calories from steps during the day. I am just about done using this app since the steps calorie adjustment is completely flawed and outright useless.

Not syncing exercises I like this app more than other meal tracking apps because it‚Äôs easier to find foods and input them, as opposed to other apps where I have to put everything in manually. It‚Äôs not as stylish and sleek as other apps, but it‚Äôs most functional. However I‚Äôm currently having an issue where it is not syncing my exercises. I have the Nike Training app syncing my exercises to my Health app, which is currently sent up to connect all data with MFP, but MFP is syncing all of my steps and nutritional info, but not my exercises. It‚Äôs frustrating and I‚Äôve tried uninstalling and reinstalling and turning app permissions on and off but still won‚Äôt work.

Apple and MFP miscommunication. I rarely give such low star reviews as I really like the app in general; however, MFP and Apple really have communication issues. I have a 3rd gen Apple Watch that I wear everyday and I make sure to use it during my workouts I have turned on the health app to share the data with MFP and it still will not work. I get no credit for all the exercise that I do, only the steps go but even then I get no credit for the calories burned during my walks and reaching my step goals. I don‚Äôt want to buy another device just so it can communicate properly with the app. If it gets fixed I will definitely update my review and give it the 5 stars I think it deserves but right now I just can‚Äôt.

Wish it had more strength exercise choices Two things: there are very limited choices when doing strength exercises, so I have to make up my own and save them. I can monitor my calories burned while I‚Äôm working out with my Fitbit, so I wish I could just pick ‚Äústrength training, 30 minutes, so many calories.‚Äù

Surprisingly Convenient, Habit forming and helpful I haven‚Äôt been much for counting calories or tracking meals, mainly because of the inconvenience. I had been recommended this app by several people and so I recently decided to give it a try, with low expectations. I was surprised at the variety of foods that were programmed in and I just had to type it in. Very quick and easy to use. It also keeps track of my macros. I have been using it for the past three days, and it‚Äôs really helped me become more conscious of everything that I eat. Great content for a free app, I hope to maintain this habit.

Not the best, not the worst, just what we‚Äôre stuck with This app is ok. When it‚Äôs not glitching up a storm it works alright. Ok range of food to search from. However, every week or two it all of a sudden decides that it is going to go into ‚Äúoffline mode‚Äù despite the fact that there is DEFINITELY a WiFi connection. It won‚Äôt let you search for any new food whatsoever. This is SO frustrating - especially because there is no fix. I googled the problem and apparently a lot of people have it. The only response from the app maker, however, is ‚Äúsorry, we are looking into it.‚Äù That post was from Aja rust of 2018 and as of April/May 2019 it is still doing it. I would choose a different app if I were you.

Recent update App was working perfectly before the last update.  Since the update it is not correctly recording my step adjustment.  I‚Äôve logged on the website directly to make sure the negative value box is checked and it is however now it‚Äôs reversing the value(-48) and adding it into the calorie count instead of subtracting it.  So I went back into settings and unchecked the box, saved, then went back in an rechecked, saved.  When I went back to the home screen not only was it still incorrect it actually went from -48 to a mysterious -936?  Very frustrating for someone who is new to dieting and relies on this app for help

Great free service, clunky buggy app I love MFP, but the app tries to do too much and does none of it well. It‚Äôs slow, crashes frequently, and offers less functionality than the desktop website. Ads take up way too much room. Plus, videos in comments either don‚Äôt load or play without sound. Mobile website is unusable, which makes app necessary for mobile access.

What‚Äôs up with the sugar alcohols?! It‚Äôs a great service, definitely better than others out there. Sometimes have to search through the many listings of the same food for one that seems remotely accurate. A cup of pecans doesn‚Äôt have zero calories, for example. And, more importantly, why is there a line item for sugar alcohols that is always zero? Many foods and/or recipe ingredients contain sugar alcohols. I am a type 1 diabetic and these are important for maintaining accurate blood sugar regulation. It consistently messes up macro calculations for those on certain diets and makes it difficult to accurately calculate net carbs. Would be very helpful if this were included.

Annoying ads This is the best food/meal tracker available...I‚Äôve used the free one for yrs and never had an issue...now I come back after not using it for months and there‚Äôs a ad right above my food logs üòñ I‚Äôm sure that was by design to get people to go ‚Äúpremium‚Äù but I don‚Äôt need any of the premium services so there‚Äôs no reason to pay a monthly fee for nothing...you should offer a ‚Äúpro‚Äù option for people like me that don‚Äôt need a monthly service...I‚Äôd happily pay that to remove that stupid ad but I refuse to pay monthly or yearly for it

User Friendly, Even For Beginners I was never interested in counting calories, but this app makes tracking my food and exercise intake easy and convenient. I also enjoy the premium features of reading recipes and seeing more nutritional info.

Great app I am new to MyFitnessPal and have started using it after witnessing my teen daughter losing 45 lbs in less than a year. She changed her eating habits and even cooks for herself even though she is a high school junior living at home. The program has taught her to understand the content of food, not just their calories. It has helped her embrace a healthier lifestyle, and she feels more confident about herself. I am enjoying the challenge of losing weight and being more conscious of the foods I eat. I would highly recommend this app/program to anyone.

No more weekly digest? I‚Äôve been using this app for six years and very recently, I‚Äôve been logged out of the app frequently, forced to sign in, and unable to access weekly digests anymore. It sends me to a sign in screen made for Safari or Desktop mode (even when I‚Äôm WITHIN the actual app) and throws me a banner to use the app to easily sign in....even though I‚Äôm already in the app.

Happy to be a member! I joined Jenny Craig for one month to try to start losing weight. I went into that program weighing 194.6 lbs. I went down to 186.6 lbs. I just ended the program this past weekend and decided that I have enough knowledge on how to eat more healthy and properly. I found MyFitnessPal on my app and decided to join. I just did my weekly weigh in and I‚Äôm now at 181 lbs. This app is wonderful because when I track my daily consumption of food for the day. It informs me on what I‚Äôm doing right and where I have to improve. I love this program!

This Works I am in my late fifties, and the weight is slowly drifting up. It doesn‚Äôt come off if I ‚Äútake it easy‚Äù on the food for a few days like it used to. So I gave My Fitness App a try.  If you are honest with recording what you eat and drink, and your activity, it works!  I‚Äôm very relieved that getting chunkier is not a foregone conclusion. But you do need the discipline to stick with it. So many ways to get blown off course. At least now I have a method that I know works.  And I really ate quite a bit, I made much better choices, esp about portion sizes.

DON‚ÄôT TRUST: Sold email on dark web! DO NOT DOWNLOAD or trust, read other 1 star reviews like mine. This company deserves the boot from Apple store. Do not trust this company or it‚Äôs security/privacy agreement. I received my monthly credit alert from my credit card company which monitors the dark-web and World Wide Web (everyday internet) for my information that has been stolen or sold by hackers.

So many ads lately I‚Äôve been using MFP for about 7-8 years and I‚Äôve always appreciated the simple/basic interface and functionality. The app is much better than the website, but lately there have been SO many ads. Every time I try to log my exercise, in comes a pop-up ad. The past 6 or so months it‚Äôs become almost unbearable. I understand they need to compete and make a profit but I would appreciate more subtle or different types of advertising vs full screen pop ups. Otherwise it‚Äôs a great app and has a ton of foods and exercises in their library to choose from. I‚Äôve successfully lost 40+ lbs using this app.

DO NOT GET THIS APP Got an email a few days ago from my credit monitoring company (Intuit) saying that something is monitoring my internet usage. I look into the details of the report and it says they‚Äôve traced it back to my fitness pal account. Apparently this app/company had a security breech, which they never informed me of and my information was stolen. They had my email and a password that I used because I actually remember it. Now who knows who has that information and if they‚Äôre watching my internet usage then they could easily have loads of my personal information. Absolutely ridiculous. Not so much as an email sent to me. Instead I‚Äôm wondering why in the world I‚Äôm getting so much spam mail in my inbox. Lord know what else they‚Äôve got access to.

Lose weight, change your life I started using this app in August 2018 after seeing a guy on a talk show who lost like 100 pounds. They asked how he did it and he mentioned using the app. Since August 2018 I've lost 40 pounds by just logging everything I eat and exercising regularly. I can say that you'll never realize how much you eat until you actually log it in the app. Now the app is a regular part of my life so I didn't just lose weight but I changed my lifestyle. My blood pressure is down, my BMI is down and I feel great.

Great app for tracking I like that I can scan or manually input the food I eat and the time and type of exercise I‚Äôve done and it calculates for me the calories and energy spent it also give me a breakdown of my nutrients in my food it‚Äôs a great app. It also allows you to set goals and track your goals and calories use for the day versus what you have left to eat for the day a great encouragement to look forward to each and every day for self-discipline or join others within the app in your quest for healthy living.

Security breech Just received an email this morning letting me know that all of my information, email, password, profile info had been taken from their site in March. Every app seems to think they require your personal info to, in this case track your calories. If you don‚Äôt give permission then you can‚Äôt use the app as always. Once trusted with your personal information they can‚Äôt even keep it safe. This is happening in more and more cases. These companies as in this case say oops we messed up sorry. Change your passwords and hope for the best. Yet I notice this app is still up in the store with a 4.7 rating. Be warned this company doesn‚Äôt take keeping your personal information safe as a priority. Be very cautious about using this app!!

What are your developers doing all day?? Where did your developers go??? I use my fitness pal and map my run and both have had horrible bugs for the past 6 months. I‚Äôd rather not change to a new app and keep my data but at this point it‚Äôs now not letting me even login. I can‚Äôt login to my fitness pal and it won‚Äôt let me create a new account. Before this issue it would ask me to login every time i launched the app. That‚Äôs multiple times a day to enter each meal. Also, map my run freezes after running 3 miles and messes up my running stats and distances and I have to stop running so I can relaunch and log back into my app. I‚Äôve been using these apps for years I don‚Äôt know what happened, I can only assume your developers have left.

Frustrated. Could be so much better. I have never really enjoyed using this app, but it was at least functional and had a large database of food, even though those are user supplied. Now when I re-downloaded the app onto my iPad I was apparently signed up for the premium features, even though I have been a member on the site for the past 3 years and never elected to sign up for it. I was charged for an entire year of subscription and neither iTunes or myfitnesspal will refund it. So I tried getting some use out of the ‚Äúpremium‚Äù features, but I‚Äôm experiencing bugs, links that go around in circles and issues connecting to my Fitbit. Too simplistic and the UI is still wonky and the look as unattractive as it was when I signed up in 2016.

Keeps me on track I use this app to balance my food and my exercise. It‚Äôs very good for tracking both. You can import recipes, and it will calculate the nutritional value of a serving. Scanning food package UPC‚Äôs has never failed me. It brings up the nutritional content of processed foods. In addition, I really like the healthy food recipes that pop up on the blog. I send those to the Pocket app for reference. The font on this app is a little small, and sometimes it doesn‚Äôt respond to my touch on the interface. I know this is not related to my phone, I think it‚Äôs the speed of the app instead.

Okay, but much of the nutritional info is incorrect. The app works well with many devices and services. It is easy enough to use. However, the food catalog is a crazy mess. There are many inaccurate food items. You have to Google ‚Äúlarge egg‚Äù because only one or two of the umpteen entries have correct nutritional values. Researching every food item is really obnoxious, and it eliminates the usefulness of this app. It would be great if basic food items were easy to find AND nutritionally correct. Sure, allow customization for non-basic items, but it would be so much better if some entries were just easy.(and correct!)

A major gap in functionality for over a year I have been using MFP for over 3 years. A year ago I noticed when I logged an exercise activity through the apple activity app to MFP it would wipe out the step count for that day. After monitoring further, any exercise blocks all steps for that day and will remove all step not counted in a specific exercise thus I have lost 100‚Äôs of miles of steps over 3 years. I year ago i open a ticket with UA, followed up very 3 months. Never addressed, not time frame to fix it and ‚Äúit‚Äôs harder to fix than they expected‚Äù. Exercise is 50% of the function and to loose all steps for a day when one exercise is recorded is a major problem with core functionality. Leaving MFP after three years quite disappointed.

Absolutely love it! After having my son I gained 10kg (about 20lbs) and I wanna be at my weight again. I am so glad my co-worker introduced me this app. I use it for 80days and lost 5kg (about 10lbs). I love my healthy lifestyle, feel full of energy and much happier than before. The purchase $50/year is nothing in compare to the life change! I am saving money on food, I dont eat out, I prepare my food for the whole week and log in food every day to stay on track. Sometimes I feel tired of measuring and weight all the food but its worth it!!!!

LOVE THIS EASY APP! Committed to losing 10 pounds by starting this app. 3 months & 15 pounds later & still going strong with the help of this app. It has taught me so much about balancing my meals with the macro breakdown & broadened my perspective in relation to serving size & the content of food I use to fuel my body. The scanning function & extensive library make meal entry so easy! I recommend this app to anyone I know wanting to lose weight, lower cholesterol, track sugar intake, etc. Feeling stronger & healthier than ever & crediting the accountability & success I have achieved to this amazing app!

Calorie counting made easy Had started on Noom which is a very good app but after the free trial, it gets expensive. A friend suggested my fitness pal. It also makes it easy to record intake and count calories. Just recording everything we eat makes us make smarter choices and I don‚Äôt need the support of a group to keep me on this journey. Links to articles are helpful as well. This makes sense to get healthy without forking over a fortune. Will strongly recommend this to anyone looking to get healthier through their nutrition and exercise

Great app - subscription is costly This app is great. It knows the calories of most store bought goods and even restaurant menus. It can even scan bar codes for when you can‚Äôt or don‚Äôt want to look up a specific product. It‚Äôs a great way to keep track of where your calories are at throughout the day and the news feed keeps you encouraged to keep up the hard work.

Ads ruined this app I needed to track my macros for weight training and remembered using this app in the past so it was an easy decision. Now I‚Äôm searching for something else. Ads are completely understandable but they are now literally placed in the middle of every useful screen in the app. So much screen real estate lost and they now use shady UX design to try and trick you into clicking an ad. Not sure when this happened but I‚Äôm guessing it was when UA took over. So sad.

Buggy I love the idea of the app, the massive database and the engaged community here - the life style changes it brought to me is great. But the app itself is so poorly done.  Slowness, constant freezes, the limited function in notification list (eg. You can get push notification or email on ‚Äúsomeone commented on a post you comment on‚Äù, but you cannot find it in the Notification Center of the app - hence you can never go back to those post to interact withe people), there is no tag function, photo posting process is very not intuitive and very cumbersome... etc. and those bottom line performance issues seem never be the priority of the app improvement. If one day I stop using this app, it will be because I‚Äôm fed up with all the frustration it causes...

Is our data safe and secure? I've got an email form myfitnesspal pal saying that they've been hacked and someone stole usernames, emails, passwords, etc. Is it so hard to protect such database? Why then they ask for our email and not using our icloud or game center profiles... Apple shoud ban the apps, that require our emails. I'm using same password (since they require password everywhere these days) on all websites and online services and now I should go and change all of them which could consume a couple of days.

Disappointed. I have had this app for years and it helped me lose 20 pounds. However, in the last few months I have been experiencing issues. Every single time I try to open the app I have to log in. Then once I go through my FB I‚Äôm told that the server doesn‚Äôt match. Then it works the second time. It‚Äôs too much to have to log in twice just to use the app. I‚Äôve even opened another page because I thought maybe it was Facebook and I still experienced the same issue.

Good but starting to get annoyed I love this app. I have used it many times and is always my favorite fitness app. Yet, since the last update I have had nothing but problems. It logs me, won‚Äôt let me back in for hours, and even will not sync with my Fitbit. As of today I even could uses my scanner. I know that there might just be an issue here recently but I‚Äôm still irritated. Then when I do get log in, it deletes everything I‚Äôve had for the day. But then a couple hours later it comes back. I hope that the app get changed back because it used to be PERFECT.

Would be good I used to use this app all the time and it was a great tool for losing weight. Recently it‚Äôs been hard to use because of all the glitches and problems within the app. It‚Äôs not counting my steps right or turning my steps into exercise like it used to. I thought connecting my Fit Bit would help but it doesn‚Äôt even work. I have contacted help twice and they responded saying they have had so many complaints that they can‚Äôt get to everyone. Good concept but bad execution. They need to go back to what it used to be when it actually worked.

Great app for beginner My husband and I are just getting started using this app, it is user friendly so we have been able to get used to using it daily quite easily.  And we love that we can share foods and meals and the like.  The only thing I noticed is when we scroll through the food diary for the day, the bar that says ‚Äúcalories, carbs, fat, protein, sodium and sugars‚Äù disappears.  Sometimes I can‚Äôt remember which column is which when I am looking at the meals below it.  Perhaps that could be changed?

Good but has FITBIT issues Good app for tracking calories. It‚Äôs surprising how many different brands of foods it recognizes. A big problem for me is that the app constantly has issues with syncing with my Fitbit. It says it‚Äôs connected but it doesn‚Äôt incorporate steps and calories burned. It happens at least once a week. And it‚Äôs so annoying to have to disconnect all the apps and wait. Sometimes that works and sometimes that doesn‚Äôt. Wish they‚Äôd figure out the issue. There‚Äôs a whole trouble shooting section on their website which means it‚Äôs been happening for a long time but for some reason they haven‚Äôt found a solution yet.

Fitness Pal tracker Loving this app!  Tracking my calorie and carb intake is so much easier than I thought.  It‚Äôs keeping me accountable and in just one week I‚Äôm starting to see my sugar levels come down finally!!! I‚Äôve even lost 3lbs.  The app is so easy to use and I use the scan option frequently but most the food items are found under the options.  It also tracks your exercise and the calories burned! Confident Is incredible how it has a section where one can put their daily calorie goals and also MACRO goals. Is much funner plugin in meals this way. Another awesome feature is the section where you can add friends that way one can view each others Daily Diary on calories and foods consumed. Also the app is so reliable because is keeping track of everything while you just keep plugin in the foods you eat. You will get reminders when your about to surpass a macro or calories. amazingly designed I too much like food. Have been entering my eating data for over 3 months & am walking now, a different/better relationship-path-with-food. From someone who ate when he wanted & how much he wanted, to recording w/the MFP app & now tracking the daily calories...it is crazy man, to ‚Äúsee‚Äù the amount of calories in most of my easy-access-foods. When I discovered the MFP‚Äôs UPC scanning & then the library look-up features, the calorie tracking was even easier to enter. So thank you UA for the FREE, amazingly designed MFP app, j

Very useful This app definitely delivers on options. It‚Äôs complicated in the beginning, because you sort of need to program stuff in. I do wish you could share recipes with other users though, especially since it helps to have a buddy when you do this kind of thing. Solid app for tracking food and exercise I‚Äôve been using this app for about 9 months now and it‚Äôs ok.

Best food tracking app I‚Äôve used yet I want to thank the makers of this app, for making logging food that much quicker and easier. I have used spark people on and off throughout the years, but this app is alot more user friendly with more tools, it literally has everything I could want. I got my mom into it, and she‚Äôs using it and making progress too.
