Nearly everything is ‚Äúpremium‚Äù. I was looking for a decent app to track simple nutrition information. This app was recommended, but even the most basic nutritional information to track is locked down behind the premium subscription and makes it overall useless otherwise. I can‚Äôt even track the time I ate the food without subscribing. From the moment I opened the app I‚Äôm inundated with repeated reminders that all the useful stuff is a premium feature. It‚Äôs fine to have to pay for some stuff, but locking away 99% of tracking features is just bad. The app design is horrible and very unintuitive. It‚Äôs very confusing trying to find certain options. I ended up going with another app that has a small one time only fee.
What happened? Update- Thank you MFP people!!  You seem to have fixed the bugs! The app hasn‚Äôt locked up in a whole week of use!  Whew!  I‚Äôm so glad you figured it out. üíú

MFP needs some work I have used MFP on and off for years. I‚Äôve been successful in losing weight using the app. However I finally just gave up and switched to Lose It! I paid for MFP premium so I could set different goals for different days (1200 and 1500 cal/day). It didn‚Äôt update the calories and now every day randomly says 1290. I can‚Äôt change the calories now. This is one example of a multitude of glitches in the app that have come up over the years. The database, though extensive, has become overrun with erroneous user-entered foods. The user interface needs to be updated from the one they‚Äôve had for years. It‚Äôs time for MFP to clean up the app and improve the user experience.

So. Many. Ads. Yes, I have the free version so there will be ads. But it seems like there are more every day. I have to scroll through at least 10 between the first and second posts, and there are still more after every couple posts.
AWESOME Huge food database, barcode scanning is awesome and does really well keeping track of exercise! I've lost 9 lbs since using MFP. Best app!!

Lose weight, improve body composition This app is convenient and easy to use. It lets me keep track of the calories I consume while helping me better understand my macros. I've been using My Fitness Pal for 5 or 6 years and have lost weight and improved my body composition with the support of this app. Definitely recommend it.

Keeping Track The act of logging in what you eat each day makes you aware of exactly how much energy you are putting in your body and MyFitnessPal will show if you are burning that fuel off.  This act of logging what one eats makes the user aware of their eating habits, thereby enabling them to lose weight and improve their health and well being. MyFitnessPal is easy to use and has become a ‚Äúhealthy habit‚Äù of mine. I‚Äôm excited to be using this App and looking forward to learn more about my eating habits as I improve my health.

Can‚Äôt Log Food I downloaded this today and it my first day using it. Every time I try the search function to log my food I get a message on the top saying ‚ÄúOffline Mode‚Äù even though I‚Äôm connected to WiFi and cellular network. I‚Äôve tried disconnecting from WiFi and closing/opening the app again and still the same thing happens. Basically it‚Äôs main function is not working and I can‚Äôt use this at all so I see no point in keeping this app. It seems that others have had issues too and is a simple enough bug fix. Maybe I will check back in in a few months as I was excited to use this in my weight loss journey but was sadly disappointed.

Better than Weight Watchers Free Style I‚Äôve been dual tracking in WW and My Fitness Pal apps for a month. Today, I am over in points allowed and can still have another 332 calories in MFP. I‚Äôve lost my 2 pounds a week since tracking in MFP.

A good way to turn your habits around I started this app to be supportive to my boyfriend who was by doctors orders working on losing weight and change his eating habits. I first thought Àãwhat an overkill¬¥ but it quickly became fun to use. And I found just as quickly that I was having some bad habits too. Adding the exercise app to this one made it so much more fun. We now have a healthy competition going on, literally, and lost 2 pounds in the first week. I feel better, shop and eat more conscious. Great app to eat and live better

I love the app; however it could be better. I love everything about MFP except this one thing. I was logging my food and I got a low calorie reading for the item I was logging. So I checked several other apps that I subscribe to and they had different calorie readings also. So I decided to look the food item up on the website and it was higher than what MFP said in their database.  I know that apps claim that some foods might be slightly off but when the food is off by 10 or more calories...that‚Äôs a big difference when you‚Äôre serious about counting calories. If this can‚Äôt be fixed I might have to jump ship.

Dissatisfied Not as good as it was. The relationship with Under Armor has corrupted the app to the point it is more about social engagement and selling their gear. I paid for a subscription but the app pops up Under Armor advertising every time it opens. Every time. I have to click through adds to get to the diary.

Bring back the weekly overview A while back they took away my favorite feature. It was a weekly calorie overview with green bars that turned red once over the calorie line and then gave an average for the week.  I found it super helpful and kept me returning every day to make sure I was still on track.  Now I feel like it‚Äôs hard for me to quantify how I did in a week since I would have to go back through every day and do the math myself.  I can do it, but it was way more convenient before.  I‚Äôve used this app for years and love everything else about it.

Great app but doesn‚Äôt pair with iwatch ‚òπÔ∏è I have had this app (free version) for years and have always loved it! Recently Iv been looking for something new that pairs nicely with my Apple Watch and gives notifications. I found one which paired nicely and had an easy to read macro counter on my watch face (lifesum) which was exactly what I wanted, but the food tracker was very very inaccurate!! I deleted it and am back to MyFitnessPal. I LOVE this app here, but I really wish there was a visual friendly pairing option for the Apple Watch :/ I rate between a 3-4 stars. App is great but want more device options!

Truly Helpful Long story short... I had a brain aneurysm rupture, truly a life changer... I went from working out 4 times a week to dealing my short term memory being completely wiped out! So bad I had to learn how to walk and talk again! I ended up GAINING 70lbs! 2 years since I have been able to be active and have been using my favorite go to, MyFitnessPal, I have been able loose 45lbs! Now I may never be as small as I was before but my healthy aspect of life is getting better every day!!! Thank you for the ongoing support!

AWESOME I just cannot get enough of ALL the aspects of weight loss this app assists one with.  An excellent example is the Nutrition section.  This breaks down various nutrients in each food item you partake in.  It is incredible because it also provides a running total of each nutrient.  This is invaluable due to my need to keep a close eye on my sugar intake.  If I kept going about all the fantastic aspects of this app, I would end up writing a 1,000 page review.  ALL THIS FOR FREE?!?!?!?!?!?  You cannot beat this no matter how hard you try.

Great start up program application This is such a great tool to have when you're starting a fitness journey. You're able to hold yourself accountable for your food intake and you get to see the progress. Great for ppl like me, who are on the go and constantly eat snacks all day. I am able to plug into the app what I've eaten and how much water intake I have had for the day.

Feature rich app but it is a memory hog I have been using this app for the last week. It is flexible where I can either scan my meals or create my own. Also easy to share the meals with friends via iMessage which is super helpful. I would have given it a higher rating if it did not eat up so much memory. Using the app a few times a day brings my battery down to less than 30% on my iPhone 8!! After that it is excruciatingly slow. Tapping different parts of the app is unresponsive. I have to kill the app after every use üò†. I might have to find another app if the developer does not resolve the slowness.

Great App for FREE. Premium in app purchase Fail My fitness pal is probably one of the best health apps in the App Store. My problem is the **premium in app purchase** can‚Äôt be shared with my wife. (Family share) You would think at the very least they could allow two users to use it at $50 annually. They can. No way in hell are the upgrades so great that I‚Äôm spending $100 a year. Let me repeat that. The premium upgrades seem very flashy but honestly there are just a few that are helpful.  I‚Äôll go back to the free version. You almost had my $50 a year. Greedy market strategy. The EA of health apps. Some of us have families that live healthy lifestyles.

Unhappy with update MyFitnessPal used to show me me my macros for each food and meals in the food diary so I could track which macros I might need more or less of when meal planning.  Now I just have how many calories are left at the top on that page and the pie cart on the home page.  I want to see my macros again in the food diary without opening up each food and keeping track on a piece of paper.  Booo!  Don‚Äôt like this update.  This now gets one star..but the old one would get all the stars.

Needs a couple of tweaks While this is a great app in so many ways, I‚Äôd like to offer a couple of suggestions.  The hardest problem I have with this app is figuring out the calories in dishes I make.  The recipe calorie function is difficult to use and putting in the number of servings is something I constantly have to spend a lot of time figuring how to work it.  The other thing would be to have more information on adding in the exercise portion.  Maybe I am just missing it (that wouldn‚Äôt be a first),  but I would like to be more efficient with this.

Love it, but needs one more thing I love this tracking app.  I have been eating keto for quite some time and love how many recipes and items there are already in here.  The only criticism that I have is that it doesn‚Äôt track net carbs.  I know the math is really easy, I just don‚Äôt like the orange/red message that pops up when I input something that puts me over my total carbs, even while I am well within my net carb goal. It may seem silly, but it‚Äôs like a psychological reprimand.  Other than that detail this app is great

Keto Diet/Fitness PAL I‚Äôve always done the easy method with losing weight, diet pills, well now with being a newlywed and having a husband that LOVES to EAT, the pills stopped working...I have been on Keto for 7 days today and I feel fantastic! With the help of Fitness Pal I can log everything in (loving the scan barcode thingy) and make sure I don‚Äôt go over my calories, carbs, 0 sugar, just all of it is AMAZING!!! Thanks to my husband for the iPhone 11 Pro, it helps to gauge my steps and exercise. Hopefully I can get to my goal weight 140, he‚Äôll I‚Äôll settle for 149üòÇü§£üòÇ

A bit cumbersome to use I needed a calorie counting app to help me quit snacking and lose about 20 lbs. Couldn‚Äôt decide between this app and LoseIt so I used them both for a month. Entered everything in both places.

I keep coming back to this app I‚Äôve tried other apps, but myfitnesspal seems to have the most extensive suggestions for food from restaurants or homemade. I love their layout, it‚Äôs organized by meal and by macronutrients. There is the social aspect also, which means my family can all get involved despite living in different cities. The only qualm is I wish there were more comprehensive micronutrients and minerals that could be tracked, but even with this flaw I still choose it over others meal trackers.

Great app...but I have been enjoying this app very much as it helps me to stay focused pursuing my goals. But I travel a lot during the year and especially out of the country, even to places where there is no internet connection, like Cuba. The app doesn't work when there is no internet access and that limits my ability to keep up with my progress. You need to include the possibility to log in the foods of each meal
Positive motivation I really like this app because it helps me to stay on tract with the goals I have set for myself.

Love the scan feature!! There are so many options when you look for one food. Ex.- if I looked for carrots, the option would be: sauteed, raw, steam, carrots and broccoli and the list goes on. Mostly super helpful Overall this app is really great for tracking calories, and keeping yourself accountable. The only two things I wish this app provided (and keep in mind I do not have Premium) is: 1) more options in entering exercise, like group workouts, or cardio/strength combination exercises. Right now I don‚Äôt know how much I‚Äôm burning if I am doing a core strength class for example; 2) it would be cool to have a place to put in body measurements in addition to what you do, so one could track how many inches lost off of their waist for example. Other than that, super great app.

Functional app, but takes a while to use At least with the free version, there are no presets for common foods, so you have to manually enter all the nutrition info for a food, and when you scroll down too far, you can lose some nutrient info you just entered. Used to be a 5 Star App! Please fix the Apple Watch 3 / MFP synching issue. I need this capability and functionality badly!  I used to used MFP religiously...from meal tracking, to the challenges, the community aspect and follow some of the suggested recipes/workouts.  The app was always consistent and I never had any problems

Love this App!! Can not believe I haven‚Äôt been using this app, before- it‚Äôs fantastic!! Love how it tracks everything and makes calorie recommendations for your goals. It seriously keeps me on track. Imputing food is SUPER easy- being able to scan in items, even some pretty obscure ones. The recipe feature is awesome- I no longer have to ‚Äòbuild‚Äô recipes- it will import a recipe from any provided link, then you can go in manually and switch up/delete any ingredients for a more accurate count. Game changer!

Been Using for Years - Still Needs Work I have used this app for around five years now. I enjoy the fact that it syncs the data to HealthKit. I wish it would sync water consumption data with HealthKit as well

Male Weight reduction plan This program makes tracking calories so easy. As a professional fitness trainer that has trained U.S. Olympic and professional athletes, it‚Äôs a breeze and huge time saver.

Much improved over the version I was using 2 years ago I love this latest version (Aug 2019). It is so easy to make entries in my food diary and I love the feedback at the end of the day indicating how quickly I could lose weight if I kept up today‚Äôs pattern of diet and exercise. Useful but now an ad-fest, really too bad ‚òπÔ∏è Update: Another great app made worse by corporate ads. Now popup ads & ads in your food diary, very intrusive.  Ads in the other pages aren't so bad but having them in the food diary is really annoying.

Move nutrition button to top of page I like this app, but wish the nutrition button would be at the top of the screen, rather than having to scroll each time to the bottom of the page. Also, when scrolling from day to day to check foods eaten, breakfast, lunch, dinner and snacks, keep the page at the same designation rather that auto scrolling to the top. Enjoy a lot I like that it uses information from my Apple Watch and Fitbit to give me an accurate exercise calorie count. Also I like that it gives you the option how many pounds to loose I week and give you motivation at the end of the day saying if you eat like this in 5 weeks you will weight this many pounds. What I don‚Äôt like about it and maybe I just can‚Äôt figure it out but when I input my recipes I can‚Äôt figure out how to see the ingredients I used or edit after I save it so if I forgot an ingredient I have to re-enter the entire recipe over

Beware of the ‚Äúfree‚Äù trail. I have been using this app for a long time now but recently have been interested in giving the premium portion of the app a try. I finally decided I would utilize the 1-month free trial option before committing. When following the process of activating the free trial, I was charged for the monthly subscription right away. And lost my opportunity for the free 1 month trial. The app stated I would be charged either the monthly or annual amount AFTER the free trial was over. Unfortunately this is not the case and will be disputing. I will continue to use this app but will never give my mom to them again for ‚Äúpremium‚Äù

Friend Indeed I am not one that falls short when it comes to task oriented situations. I‚Äôm pretty organized and I follow through . Until it comes to my own personal life . I have the tendency to disregard myself and put me last in most things. And most of the time last doesn‚Äôt ever happen!

Great concept, Buggy and slow reality The concept of mfp is amazing and so helpful. I‚Äôve been using it for years. After my last pregnancy I got the app again and this time around it‚Äôs frustratingly slow and buggy to use. The desktop site works fine though. I would never consider going premium when the free version is barely functional. If mfp ever went full premium I would find another service, even if I had to pay for the alternative. If they ever figure out how to speed the app back up I think they will find many more premium customers...but it‚Äôs been months of this for me.

Almost 5 stars because.. Because I use this app strictly to monitor what I eat for my carb intake and sugar intake. I have pre diabetes and am trying to reverse it. I have multiple apps on my phone for my sugar and this is the only app for my food. It would be WONDERFUL if this app would connect to the sugar tracking apps like mySugr or one drop or others. From what I understand mySugr is the most popular? But in it you have to track your carb intake. If the two apps could collaborate and track the carbs together and the calorie intake and other stuff together that would be Amazing!

Helping me be aware A colleague of mine at work suggested I use this app and I‚Äôm loving it. That all he is is helping me keep on track and starting to lose weight but it also informs me about the nutrients and eating and how much fat and sugar is actually in food. I haven‚Äôt tried it the premium subscription am on the free one for now. It‚Äôs so easy to use and it lets you repeat common meals that you eat like I usually eat the same breakfast every morning so it‚Äôs easy to copy it and not have to re-enter the whole thing.

Never ‚ÄúUp to date‚Äù No matter what iOS it is, this app never seems to work correctly. I kept thinking that it was because Apple updated the iOS and the app hadn‚Äôt been updated yet, but every time I update to the current iOS, My Fitness Pal crashes. They put out an update. It still crashes, and sometimes more frequently, or (in the case of the current app version) it never even opens at all. I am tired of trying to use an app that is never available when I need it. I would think Under Armour could spare some of their millions to make the app work correctly, but I guess they spend too much money flying their helicopter between downtown Baltimore and BWI, and they can‚Äôt afford to keep up with the app.

Takes the guess work out of being healthy I love this app because it takes the guesswork out of being healthy along with its sister app that tracks your exercise and combines it for calories. The only thing I wish is that there was a spot for supplements. I currently put them under snacks even though most apps have a snack spot between each meal or a bunch at the bottom. I wish there was more than one snack option so I could keep track of when and why I‚Äôm more ironed to snacking.

Good overall, but something's missing for me. I've been using MyFitnessPal since I was 16 years old, and it's been a go-to. I love that you can connect your chosen fitness tracker to the app (mine is a Misfit Shine) and have all of your information there, simplified. The UI is also very minimal and not too busy. The only thing that is missing for me is one app: Nike+ Training Club. My fitness tracking device only tracks three types of physical activity, and it's an issue because I use NTC a lot! MFP would be the ultimate app if we were able to connect the two. Please consider it!

I Love It !! I wasn‚Äôt aware of how much damage I was causing to my body and health by just consuming too many calories per day and not drinking enough water throughout the day. This app has helped tremendously by helping me keep track of what I'm putting in my body and showing me a clear display of the nutritional content in a way that I can easily understand. I‚Äôve been logging every single meal for 30 days straight and I think I might be upgrading to premium pretty soon because it‚Äôs totally worth it !

Expand the age My mother and grandmother use MFP to loose weight, I‚Äôm 13 and according to them I eat too little and need to eat a little more and a bit healthier before it all catches up with me. I went to this app seeking help with keeping track, but you have to be 18 and I can‚Äôt change my age because that would change my calorie limit. I would love if you can expand the age limit and maybe have a different course (just staying healthy and active) for those who are under 18. Other than that it‚Äôs a great app and it‚Äôs working well for my family!

Caution I‚Äôm 15 and was once 225lbs. MyFitnessPal has succeeded in helping me lose 86 lbs and counting in less than a year but I want to warn people, especially teens that calorie counting becomes addictive. It‚Äôs s o easy to stem an obsession with logging every single little thing you eat and while it does work to lose weight and potentially become physically healthier, it‚Äôs not mentally healthy to become a slave to it. I will say though, that out of all the calorie counting apps MyFitnessPal is the easiest to use without a membership. Make good choices:)

I lost more weight than I thought I could! This app has been instrumental in losing first the nagging five pounds then since hat was easy, I went for 10 and got there. Then I was so close to my college weight I figured why not give it a shot. And it worked! LOTs of food items in the food diary and I started measuring food so I could enter it. It opened my eyes to portion size. It‚Äôs been 4 months that I‚Äôve kept it off (still entering food to the app to make sure I maintain). I hope to make it through the winter!

Love the app BUT I love this app and how easy it is to log foods. What I realize and the only thing I don‚Äôt like is how it adds the calories I‚Äôve burned in a workout to how many calories I have left to consume for the day. I feel like I‚Äôm not getting anywhere with my weight if it‚Äôs telling me to eat 1500 calories but at the end of the day I see I consumed 1700. Why make a calorie budget if you‚Äôre just gonna go over without even realizing your doing it because it add the calories that you burn to what you have left to consume.

Umm I like the app to a point.  This app says it will sync with Fitbit but it does not work right.  I have it setup to Count my steps This app states I walked 377 steps and burned -37 calories.  So out of my 2000 calories a day it now says I only have 1963 calories left.  Umm math is not right. It should have not been -37 off my calories per day but added 2037    Do not blame Fitbit. Fitbit has the numbers right. Another bug there are times that this add will not even add steps walked calories but has the steps walked.  I have use a different step app and it does the same.  I have also checked to make sure that all the app can talk to each other so my settings are good.  Definitely a bug in the program.

Great in Theory, GARBAGE Execution The app is great, and really the only legitimate option for calorie/macro tracking. However, the bugs are consistent in every single update, some of which are more than minor annoyances. With the most recent update, the app is freezing on my 6s just about every single time I add a food to the log (and it isn‚Äôt just me). It‚Äôs completely unacceptable given this app‚Äôs track record, and quite frankly, something that even highschool-aged programmers could fix. Couple that with the abysmal battery life draining, and it‚Äôs almost more worth your time to just track your macros by hand with some pen and paper.

Room for improvement Interface is not nearly as user friendly as the LoseIt app. The premise of the app is good but it‚Äôs frustrating to use. The free version only gives you access to half the screen while scrolling in diary mode. App is glitchy and freezes a lot. Any time you leave the diary page and come back, it scrolls all the way back up to the top, and you have to scroll down again. I‚Äôm constantly scrolling in this app. Can‚Äôt see macros on the main diary page. App defaults to home tab but diary tab is the most frequently used. It could be so much easier to use than it is

Most Helpful Fitness Tracker This app is seriously amazing. I was looking for a simple calorie tracker to help me slim down before the Holidays when I found this app through Reddit. It is so simple to use! To start you type in your height, age range, current weight, and your goal.  I recommend the ‚Äúone pound a week‚Äù loss rate. There is also a barcode scanning option to log food, which has been so helpful. I started on November 3rd and I am already one pound away from my goal! *My goal was to lose 5 pounds*

Keeping Track of Foods I am a senior citizen , who works out 3 times a week at a gym and walks briskly daily.  I do work out with a trainer once a week and she suggested that I keep a food journal so I can reach my nutritional goals.  I began keeping track online, which was very slow going.  My trainer recommended doing the same thing on my IPhone.  It was a lot easier!  I have lost 6 lbs, but now am fluctuating.  I am determined to lose about 5 more lbs, by making tweaks to my diet.  My Fitness Pal has been helpful to me with my calorie count and food portions.   Thank you for this app.

Lost 15 lbs using this I never ever wanted to be a calorie counter. But this app made it so easy that it‚Äôs just become part of my life. Setting up meals makes it easy since I usually eat the same 10-12 meals during the week. A few clicks and it‚Äôs in. I discovered I was eating about 200 cal too much a day. Cut back on a few things and in the last 8 months I‚Äôve lost 15 lbs. can‚Äôt believe it. Even when I don‚Äôt work out a calorie deficit is all it takes and this app makes the math easy.

Great App, could easily be better! This is a very useful app and has done wonders for me.  However, it has one frustrating flaw!  There is no easy way to delete foods out of your food diary.  If you make the mistake of logging one food from a specific restaurant that you may never eat again, it‚Äôs in your food diary forever.  The food diary gets so clogged up, it‚Äôs frustrating to find the foods you have eaten before and eat occasionally.  A simple swipe to reveal a delete button seems to be such a simple solution to this major problem!

Love it! I‚Äôve been using my fitness pal off and on for about 7 years and I really love it. I‚Äôve lost about 35 lbs total and I‚Äôm back using it to lose 20 more lbs. helps you take accountability for what you are putting into your body. Now that I‚Äôm focused on actual nutrition vs calories, it is a great tool helping me see what to eat more of and what‚Äôs just not worth it. Get this app. You will love it. I never take time to write reviews but I had to for this one after all my success gotta give some credit.

The best dietary/fitness app I have I really love this app because it allows for you to input all of your meals and snacks, daily. Although it may be a little tedious keeping track of every little thing you intake, I do feel that it is very accurate and helpful when trying to reach a certain goal, whether it be to lose, gain, or maintain weight. MyFitnessPal Premium also offers meal and snack recipes that are within your dietary restrictions, which is ideal because for a moment, I was trying the Keto diet!
Charged for the entire year I signed up for the week free trial and stopped using it after 3 days and deleted the app. Completely forgot to cancel the subscription, which is on me.

Search has been sliding for years I‚Äôve been a user of the MyFitnessPal app for years and when I started, it was relatively easy to find what I was looking for. No so much anymore. At some point over the last two months, searching MFP for any food, even an EXACT TITLE MATCH, became nearly impossible. Foods with only tangential relevance to what I was looking for started filling up the first, second, third, etc. search result screens. My workplace uploads our cafeteria‚Äôs daily menu items to MFP along with unique search terms, and those are no longer searchable.

Deserves 10 stars! As a newly diagnosed diabetic, I was scared to death to eat ANYTHING! My doctor told me there were apps that could help me track my calories and carbs. I happened upon the one. It is amazing! Just about any food I can imagine is there, even restaurants! I also love the fact that I can import recipes from the Internet or type them in myself and the app figures out all of the nutritional information for me. This app has been a lifesaver. The creators deserve a standing ovation for this one! Thank you so much!

Great but one bug The app is great but there is one bug that‚Äôs kinda annoying. Whenever you change the amount of an item of food using the scrolling number bar, if you don‚Äôt wait for the bar to stop scrolling and land on the number and instead just close the amount UI, it won‚Äôt register that you changed the amount. The number amount will change, but the calories and macros will still reflect the amount before you changed it.

Does not calculate net carbs which skews reports. I like the database of foods, even restaurant foods, available to track your diet. However my biggest issue is that the app does not calculate your net carb intake. I have to manually subtract fiber from total carbs to know if I‚Äôm meeting my goals and it‚Äôs frustrating that my macro charts are always off from my goals because it‚Äôs including fiber.

Life-changing! I turned to MFP out of desperation at my inability to plan and stick to a healthy eating plan in order to shed stuck-on baby weight that was lingering on long after my kids were babies anymore. I cannot believe the amount of calories I must've consumed on a daily basis before using MFP. I lost 3 lbs in the first 10 days simply by being held accountable for my food intake. Wow. I'm still on my 40-50 lb weight loss journey and I don't know if I could have realistically done this without this amazing and helpful app!
You will be amazed at what you are truly eating! This is an Awesome App!! If you‚Äôre like me you probably wonder why you weigh what you do or why you‚Äôve put on a few pounds?

Great, simple app. Great app for the busy person who doesn‚Äôt have time to make sure they have specific kinds of food that fit into a diet plan. Keeps track of calories, and other nutritional info where provided. Easy to use barcode scanner to quickly add item to diary. Also can keep track of water intake and excersise. Can be synced with many activity trackers including your phone, Fitbit, and Apple Watch. I would give it 5 stars if it had an option to adapt for a breastfeeding Mom who generally needs about an extra 300 calories a day.

Constant problems I have constant problems connecting to the server to help track my calories. It‚Äôs not my internet or service as it works with literally everything else and even internet-loaded ads on the app itself! Yet it keeps telling me it‚Äôs in ‚Äúoffline mode‚Äù and can‚Äôt search for food, only rarely letting me get one search in. This is a problem that I‚Äôve had previously on occasion, but especially after the last update. I‚Äôve had this problem through different phones as well, so it is 100% the app itself. I‚Äôm done using an app that constantly has problems like this after being on the market for years. I highly recommend using a different calorie tracker than this one

I Like The Old App Better This has way too many annoying articles on the front page.  You need to upgrade to a paid version to get rid of them.  I can not customize my nutrients. Their information is outdated and it wants you to eat way too many carbohydrates.  It counts the all the same, whether it is a candy bar or fiber carbs from vegetables. Lisad Easy to use. Can do a little or a lot depending on what you want or have time to do.  I particularly like the running count of how many days I‚Äôve logged in. It makes me want to keep the streak going. I also like when you complete diary at the end of the day. It shows you how much you would weigh in five weeks if you ate that amount every day. Sometimes faster sometimes slower but it‚Äôs not all or nothing. I bought a new scale and weigh myself once a week and so far so good. Excellent app.

Love it! This app has been so helpful with keeping up with all my nutrition stats. I have three kids and every day is busy so my memory isn't what it used to be. As long as I log all my food and drinks when I have them into the app it keeps up with it for me. I can go back throughout the day and check my intake for calories, protein, carbs, etc. as many times as I need to. It helps you set goals and gives reminders about them. It has great recipes. It has awesome exercise regimes. Love this app!

Navigation is challenging I really appreciate the accuracy of this app but it‚Äôs not easy to select the portion sizes I am trying to record. Over the long term it may become frustrating to need to spend so much time trying to figure out the portion sizes for the things I‚Äôm eating. If that could be more flexible it would bring it up a star. And I don‚Äôt know how to get to the community function of the site at all. Maybe for someone a little younger it wouldn‚Äôt be hard, but it‚Äôs hard for me.

Has become too intrusive I‚Äôve just cancelled my subscription because my frustration has tipped over: with the latest app update, every time I open the app, I‚Äôm pestered to turn on fine location tracking; not for finding nearby places to show nutrition menus, but so that the new corporate owners can show ‚Äúbetter‚Äù advertising to me. This is an intrusive violation and I‚Äôm no longer happy to be sharing my eating habits with people who have such disregard for the privacy of their paying customers.

Great for awareness accountability Helps me stay on true to my goals. Very grateful for this app. It would be great if the developers added more micronutrient categories (e.g. magnesium, zinc, vitamin D, K, selenium, omega 3 to 6 ratio, etc.) I realize this is nitpicking and most nutrition labels unfortunately don‚Äôt disclose this information specific to the manufacturer (which they should legally have to IMO). It would be nice to have a general idea of intake based on the food type and information that is readily available. It would be a great addition to an already great app!

A great free app There is a lot to like.... daily food log for calorie monitoring, exercise library to ‚Äúcredit‚Äù yourself for formal workouts as well as activities of daily living, ability to scan product bar codes to import nutritional data, and much more. Advertisements do pop up, but hey; it is a free app. My only ding is that the premium level has an incredibly complex agreement that scared me away. Also, the cost is not provided up front. Worst customer service Never use this app never use this app . I lost my password when I was locked out of the account from their upgrade. I paid for the premium account. I had a free account and $50 account. They told me that my $50 premium paid account did not exist. Two weeks later with ongoing complaint to the Better Business Bureau they give me access to my free account to change the password. Still not giving me access to my completely full paid premium account that in their records does not exist but my iTunes records proof with the email record and my paid receipt that I do have an account that is premium. Never use this app I will get my money back these people are ripped off agents.
Easy and insightful. I like the easy tracking of common foods and being able to export my data since I‚Äôm a big Excel nerd.

Very impressive app Really really well thought out. Ideal for calorie counting and exercisers. The database is incredibly complete. Many small points were beautifully thought through such as the ability to change potion size and quantities (fractions or decimals). Have tried many diets. They all work to some degree for short term loss but then one returns to previous habits and all is lost. If one continues to track eating then one can maintain the loss. This really helps. The monthly cost is worth it. Kudos to you!

Great app but is missing a few things I have used this app for years. Recently it has been logging me out randomly for no reason. However it doesn‚Äôt crash like some apps do. Has been working great to keep track of daily nutrition, except for the fact it lacks the basic function to keep track of your vitamin D levels. To be a nutrition/health app it really shouldn‚Äôt be picking and choosing what items is going to recognize and keep track of. It really needs to do everything across-the-board as far as your intake when it comes to your vitamins, minerals, and food intake, etc.

The best... when it works. This App has changed my life for the better. I‚Äôm completely grateful for it helping me make serious lifestyle improvements. So The several times when it‚Äôs buggy is all the more frustrating. Many issues with capturing steps and doing the calorie calculations on them. Food items that mysteriously drop from my history. It seems that every version update is ‚Äúthree steps forward and 1 step back.‚Äù  But still I love it and I‚Äôm thankful for it.

Referenced the Terms and Conditions - no help at all I was charged $9.99 for four months and tried to cancel each time before I was charged. When I asked for a refund, I was told that it was not their problem and to contact itunes. This is a common ‚Äúrun around‚Äù tactic used to prevent customers from getting a refund for a service you don‚Äôt use. Do not use Myfitnesspal. I then sent them my credit card statement showing the 4 monthly charges, the bill was for $9.99 and it clearly said ‚ÄúMYFITNESSPAL‚Äù, still not refund. They told me to refer to the terms and conditions and that if I could not show proof that I was charged in itunes, that they could not help me. Of course it the charges did not show in itunes, but I paid for it all.

Huge help I thought I was eating the right amount to lose weight but after a month I lost 2 lbs. a friend recommended I try this out and what a difference. I was eating healthy but too many calories. I was going over about 150 calories per day. Once I kept track of my fitness and calories the weight started to come off.  When you see the calories in some food choices it really makes you think if it‚Äôs worth it or not. Love the app and highly recommend.

Loved it until I went premium and have had too many glitches! I love this app and used the free version for 3 1/2 months and lost almost 12 pounds (one pound short of goal weight). I decided to do the one month free premium so I could add times for my meals and vitamins/supplements and also track nutrients that are for health reasons. Ever since I‚Äôve gone premium it‚Äôs constantly telling me I haven‚Äôt logged meals when I have and it crashes when I‚Äôm trying to add recipes or meals, very frustrating!

Search I find it hard to search for the foods i eat quickly on here can‚Äôt quite figure out why. Not sure if it not enough option or too many or just to many varying calories for the same thing. Not sure. I like this app because it connects to my other apps which is why im trying it again. But i found the app ‚Äúloseit‚Äù easier to track in and was able to keep a 300 day logging streak ok there. Whereas since this apps interface is more difficult to use. Some days i won‚Äôt and i think my longest streak has been 30 days. Anyway you cuz would compare and maybe see. :)

A Good Way to Diet This is the second app of this kind I have used and it does the job. For me counting every calorie I put in my mouth is the only serious way to lose weight. Having said that in the end only you can ultimately be responsible for checking calories and serving sizes. I generally believe that if you want to lose weight you should shoot to leave daily calories on the table - especially those attributed to exercise. I am finding that the calorie read on this app is a bit high and I need to gear it to a lower calorie count to lose.

I Absolutely depend on this app I haven‚Äôt written a review until now because I‚Äôve had no problems until the recent update.  It hardly seems fair to write now!  Somehow MyFitnessPal isn‚Äôt syncing with my Fitbit watch app. It worked fine me until the recent update. And I trust it will be going great again soon.

So easy and helpful Being able to just scan a barcode to track your food intake makes the process so much easier. It‚Äôs a breeze to easily track key things like calories, fiber, protein, etc. This app helps me stay on track and is already making me more conscious of my eating habits. Helps make my diet better and I already feel better! There‚Äôs a lot more functions I haven‚Äôt even tried, but even the food, exercise and weight tracking have been great

Great Function when it works, piss-poor customer service when it doesn‚Äôt Just as the title suggests, great functionality and features when it works. It took me 21 days of calling/emailing under armor nearly every day for them to finally ‚Äúattempt‚Äù to do something to assist me.

Simple and Great! This is a great app! I have tried many food journal apps over the years and I always come back to MFP.  I feel it has to do a lot with the simplicity.  It has a very simple design and large food database.  I find that it also runs quicker than other food journal apps, which is a plus.  Yes, sometimes I do wish to see a major change done to MFP, like a new logo or something that really stands out, but then I‚Äôm also saying to myself don‚Äôt fix what isn‚Äôt broken.

Where are the NET CARBS? I have used My Fitness Pal for a while to help me track my carbohydrates for KETO.  The BIG glaring omission is the ability to track NET CARBS.  Sure, you can see Fiber and Carbs in the Nutrient tracking....but you‚Äôd think the APP would make the calculation and allow the User to display it on the MACRO screen.  Another complaint, I have tried to see the cost of going premium and what it would buy in the way of features and I haven‚Äôt found the info available without actually accepting the upgrade.  Maybe if the developers made the ‚ÄòPremium‚Äô information easier to find I might purchase it?

Love the App but HATE how much it glitches Ive been using the premium paid version of this app for years and love it. Im a vegan athlete so keeping track of my nutrition is very important, and this app has always made it easy. It has the best catalog of foods and its very user friendly. But i only rated it 4 stars because of how much it glitches. I feel like several times a week i get a 'cannot sync with server' error and i cant save my changes. Great app but some technical difficulties... I've been using MyFitnessPal since February and it's made me become a lot more organized and accountable. It's helped me become aware of my bad snacking habits and it's given me the motivation I need to work out or do a little bit of walking. The only complaint that I have is that sometimes, when I want to log meals or create a

Why the change For the past few weeks now the app has been requiring me to log in constantly. Even if I have already used the app that day. It is becoming frustrating because I don‚Äôt want to have to continuously log in. I want it open and available to enter food in my diary as well as check my daily progress. With so many apps to choose from I really liked this one the most and don‚Äôt want to switch but I have to do what‚Äôs easiest for me, trying to lose weight is a big enough complication

Great App! Bad New Look. I love this app! It‚Äôs the only thing that has ever helped me be successful in losing weight and keeping it off. And now that I‚Äôve lost it, I can‚Äôt really say I‚Äôve been missing it. I know it‚Äôs not for everyone but if it works for you, it‚Äôs a game changer!

A Rating Well-Deserved As of July of last year, I've lost 60 lbs and I'm not stopping any time soon. It was a ton of effort on my part, but there's absolutely no denying the role MFP had on my progress. They made each step of the journey a visual landmark. If you want to lose weight but don't want the cost and hassle of a gym membership, start counting calories. And if you want to count calories, definitely do it through MFP.

Apple Watch Permission Issues I truly ‚ù§Ô∏è this app, it is actually the best one in the market to help you achieve any weight goals regardless of how challenging the journey may appear. However, following the recent IOS upgrade there are issues with the permissions page appearing each time the app is launched from close. Despite this been a known issue to MFP, their response has been lacking and a week later the issue has no resolution. Hence, the reason for my 4‚≠êÔ∏è review, I will happily change rating once this annoyance is finally been resolved. Three weeks later and MFP has not provided a first -3 ‚≠êÔ∏è now!

Good but could use improvements It‚Äôs an awesome app when it comes to tracking what you intake but needs improvements to its fitness sections. I wanted to log my HIIT exercise but there wasn‚Äôt any option for it. Then I wanted log my squats but only option was for strength. Another time I try to my own but the app crashed on me. I still am pretty satisfied with this app it just need improvements until then I‚Äôm using Loose It app to keep tracked off my exercises and food and this app since it more accurate when it comes to calories and macros.

Awesome app! This app is so helpful! I always just try to remember what I‚Äôve eaten through the day and keep track in my head but it‚Äôs too hard, so getting this app has been a life saver for me. I also love how it shows you healthy meals you can make at home and how it recommends different work outs. The only reason I didn‚Äôt give it 5 Stars is because if you want to upgrade to Premium you have to pay for it. But, it‚Äôs not that big of a deal, I‚Äôm just cheap and don‚Äôt want to pay haha. This app is great but needs some tweaking I‚Äôve used this app for a few years. I lost 30 lbs with it a couple years ago. Really great database and easy to use. Great app but I wish you could group food This is a great app. I use it just to keep a general sense of what I‚Äôm eating and count my calories. Frustrated and disappointed I am so annoyed with this app. It‚Äôs great if you‚Äôre not syncing with another product, but I am sick and tired of this app not syncing with my Apple Watch. Latest uodate killed the whole apo for me. this latest update has made the app completely unusable. and i mean literally. i use the app on my iphone 8 and after this latest update, the app crashes immidiatly after opening, it dosnt even finish loading, ive completely whiped it from my phone and reinstalled it and it still cant even load the login screen before crashing. really a shame too, because i loved this app. i used it everyday and it was great. and im not the only one upset with this update. please know what your doing before you release it, i can infer that you have lost a lot of users just from the comments in the past few days. goodbye MFP, it was great having you while it lasted.

Great app, some changes need to be made I love this app!! I‚Äôve lost almost 10 pounds so far and it‚Äôs been free this entire time!!! Awesome App!! I started using this app for a college course and later in life I stopped using it during my two pregnancies. Now, I am using it again because I know it worked before. Great App - But Annoying Ads Let me start by saying this. My Fitness Pal is a superb app. It does exactly what you‚Äôd want it to do. The free version works perfectly fine just too. Easy to Use App If you‚Äôve got the willpower to say no to donuts and fast food set up to seduce you everywhere you look, then the Fitness App is for you. User I have been using this system for over eight (8) years EVERY day. It has worked for me on many levels. The calorie count has enabled me to reach my upper limit of my BMI. Great This is great for me. It really helps me stay on track. Shows me the steps I‚Äôve taken. Saves the food I‚Äôve had before so it‚Äôs easier to find. Good tracker I‚Äôve tried a couple of resources to track calories, macros, and weight. This one is by far the easiest . It‚Äôs all inclusive and you can track measurements as well as the above. Consider adding chest measurement under progress I REALLY like this app I‚Äôve been using it off and on for years and it does something to my motivation to see my historical progress. Has serious issues UPDATE:

Please fix this app I have used this app fore years successfully and a few months ago there was a new update. I am thinking we‚Äôre going to get more foods to select and  a better community but instead we just got bugs.

Fix the Crash!! This is my favorite fitness app!! It has a huge database and I just LOVE IT! I‚Äôve been using it for years! However here recently it crashes every single time I‚Äôve used it. Disappointed!! When the app actually works it‚Äôs great....... but I‚Äôm very strict about logging in. Red meat?? I thought the red meat issue was a thing of the past. It seems this app only caters to one type of eating...High carb low fat no animal tissue. Don‚Äôt be fooled by someone else spouting off rhetoric from someone they trusted who they thought they knew what they were doing but really, they didn‚Äôt. Helped me lose over 30lbs This app is wonderful. I‚Äôve lost 37lbs since i started and I continue to use this app everyday. I went from 167lbs to 130lbs. Used since 2012 I've been using Myfitnesspal since April of 2012. I lost 90# in 11 months. This app keeps me on track everyday.. even if I overeat or gain a few pounds... I log it! It keeps track of your progress losing weight.  It tells you if you‚Äôre eating too much fat or sodium, etc.  It enables you to log your exercise, and how many calls you‚Äôve burned.  In summation, this app keeps you accountable to the level you want.

Great app just one thing. This app is all around a great app. Even the free version. It tracks everything you need it to except if you fast. I do fast 3 to 4 times a week. But when you don‚Äôt log anything nutrition wise it say it doesn‚Äôt recommend not eating. But that‚Äôs what you do on a fast. You don‚Äôt eat. If you could implement a separate fasting tracker where when you don‚Äôt log food but manually select that your fasting this would be the all around fitness app in my opinion. Otherwise great job!

Best fitness app out there for tracking diet The only reason it‚Äôs not a 5 star is cause it crashes frequently. That‚Äôs it. It‚Äôs frustrating when you‚Äôre trying to update your macros or log in any food you‚Äôre eating then the app crashes. Pretty much every time I use the app.

Bittersweet I‚Äôve been using MyFitnessPal for almost three years and didn‚Äôt get serious until this time last year. I have found fault with the Streak Day Counter, such is really disheartening when I was committed for a year of food journaling. I even confirmed that I did not miss a day and reported the issue twice.

No longer working correctly I have used this app for 5-6 years. I credit the service for helping me lose over 60 pounds. For that I will always be grateful.  However, when trying to get back into tracking to take off some pounds that had crept back on I have found the recent iteration of the service/app to be VERY buggy and at time nearly unusable. For me who has years of historical data in the ecosystem it is a pain point but I‚Äôm going to keep using it largely for that reason. If you are looking for an app to help you start tracking calories now I would recommend you look elsewhere!

Beware Privacy Update!!! I used to love this app, but I may be deleting soon.  A recent update now includes an annoying pop up every single time you use the app.  The only option is to accept their excessive invasion of privacy in which they are allowed to share pretty much ALL of your personal info with any and everybody they choose!  There is no option to opt out of this invasion of privacy!    I have searched through all of the settings and can not find anyplace where I can disable this prompt or opt out of privacy sharing.  Is this what it‚Äôs come down to?  Let My Fitness Pal share your private details or don‚Äôt use the app?  No thank you!  And shame on you!

Locked out, won‚Äôt sync I didn‚Äôt immediately realize this app was the same family as MapMyRun so I tried to create a new account.  After answering several setup questions, only then did it tell me I already had an active account.  Really should consider letting you know that FIRST.

Calorie counter I love being able to keep track of my meals, seeing how many calories I eat and fat count. My problem is I am on a Dr.‚Äô Calorie restricted diet and I keep getting daily comments about not eating enough calories. It would be nice if I could change my daily calorie intake in the system. It still works for me because I have logged all of my meals and snacks, I would just prefer to see I am staying on track with the Dr. Maybe there is something I have not figured out completely yet

Interface isn‚Äôt great This app is so useful however the interface is not user friendly and the miscellaneous videos showing up on the feed are kind of just in the way. I understand that the idea is to get you to pay but that probably doesn‚Äôt change the all around interface in regards to putting in foods and meals and sharing. That needs to be overhauled. Otherwise I really enjoy the app and I‚Äôve so far been willing to deal with the headache of figuring out what it wants.

Add a caffeine tracker! I‚Äôve been using this app since 2011, maybe longer. It surpasses most of the others out there last time I checked. I monitor not only my calories but more importantly my blood sugar by watching how much sugar I consume compared to protein and fiber each day. Tracking fitness helps me keep track to f that as well. My biggest suggestion would be to add tracking for caffeine for those who want or need to limit the amount they consume! I am constantly wondering why none of the apps do this!

App appears to be unprofessionally designed and supported App does not sync well with web site. On line help is useless. Advise is always delete the app and reinstall it. Which I did a few times to finally get it more or less working.  If this app is not an embarrassment to under-armor, it should be.  Seems after much trial end error, problem is that the web site has some very old meal data (from 2016 when I tried to use it last time). The old data cannot be deleted from the web site. (generates an error and allegedly notifies support). If it is deleted from the iphone app, it deletes it from the phone, but will not sync until the app is re-installed.

I‚Äôve lost 34 pounds I have logged for over 1900 days in a row. I have severe asthma and get sick and put on steroids which really do cause you to gain weight. Anyway, thanks to this app, I do go up and down some, but I stay pretty much a good weight. I have much better control and make better choices.

Great App but still problems I really love this app, I‚Äôve been using it for a few years. My one and only complaint is that I am constantly having issues connecting my Fitbit exercise information to this app. I think what makes it so annoying is that even after the trouble shooting it‚Äôs only fixes the issues temporarily. I wish they would focus on fixing that one flaw because it makes me less likely to use this app when I can‚Äôt have an accurate reading of the exercise I have done that day and how it impacts my calorie intake.

Not that great. No upgrades for 5+ years I used to love using this app to document my calorie intake and exercise. It hasn‚Äôt changed at all in the last 5 years since I started using it. I would expect some cool upgrades by now. But no major changes. However, I am experiencing an issue. The app constantly crashes while I‚Äôm in the middle of adding items to my food diary. I only have it open for less than 5 seconds before it crashes. I updated the app and it still continues to crash. I cannot even finish adding a recipe bc it crashes before I can even add one ingredient. Just very disappointed in it since I started using it again this past week.

Please fix I used to love this app. However, i became a bit disillusioned with it after quite a few glitches. I tried to add one recipe for my breakfast one day. Each time i got almost everything added, before it was saved, the screen would go black and i was back to the apple home screen. I tried this 8 times before i gave up on the app and stopped making updates. I now just use it to find the nutritional facts on produce. I‚Äôm not sure whats going on, but the app has become irritating at best and currently is not worth the aggravation!

Great app but super glitchy and slow MyFitnessPal is great. It has a very extensive food data base, comprehensive nutrient tables and an accurate calorie calculator based on goals and body composition. My only gripe, and BIGGEST annoyance about the app is that it is very very glitchy at times. Sometimes it freezes, is unresponsive, and in worst cases, just plain crashes on me. The fact that under armour has its name associated with the app would lead me to believe that technical issues like this would be ironed out and resolved, and the app would run at peak function. Please fix!! Otherwise, great app.

Good app but greedy developers I have used this app on and off for years. It used to be really great but now I have to pay $10 a month to track my macros per meal?! That‚Äôs absolutely ridiculous. I have when developers get greedy and make you pay for something you used to get for free. And I‚Äôm am not sorry to say that this app doesn‚Äôt offer anything with $10/month or $50/year. Absolutely nothing. It is a great tracking app. But not worth that. Would have given it 5 stars otherwise.

New Look üòè First off, I love this app and have been faithfully using it every day for nearly 4.5 years.  It‚Äôs great for helping me to remain consistent.  When we move, or are on vacation, or whatever the occasion may be it‚Äôs a great reminder for me.  My only complaint is that I‚Äôm not fond of the new all white look.  It‚Äôs not one that affects the efficiency of the app (hence the 5 stars), but even so it just looks too basic.  Other than that, keep up the great work!

Encouragement and support I'm finally reviewing this app because of what happened when I entered too few calories--I was advised that I would not receive the usual weight 5-week weight projection and what the National Health Institute recommends for a healthy set of calories for weight loss.

MyFitnessPal Very easy to get started and to enter food eaten for tracking calories. An amazing number and variety of foods in its database. Although I‚Äôve only been using it for a couple days, I can tell that it will continue to help me. It sends out alerts at a ‚Äújust right‚Äù level of nudging. And I‚Äôve only been using the food tracking but it also tracks water intake and weight as well as a couple other types of data.

Great app Not going to lie.. I‚Äôve tried many fitness apps in my life. My fitness pal has easily surpassed all others. It logs your food and nutritional facts so easily you can scan a barcode and it automatically logs it in your daily dietary facts. Also keeping track of your weight is a huge motivator trying to gain weight and trying to lose weight as well. I rate this app 15/10 and would recommend to anyone looking to lose or gain weight.

Well worth the effort it helps tremendously Excellent resource for weight loss. I was able to lose 20lbs by simply logging my food. What I love most is the ability to log what I want to eat and if is too high in fat or sugar it would indicate that...which in tern helped me pick something more sensible. I found that when I stopped using the app I lost motivation and gained weight again. I‚Äôm back at logging and using this extremely helpful resource.

Great Tracker I‚Äôm a vegan on a weight gain journey. And this app keeps track of almost everything. It‚Äôs pretty cool. The best part to me so far is the barcode scanner which makes my process less difficult. I entered a goal and the app showed me how much I should be eating versus how little I actually ate. Now I can workout and know that I‚Äôm getting the nutrients and protein I require to build my muscles -which would‚Äôve been counterproductive if I didn‚Äôt have a visual. üëåüèΩüëçüèΩüëçüèΩ

Let down I have used this app to track my diet and weight loss goals for at least 5 years now. I‚Äôve used the paid and unpaid versions. I really enjoy how easy it is to log your food in the diary, and being able to share progress with friends! I started just using the app to track my weight loss a few months ago (no food entry) and I‚Äôm really let down that once I FINALLY reached my goal weight, there was nothing! No ‚Äúgood job‚Äù! or ‚Äúyou did it‚Äù! Nothing, not even a post on the news feed. Pretty minor, but definitely a turnoff for me.

FINALLY I have been trying to find something that would allow me to know how well or bad my eating habits. This app allows me to keep track of my calories; but, how I am using my calorie intake. I knew that sugar and carbs are my weakness. I have proven to myself in the last two weeks. I have been under caloric intake; however, under protein while eating too many carbs and sugar. Ongoing sync errors for 5 months now. Great concept if it functioned. Quality is non existent. I‚Äôm definitely a premium member for almost 3 years now. So even when you pay for premium expect 1/3 of the app to work correctly. Even after contacting support endlessly, almost 6 months later on premium ‚Äúerror to sync to their server‚Äù never syncs. Which means your data doesn‚Äôt accumulate so expect 100% inaccuracies while using MyFitnessPal. After 6 month of useless support and links to 404 error pages by support in support you should probably know support/service is a steaming pile. About equal to the quality of the malfunctioning app erodes to nonfunctional. But really wow! Great blog post content!

Does Not Sync With Fitbit The MFP app advertises itself as having the capabilities of seamlessly syncing with the Fitbit app to accurately track caloric adjustments through steps, exercise, etc. However, I‚Äôve run into nothing but issues when undergoing my manual sync ‚Äî and the issue is on MFP.

Great tool to stay on track Calories counting is what you put into it but fitness pal makes it easy. I love the barcode scan option, I use it most. I started using it as a way to be more aware of what I‚Äôm putting into my body and making better choices to stay in cal calorie reqs for the day. This helped me so much This app has helped my eating habits so much. Before, I used to eat uncontrollably and it made me out of shape. I started using it and it showed me how much sodium I consume and it really helped me to show me that I needed to change my diet. Since, I have stopped binge-eating and I have lost 12 pounds since I started using this app. If I were you I would definitely use this app which leads to a healthier life.

The best one yet that I‚Äôve tried I would have given it 5 stars, except there are a couple of things that are either glitches or I just haven‚Äôt figured out. Like on settings when I was trying to adjust carbs, it kept reverting back to 150 even though I changed it to 100 multiple times. Some of the serving sizes they don‚Äôt give you enough options.
Importing recipes I admit it is the best one for nutritional upkeep or discipline, but there are a few things that need to be changed.

Quality degrades with every update I have used this app for many years, and while it has been useful for losing weight, lately the quality of the app has degraded. With every update, the application keeps getting slower & freezing. I have uninstalled and reinstalled the app many times on my multiple devices, and when I submitted a feedback report, I was told that the issue may be my device and to uninstall and reinstall the app. I have tried this, and use this application on more than one Apple device, and they all have the same issues. Love this app! The reason for a 4 rather then a 5, is because anyone can add nutritional information to the food data base.  So you really have to be careful.  If you search for black coffee you might find black coffee with 60 calories and black coffee with 5. So you really need to pay attention.

Amazing app, can‚Äôt imagine my life without it. Seriously a great app, started really lose weight and track my calories and this app really helps a lot. Data won‚Äôt sync after most recent update... I‚Äôve used MFP on and off for about 8 years and if the app had worked properly after the new update, it would have gotten a higher rating. Love the app BUT The last few months there have been a lot of issues with loading with the server. Suggestion to improve app I love the app, and I think I have a way for it to be even better. Sometimes I find myself trying to plug in a different combination of foods to see how I can best reach my macro goals. So it made me think: what if there was a way that the app can figure it out for you?  Using the foods you regularly eat (and even other suggestions), the app will tell you what combination of foods/serving size you should eat to meet your macro goals before the end of the day. Hope that made sense!

Good app works for what it‚Äôs there for I‚Äôd like to start this off by saying that I‚Äôm on the free version so this could be a problem due to that. This app is great for what it‚Äôs there for and gives me good feedback on my macros as I‚Äôm getting started on my body building journey. However as of late it keeps reminding me to add my meal as if I haven‚Äôt added them already which in most cases I have. Other than that it‚Äôs a great app and that prior mentioned bug is probably a recent bug. I reccomend this app to everyone I know!

Battery hog- Beware I love everything about this app except that it eats my battery for breakfast. I‚Äôm running iPhone 6 with iOS 12.1.2. Under ‚Äúbattery health ‚Äú it shows 19 mins of screen time and 7 mins background = 22% of battery usage, but it‚Äôs the only thing close to that level of consumption. Egregious, and has put my phone out of commission on more than one occasion. It‚Äôs too bad, because the app‚Äôs ability to scan bar codes is really amazing. Also wish it would readily display carbs GI/GL (I have T2 diabetes).
All the help you need to live fit... Whether you‚Äôre turning your life around or maintaining your fit lifestyle, MyFitnessPal is there to keep you on track, focused, and honest.

Works best with a Fitbit I am an avid cyclist (use the Strava app) and I also own a Fitbit Versa. And for the times when I just walk, I use Runkeeper. All these devices/apps y‚Äôall to each other to give the user a pretty accurate snapshot of calories consumed along w calories burned. Love you Fitnesspal I been used this app off and on for past 3 years, this January took a decision to change my rating an take care if myself since I been dealing with prediabete and come from a family diabetic no want to take medicine at 64 want to be healthy and fit. Cut all grain and dairy from my food more good fats and organic meat. In past 63 day list 18. Keep track my calories and try to walk at least 4 miles dairy.., feel great and look good... thank you Fitnesspal

Great app I honestly love this app, it‚Äôs great to use the scanner when you don‚Äôt want to type up a long name. Much better than allot of the same apps. You may ask why I only have it 3 out of 5 stars.. the reason behind that is I don‚Äôt like the fact you have to pay to see your macros what you have left etc.. I oils rate this 4 or 5 stars if the developers unlocked that for free use. I mean we are all trying to get healthier right? Good healthy food is more expensive than fast food so why make us pay more for that too? Just my thoughts though.

I use it every day! I don‚Äôt know what I would do without this app! It‚Äôs hard to believe it‚Äôs FREE! I use it to log my food and water intake and manage my macros. I haven‚Äôt missed a day in years and it truly helps keep me on track and accountable. I also log my exercise and read those super informative articles. What great tips and info to help me grow and be a better me. It‚Äôs fun to share and follow friends who use it too. I‚Äôm a forever MyFitnessPal user.

Please fix syncing issues with fitbit I have used MyFitnessPal for nearly 4 years. Only the past 1 & a half I have used a fitbit. I have already reached out to fitbit and they told me many users of MyFitnessPal have had the same issues for quite some time. I heavily considered going premium on MyFitnessPal, but what‚Äôs the point if the app does not work as intended? I hate leaving bad reviews, but I am at a loss on what to do.

New update terrible The latest update now has you signing in every single time you access this app. Even if it‚Äôs mere seconds, with no option to stay logged in. Very annoying. They also make you agree to their terms of service with each sign in. So before I was able to quickly get in and add foods and workouts, now there are two cumbersome processes that must be completed each time I use the app. Also, it requires a typed out password, no touch or faceID. GOALS REACHED!! Time and time again this app never fails me. It is able to recognize more items than the carb manager app and I just love it‚Äôs simplicity. I don‚Äôt need silly pictures of food or net carb breakdown because I‚Äôm not an idiot and can do the math myself. I‚Äôve used this app for about 5 years now on and off I‚Äôll admit, but when I wanna jump on the warp again this app always brings me back to where I want to be! A healthier fit me with easy macro tracking. LOVE IT!

Works great when it‚Äôs working I like using My Fitness Pal, and I‚Äôve lost weight and have gotten better about exercise with using the app. My only frustration is that recently it wasn‚Äôt linking to my Fitbit app, and that was a pain to get working again. Sometimes when I go to log my food, the app is asking me to log in again. That becomes annoying when I‚Äôm in a hurry. Overall, I really enjoy it and will keep using it.

Pop up scare This app serves its purpose and is very easy to use. For the most part I love this app and how functional and practical it is. My only issue is that some times adds pop up and on 2 occasions they were extremely x-rated. I never want to open my app unless I‚Äôm at home for fear one will pop up and someone will see. May be triggering for those with eating disorders I have been using this app for a long time. For weight loss, calorie counting, food tracking, exercise tracking, everything. The emphasis on calories, extremely specific tracking of macros and micros, and the ‚Äúif every day was like this, you would weigh this much in 5 weeks!‚Äù Was triggering and extremely stressful. Overall, except for the bugs here and there, the app is okay. Just a bit too strong for me. I just got a Fitbit, and I find that app much kinder and more useful and accurate than this one.

Very cool. This app makes it easy to log in my food, water and exercise for the day. Wacky Over the past few days my app has been funky. When logging my info in, it randomly updates with inaccurate information. NET CARBS PLZ!!! First of all I love this app and habe used it off and on for many years. It has always helped me know where I need to tweak my food intake. Currently I am doin the Keto diet. Love it! But one suggestion... Okay, so I really really love this app. It helps me keep track of everything and I love it. I do however have one suggestion. Like if you have 150 calories, 20 G protein, and 23 carbs, I‚Äôd like an option to get food suggestions instead of combing through what I have in the kitchen or resorting to google... other than that, the app is flawless!

The best app! I LOVE this app! I use this app more than I do Facebook. Weather you want to lose weight or just maintain I find it super helpful. Nice app but burns battery down fast I‚Äôve been enjoying the features of this app.  Easy to track, great database, well integrated and fast to add information.

Randomly logs you out Almost seven years of using the app and since this last update it randomly logs me out and says it can‚Äôt connect to server. I see the team is working on a fix this evening. Problem Fixed: What is wrong with this app/website? Update: website problem fixed so moved back to 4 stars. Still would like this app to work better or as well as it did before Under Armour purchased it a few years ago.

I love this app Th food, water, and exercise journal are easy to use and full of information. Goals are easy to set. I like how it tells me how many calories are left and in which nutrition areas. Motivating app Takes a little getting used to. It tells you how much you will weigh in 5 weeks if you stay within your goal which is very motivating!!!! Ridiculous policy I totally forgot to cancel before my premium trial expired, I take 100% responsibility for that. However, as soon as I noticed charge (day after) I immediately attempted to cancel and request a refund....even a partial refund would have made me happy...nope, nothing...so, I have a $53 premium membership that is truly worth maybe $5 extra. Don‚Äôt even try the trial, it‚Äôs not beneficial and due to lack of use, you‚Äôll also get scammed üòû

No worth the money Seems like a nice app to track food but if you‚Äôre looking to add Fitbit tracking to the app it won‚Äôt work.  You‚Äôll get it to sync off the bat but it stops after that. You‚Äôll have to keep logging out going to the website unsyncing your Fitbit then syncing again.  Log out of Fitbit log back in and even then only get it to update randomly.  For a fee of twenty dollars a month this should not be an issue.  If you research you see this problem has been around since 2017 and they haven‚Äôt addressed it in 3 years.   Save your money and find an app that works correctly and isn‚Äôt just there to steal your money on false claims.

Weigh loss journey after thyroid removal! I have tried a lot of things but this is helping me keep track of everything.  It holds me accountable so I know if I can or should eat something plus helps you figure out what‚Äôs in the foods. Does everything for you! I have lost two pounds a week like it said I would.  I have never lost any weight using any other diet plan. That‚Äôs what this is.  You create it your personalized plan. Thanks so much.
Healthy companion to have I‚Äôve been using this app for about 7 wks to track my carbs & sugar intake.  I decided to take more control of my health.

App is slow & no net carbs I do love this app, but if you are doing a Keto diet there may be better solutions out there. MFP doesn‚Äôt calculate net carbs and I don‚Äôt know how it‚Äôs factoring carbs into the macro ratios.

Love the Garmin Integration I started using this app when I purchased a Garmin watch. I like the ability to count calories. Sync my Fitbit I really like this App but my frustrations are with syncing my Fitbit. When I first started using the app I had issues with MFP sync with my Fitbit finally one day it just worked. If you are not using this, shame on you! I was reluctant to ever start counting calories.  It is very obvious once you start that you(me) were an idiot before.  This is single handedly the most important activity a person can do who has any need whatsoever for diet and weight loss. Most intuitive, user friendly app I‚Äôve used to date, when compared to something more complex than ‚Äúmy calendar‚Äù or ‚Äúemail‚Äù.  Thank you MyFitnessPal!

Disappointed & Angry Been a longtime user of my fitness pal and had purchased a yearly subscription. My Apple ID says my subscription should run until July but I haven‚Äôt had access since January. I am very angry that I paid for this service and it only worked for half the time I was promised. My fitness pal has no email or contact address so I took advice from their forums and repurchased the subscription in hopes it wouldn‚Äôt double charge me as other people said. It seems this is a serious issue as other people have reported it as well. Easy and quick to use. Great way to track calories. Update: I am now 45 and hit a new high in weight and a new waistline. I'm determined to get back to a healthier weight and waist. I like this app still.

Awesome This is a great app. Its easy to use and super convenient. I love that i can scan a barcode to log stuff for food. Another great thing about  this app is that when I log my weight I can put a picture with it to really see the change that‚Äôs happening. And to see all the victory stories is super encouraging.

Useful app, but needs to fix issues with duplicate exercises and user interface This is a very useful app, but the interface is very slow. They also need to fix issues with exercises being duplicated. Connecting the app with Strava and Apple health has resulted in a bunch of exercises being duplicated 4 times in a lot of cases. Use to love it. Terrible customer service. I used this app for 4 years. Help?? I‚Äôe used this app for so many years and have had no complaints, though I have noticed every few weeks it makes me log in again which is weird, but after this most recent update it had me log in again but then said there was a issue getting me on the server, and then when it finally worked it would log me in for five seconds and then go back into the log in screen. Great app, but missing a couple of things This is a great app, and I did get the premium version.   I really wish you can add the net carb goal and also add a recipe to a recipe. If you‚Äôre not 18+ don‚Äôt even bother First of all let me say, the app is great, I‚Äôve tried it before and it‚Äôs great and user friendly but the problem is that I don‚Äôt get is that it‚Äôs only for adults (18+). Bad fat vs Good Fat Just started today. Looks like it will really help me. However I am confused as to why my goal is to have 9g of Saturated Fat, but 0 of both polyunsaturated and monounsaturated. Full integration! ‚ù§Ô∏è using this app with UA Record, the wrist band, scale, and heart rate strap. It's a complete system that works well. I'm athletic, and am using it to make gains.
