I want to gain 5 lb, and this app calculates the necessary calories to do that while accounting for calories burned during exercise.

Would never live without I do not have premium access at this point and have been using the free version for over 3 months. I have proudly lost 18+ pounds thanks to MFP and Fitbit. It‚Äôs accountability. It‚Äôs so easy. I mean SO EASY!! Otherwise I wouldn‚Äôt bother. I felt hopeless before I began, but now see I CAN make changes. Love the menu ideas. I just had to add this to my regular review of 5 stars and glowing reports. I just saw the protein lunch ideas and LOVE IT! It is such a help because I have trouble many days getting my protein up and these are great ideas.

Good, but... I wish that you could have a miscellaneous section to add things that aren‚Äôt full meals/ snacks. Can‚Äôt login or re enroll I‚Äôve been away from the app for quite a while.  Colleague suggested it so I decided to re install. First attempt didn‚Äôt work. Half Expected that as I was only guessing at my password from way back when. When prompted, I tapped on the ‚ÄúForgot Password‚Äù button. Entered my email, followed the instructions there and reset my password. Then followed the link back to sign in and received an error message saying email or password invalid. Repeated the reset process four times, each time requesting a new email and resetting to new passwords. It also wouldn‚Äôt let me sign up as new because my email was ‚Äúalready in use‚Äù.

Nope Prompt me for a review with no way of stopping you from prompting me for a review and this is what you get.  Asking for a review is okay so long as you provide ‚ÄúNo Thanks‚Äù in addition to a ‚ÄúNot Now‚Äù option. Constantly asking for a review with the only options being to give the review or to let you bug me again later is a huge no-no in app building.  Against the Apple human interface guidelines in fact.
Too many bells & whistles I only downloaded this app because the Garmin app for my Instinct doesn‚Äôt track food and this is the only one that will link with the Garmin app.

Love this app I love this app! I‚Äôve used it for about four years now. I‚Äôve worked with multiple nutritionist that can look into my app to read what I‚Äôve logged and change my macros accordingly. I would advise working with a professional versus relying on the app for your calorie and macros because it typically puts you in a deficit lower than your BMR which is not good. I also pay for premium so I can change the settings and goals.

One of my favorite apps! This is my first review that I‚Äôve ever written for anything on the App Store, and this is legit one of my favorite apps. It‚Äôs so intuitive and works great if you apply the data with other fitness data across your apps (say a smart scale)!

MyFitnessPal Premium BE CAREFUL!!! This is a great app until it starts charging you without authorization. I had the app over a year ago. I used the premium feature for free last year which I did not remember when reinstalling the app this year. I clicked on it and it said there was a month free trial so I decided to do that and it automatically charged me $49 because I had the trial version last year. It did not say anything when I went to click the free version again. This is really upsetting and there‚Äôs nothing that can be done with it.

Kills my battery I seriously love this app; I‚Äôve been using it for a few years and it makes tracking my calories and macros SO simple. However, for the past week or so I can‚Äôt log in without it draining my battery COMPLETELY after literally just a minute or so. Too Much Incorrect Nutritional Data You really have to be prepared that when you enter an item, that you validate the nutritional information at multiple web sites. MyFitnessPal App Needs Fixed ! I'm having trouble with MyFitnessPal app , I can't input anything

Responsive Developer I was having an issue where the app crashed constantly. In short order, the developer replied to my review and told me they‚Äôd fixed the problem, and asked me to reinstall the app. It‚Äôs working much better now.

I can make up nutritional values on my own The app gives you the ability to input recipes ingredient by ingredient and calculate the nutritional values. Except that it‚Äôs a complete mess. Amazing Tool! I love this little helper.  The free version they offer is great!

Love this app! Just started this app a week ago after reviewing my bloodwork results & not being happy with what I saw. I had been working out 5 days a week but hadn‚Äôt changed the way I was eating. Finally had to admit that I needed to make some better food choices. Particularly in the area of sugars & carbs. This app helps me look at my nutrition for the day and determine whether I really want that sugary or high carb snack. Have lost 2.5 pounds in one week!

Resets my macros everyday Since the last update, it has reset my macros every single day back to the ‚Äústandard‚Äù options. On the keto diet, that won‚Äôt work for me. I could just ignore it, but the fact that it pops up the ‚Äúset new goals‚Äù screen every day has caused me to be thoroughly annoy and start using Carb Manager. I don‚Äôt like it nearly as much, but at least it‚Äôs not resetting everything every morning. I would quite appreciate it if that could be fixed. My favorite Ap! This ap is incredible. I do wish the calories burned was more accurate. I feel like it pulls the number out of thin air. Not happy Has not been syncing with Fitbit for the last 3 days- this has happened before in the past. All of my other apps are syncing with Fitbit- so I know it is a problem with MyFitnessPal

Awesome! I really enjoy this app! It's really easy to use and very simple! I've never had any glitches or anything with it. Great but could be better This app is the best way to keep track of nutritional intake but it annoys me that they still haven't updated it to track strength and better cardio workouts. I use an app called Fitbod, it's like a handheld personal trainer mainly for strength based workouts, and My Fitness Pal does not have the option to pair with other apps, not even through My Health on iPhones. Love this App! This is great - recommended by my nutritionist as a way to hold myself accountable and learn about nutrition.  Very different than dieting - tracks nutrition, exercise and helps monitor ups and downs in weight.  Very good scanner and data base is full of many foods I eat or similar.  Also I use ‚Äúmeals‚Äù to enter salads or similar that I repeat and can swap out components without re-entering all the basics.  I‚Äôm very happy and so far down 5 lbs from beginning weight one month.

Apps like this are the "secret" to weight loss I've been tracking my food for over 10 years and have not seen any significant weight gain even though I am in my 30s. It truly is the secret to weight loss/maintenance. I've used a few other tracking apps and my fitness pal is numero uno. It has everything you need and for the most part works flawlessly. If you are wondering if you should download this app the answer is YES.

Woefully inadequate on serving options My biggest complaint with this app is that you have to do some weird shenanigans to figure out an adjusted serving size from the standard.  For instance, I wanted to add chia seeds to my daily breakfast entry.  The standard serving is 1/4 cup.  Well, I used 2 tsps. There is no entry for 2 tsps of chia seeds.  So I have to do some weird math to figure out that 2 tsps is the same as 1/9 of a standard 1/4 cup serving???  Or scan through dozens of entries of chia seeds where someone else just happened to eat 2 tsps too?  That‚Äôs insane.  I can find another app ‚Äî My Net Diary ‚Äî which does the math for me.  Ridiculous app so I deleted my record entirely.

Suggested as a key part in losing weight Recently I went to a medical doctor to find help in losing weight. My weight was 248, a BMI of 32, which is two points up the wrong way on the obesity chart. As part of a routine to lose fat to gain a healthier body, she recommended tracking everything I eat or drink on the MyFitnessPal Application. My physician guaranteed pleasing results will happen. With her medical advice, I have been meticulous in recording food, liquids and all forms of exercise.

Good idea, bad app I like the underlying mechanics of meals, website recipe importing, barcode scanning, etc, but the app leaves much to be desired. The UI can be unintuitive, for example, when editing a prior-made recipe before adding it as a meal, there are multiple ‚Äúsave‚Äù/‚Äúok‚Äù buttons, and even after saving and adding the meal, it doesn‚Äôt always go back to your diary.

Don‚Äôt pay for other apps! There are other apps out there that do these same things that cost a lot of money monthly to log your food and exercise. Don‚Äôt pay for those! This app is all you need! It‚Äôs easy to use and the upc scanning feature is the best! It can sync with your step counter app and your scale app from a blue tooth scale. Great app! The free version is perfect for what I need. Not super restricted low functionality like some apps. Perfection!
aesthetically bad This is one of those apps that‚Äôs great and easy to use, but you don‚Äôt want to open it because it feels cluttered like a 2011 blog.

A little buggy Overall the app is great, except that it keeps telling me I haven‚Äôt logged my meals when I have logged them. I‚Äôll get a notification, and I check it to see, yes, the meal is in fact, logged. It‚Äôs a little irritant, but it builds up over the days because I‚Äôve been diligent about my meal logging. The only way to avoid these notifications is to check off the ‚Äúcomplete diary‚Äù option. Then it asks me if I‚Äôm finished logging for the day and tells me I‚Äôm not eating enough. üòí

More Apple Watch This app is pretty good but it needs more functionality with the Apple Watch. It has an Apple Watch app, but it‚Äôs use is very limited. Amazing app / glitches and force-closes often I chose to do the free trial of the paid version with no intentions on continuing to pay for it after, but one day in, I knew I was willing to pay to continue using it. So far so good The apps is good so far, but I wish they can help out with food example to choose from. Some of the pre existing things on here are from random people and who knows how accurate they might be. Wish the apps had a standard of items we could go by. Other than that, it‚Äôs okay.

Audacity to even offer a paid subscription I loved the app and everything but every few months or so I lose the ability to see calorie adjustments based on my steps per day. I've tried everything and it just will not return. This is ridiculous and to even think that I was going to pay for the paid version. Smh MFP. Too many issues I love this app when it‚Äôs working properly.  However, I am constantly getting an error message that says it‚Äôs offline. If you are patient enough to let them work it out, you‚Äôll absolutely love the app.  Unfortunately, I‚Äôm not that patient.

Great app, some limitations Overall it‚Äôs a great app that I use pretty much exclusively to track my diet and nutrition. Good, but not compatible? I used this app for a while and got really bad about tracking, once I re-downloaded it for a fresh start I couldn‚Äôt get the app to sync up with my apple watch for activity purposes when it claims that is does. Have always loved this app, but it loses data with every update. I echo all the favorable reviews ‚Äî easy to use, very detailed, and the paid version opens up even more user-friendly options and customization.

Great Tracking AP! My doctor told me that she wanted me to loose weight!üò¨üò¨üò¨. I was frustrated and felt defeated. Its ok It does mostly what it's supposed to. But today I finally linked it up with the run tracker. Found out it posted my run twice. Took too much effort to find the way to edit this. Love this app! I‚Äôve used many food diary/tracking apps and this is the one I always return to and have the most success with. Best App for Keeping Me On Track Seeing my nutrient intake without it being a paid feature of the app has really helped me begin to realize my goals. This app changed my life!!! I have been trying to lose weight for years and this is the first time I succeeded! The app helps me understand how many calories I am eating, and that helps me make better choices.

Love the app, hate the update! I‚Äôve been a premium member for at least a couple of months now. It‚Äôs really worth paying for bc tracking macros makes all the difference in hitting your goals.

Good I really like this app my only complaint is when putting in measurements sometimes you only have a tsp or 1/2c but the option is not there so I have to put a tbsp or a cup when I have not had that much which makes my counts a little off and it would be nice to delete from your history so that is the reason for the 4 stars otherwise it‚Äôs great for helping with weight loss and being accountable to something makes you think before eating üòÅüëçüèª
Most user friendly site on internet! I have found this site to be not only the most useful site on the Internet but everything is free at your fingertips.

Very easy, very intuitive This is amazing app and the fact that a person gets all that they get for free is amazing. It‚Äôs very easy to track food with the scanner and search bar. Love this app! This is the best app I have ever used for tracking food and exercise. Really works I started this app 2 weeks ago. I love it I am overweight because I wasn‚Äôt eating enough! Yes ,not all overweight people are heavy for the reason of eating all day. Amazing App!!! This app is amazing because my family is on a diet and we all use this app to put in all of our meals and snacks that we do. Glitchy Ads Ruining App I've used this app (weather consistently or not) for YEARS. Accountability!! Hitting goals! The app is very accurate with the nutrition values and helps me to be accountable! lost all of my progress photos MFP recently had server issues. it forcefully logged me out. when i logged back in, ALL of my progress photos, 2 years worth, disappeared. i've already contacted MFP and they gave me a generic response. yes i've done all of the troubleshooting you've recommended (restarting app, reinstalling app, etc). they're absolutely no help at all. they do not upkeep the app either and it looks terribly outdated. the only thing keeping this app good is the database it has, however there are many other apps quickly catching up.

Doesn‚Äôt work well with Apple Watch Either incompetent programmers or they‚Äôre just trying to push you to buy premium to somehow make this thing work. Their retarded negative calorie adjustment setting is ridiculous. Whether activated or deactivated any calories expended will be subtracted from your daily caloric goals so that if your goal is 2500 cal and you do 500 cal worth of work it will display that you have 2000 cal left for the day rather than 3000. Garbage This app has potential but its buggy as hell, set your calories and macros goal?  Nah it just ignores em and puts em wherever it wants, want 4500 calories a day?  Nope, 3800 for no reason ever, this app is more frustrating than useful, want to add food well maybe, or maybe youll punch in all your food click complete diary and itll just erase all of it for you!!! Even going through with monumental amounts of patience and at best you can actually enter everything and get it to stay but no promise itll be there later, it‚Äôs really a massive waste of time trying to use this app.

üëéüèΩüôÉ I don‚Äôt have the full version. I‚Äôm glad my bro put me on with this to keep track and have a conscious mind about what I eat and to know what I‚Äôm putting in my body and get to have an estimated guess on what I‚Äôll weigh by calculating my food intake and calories that I burn from exercising but other than that when I‚Äôm on the app it burns the fire out of my battery and it makes my phone extremely hot and it starts to move really slow until I exit out of the app. I won‚Äôt have it for too much longer.
