Paid customer - searching getting worse I have used this app for years now - and I started paying about half a year ago. Recently the searching has been changed to be more difficult and the times it stores my foods seems to keep decreasing. As a paying customer it should keep any food I‚Äôve selected for at least a year. Also, get rid of the frequent/recent picker.

Issue connecting with fitbit I have been using this app for more than a year and love it. Very easy to track and record foods and have loved being able to connect it to my fitbit account. Unfortunately starting a couple of days ago the food and exercise data hasn‚Äôt been transferring from this app to fitbit, tried unlinking and relinking accts and got an error message, probably just a minor bug. Fix this and you‚Äôve got 5 stars!

Great for beginners 5 stars I came into this intimidated because I know nothing of nutrition or calories but this app has opened a new world for me in the most welcoming and easy way possible. You can put exactly what you‚Äôve eaten for the day and you‚Äôll know what kind of weight gain or loss you‚Äôre to expect. You can set a bar for yourself and it‚Äôs so intuitive and simple to use. 5 stars hands down!

This app works If you are willing to put the time into logging all of your food intake and exercise, you will definitely lose weight with this app. I lost about 8 lbs in 3 weeks (my goal is to lose a total of 12 lbs. in 12 weeks). Most importantly, the weight loss is sustainable and you can lose weight without losing muscle mass if you pace the weight loss to a reasonable amount per week.

A huge help I a recently diagnosed diabetic who is obese. I need to lose st least 50 lbs and is hard to do. This app motivates me to track my daily intake of proteins, carbs, fats, water and other nutrients. It‚Äôs easier than keeping a hand written food journal and I especially like the way I can scan a bought food product and instantly get all the nutrition data that I need. Highly recommend this app.
Vastly improved but... Integration with other apps - nice. Presents a whole fitness/diet picture.

Pregnancy mode My Fitness Pal has been the single most helpful way for me to maintain and lose weight. However, I wish there could be a ‚Äúpregnancy mode‚Äù.  Protein and nutrition needs overall change with pregnancy, and it would be helpful to have different options for planning and tracking weight gain goals depending on current weight and which trimester of pregnancy you‚Äôre in! :-)

Keeping it off I have lost and gained my weight back at least a dozen times in my lifetime. This app is so easy to use it isn‚Äôt a bother to track what I‚Äôm eating. My friend lost over hundred pounds and has kept it off for over three years - All because he uses this app to track what he‚Äôs eating every day. I‚Äôm at 15 pound weight loss and plan to use this app to my goal weight and then beyond.

My fitness pal I love this app. it is allowing me to be focused , and accountable! It makes me be more aware to make healthy food choices! üôÇ‚ù§Ô∏èüí™ü•óI just need to add exercise and I will be golden! But first I need to focus on healthy food choices and portion control! I am doing this by cutting calories! I am slowly seeing results! I   feel so much better! I am focused on lowing blood pressure, cholesterol, sugar not so much on weight !If I loose weight that is bonus!

Wish They Would Add... Love this app and it‚Äôs been very helpful with weight loss! Love that you can create recipes to add to your day in it. I wish they would add a feature where you could share the recipe with your friends in the app. My husband has this app too and I have to go into each of our phones and create the same recipe when I make something for dinner. Would be easier if I could only add the recipe once and share it with him!!
Can't do anything Umm, I just spent 20 minutes trying to add food that I had just eaten. Every time somehow getting a premium sub ad between each item.

Great...when it works Very buggy. Server errors are regular when importing recipes from the Web. Problems saving recipes and losing data I entered. Barcode scan often works but sometimes the data is inaccurate and I have to plug it in anyway. Have regularly force quit the mobile app or even uninstall it and reinstall, but when I do that, some of my settings stick and others don‚Äôt, so I have to reset my preferences. When it works, it works great. Especially for macro counting.

Not working i‚Äôve heard very good things about this app so i thought i would give it a try. i look forward to it helping me on my weight gain journey. i downloaded it a couple months ago and tried to sign up. each time i tried however, a box would pop up saying ‚ÄúAlert. we are unable to process your registration at this time.‚Äù i‚Äôve tried probably 50 times. and each time it‚Äôs the same thing. please fix this, i really look forward to using this app !!

Under Armour This is the best calorie tracker available for the iPhone, and it always has issues. Also, when I scan a barcode, the nutritional info is wrong half the time. What more should we expect from a company that stuck with its original concept as a company name after becoming known for products that have nothing to do with that concept. I guess the figure it out as they go, and that seems to work okay.

I love this app BUT.... I love this app so much, I use everyday and I'm currently using to for my competition. One issue I have with this app is that it crashes so often. I got a new iPhone X thinking it was my old phone, and it was, because a lot of apps were crashing yet this one still seems to crash. And before you ask, yes I'vve updated it. I've been on and off of multiple WiFi signals from weak to super strong connection. LTE with zero to 4 bars. Everything. This app always crashes for me. I hate it. :(
User Friendly App to Lose Weight This App is extremely easy to use, because it catalogues the foods you eat, which makes it easier to add items to your meal selection.
Works great, with discipline. I‚Äôve reached my goal at the rate that I entered into MFP. (10lbs@ 2lbs/wk)

Decent, but increasingly buggy Before Apple health MyFitnessPal used to be great, but I've seen more and more bugs over time. I've registered the bugs through their very annoying bug tracking system, but nothing seems to change.

I like the app but I like the app, great features and great app to keep track of your eating habits but every time I log my food, it gives a reminder that I didn‚Äôt log my breakfast would you like to log it now (example). I tried many different things to fix it but it still keeps saying the same thing. Also there are too many things happening in the app it is a bit distracting. Please keep it simple and have drop down menu items for customers to choose.

Great app but very slow Myfitnesspal has served me greatly over the years. The food database is huge and it has truly helped me with my health and fitness goals. However, the app can be very slow and glitchy which gets frustrating considering how often I use it. I use the free version so I don‚Äôt know if the paid version is any better in this aspect. Regardless, I have not come across a better database for macro tracking and I recommend MFP.

Great but lags I love this app but it loads very slowly! I‚Äôll try to move to another day or select an item & I‚Äôll to wait for several seconds for it to respond. Sometimes nothing happens & I have to close out altogether. After adding new items, it doesn‚Äôt recalculate the amount of calories I‚Äôve had. Again, I have to close the app & reopen it for it to reflect the correct amount. I‚Äôd give it five stars if it wasn‚Äôt frustratingly slow!

My Fitness Pal I have used MyFitnessPal for 465 days and I totally love it. It has helped me manage my calories to the point that I have lost 47 pounds; and I only have five more to go to reach my goal. The database is awesome. The ability to add my own meals is awesome. I like the online database more than I like the apps which I have on my iPad and iPhone.

Hi mommy I just got home and I‚Äôm getting my dog from school I don‚Äôt have to do that I just did not get it to me because I‚Äôm going back to the bowling house because of my phone and my computer is going to go pick it out I just want my money back to you pick it off because you don‚Äôt have to do anything you want me you can pick it up and I go pick it up and I go to get the stuff I want it

Great food log I am using this app to aid my personal training at the gym so I only really use the food diary section. I love the massive database of foods I can find because it makes organizing meals easy.  Being able to track what I eat has helped me meet my goals much more easily. Also the copy and save meal functions make it take very little time to log my meals if I make batch cooked meals for the week.

Love it!!!  Would like to see these innovations added... This app has made me very conscious of my fat, protein, and carb intake.  It helped me realize I wasn‚Äôt getting enough protein, which foods I was eating provided the highest protein levels, and that I was not getting enough of the RIGHT carbs!  Once the habit is created of entering foods, this app is VERY useful!

Love this app This app over the last year and a half has been a major contributor to my being able to lose over 70lbs. Recently, the app has not been syncing consistently with my Fitbit app which is the other app I use daily. The app still functions great as far as tracking food, but I follow the Fitbit calorie recommendations since they seem to be more accurate with adjusting based on daily activity. It‚Äôs just annoying that it stopped synching. I‚Äôm hoping it gets fixed soon!

Helpful....must needed/used app. Was hacked and got nervous. Deleted. Need this more than ever now. Helps very much with my type 2 insulin dependent. NOW, I need to eat ‚ù§Ô∏è smart and watching my salt in take. I had a stent put in. I want to be here for my family/grandkids, who I love ever so much.

Best health conscious app ever!! So far I‚Äôm loving this up it has the best features over it keeps track of what I eat based on what I put into it and let me know my calories and my intake and gives me good advice I love the blogs gives me more motivation to keep going to keep trying and I downloaded the other apps through these guys I‚Äôm so thankful thank you my fitness pal you really are my fitness palüí™üí™üí™üëçüèºüëçüèºüëçüèº‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏èüòéüòéüòé

Crashing at startup This app is not great. It was merely OK for a while, but I tried deleting some annoying posts in my "activity feed" (who needs that anyway?) and the app suddenly crashed. Now it won't start up again. I even reinstalled it and it still crashes on startup. I guess I messed up my profile data somehow by deleting those posts.

Great app I enjoy the fact that in the app it tells you a food is high in vitamin C or protein, but also tell you if the food is high in bad things like sodium. I also appreciate the micros, it will show how much of fat, carbohydrates, and protein you‚Äôve consumed that day. So if you‚Äôre trying to up your protein it will show how much percentage of protein you consumed. It really helps when thinking about healthy food choices and what you should eat to reach your goals.

Used to be an Amazing App Update June 2018: after 4 conservative years of using this app, I can say I‚Äôve never had as many issues as I have over the past month. Constant sync issues with Fitbit, lost data, and continually having to delink-relink the apps. So frustrating.

Login issues This app is great, other than the fact that after it force logged me out, it will not let me access my account anymore. I‚Äôve attempted password resets, using other passwords, logging in with my other email... I‚Äôve had to go as far to contact the makers for help. DO NOT use Facebook as a login. Once it logs you out, you can‚Äôt get back in. There are login bugs that need to be fixed with this app. When I looked this issue up online, I came across a big forum with login issues. So just be aware that this is a possibility with this app.

Poor dysfunctional app I‚Äôve used this app years ago, and it was wonderful. I never had any problems with pulling up recipes, different foods, calorie counts etc. This latest version has me baffled because every time I attempt to look up different recipes and food items I get the ‚Äúoffline mode‚Äù can‚Äôt seem to figure out how to make this app functional. I‚Äôve deleted this app over and over and then reinstalled over and over, still to be dysfunctional. And... everything I attempt to give feedback, I‚Äôm prompted to come up with a ‚Äúnickname‚Äù to submit this. Every ‚Äúnickname‚Äù I‚Äôve chosen has been taken! Go figure!

Great weight and health management tool My weight loss stalled with about 40 lbs to go. A friend of mine suggested I use a food logging app to help. Once I started logging my meals, I lost weight consistently. 105 lbs total so far. I am maintaining my weight and using myfitnesspal daily. It not only tracks calories and macros, but let‚Äôs me see if I am getting some key nutrients. I recommend this app to anyone wanting to improve their health.

Lost 40# with this app I've used this app for over 4 years. Its convenient interface and features have helped me adopt healthy habits and lose 40# that I have kept off for more than 4 years. I tried several similar apps that I quickly abandoned. This is the one that works well, and I've used it to log my calories and exercise every day for over 4 years.

One problem... I used to love this app. But now it is very very glitchy and I barely use it because the all of the glitches bother me a lot and it makes it frustrating to use the app. Sometimes it doubles my food. It always takes a long time to move from date to date and the daily calorie consumption sometimes never shows. When I want to add something it glitches when I click on add food and when I add it, it takes a while to show up which is then followed by more glitches. This app used to be flawless. It used to never glitch. But now it is impossible to use this app.

Calorie Adjustment issue I‚Äôve been using this app for years and really like it. I recently purchase an Apple Watch and appreciate the constant connection of my exercise with the app. One area I‚Äôve found that is flawed is when I workout twice in one day, the adjustment feature goes out of wack. I burned over 500 calories in two walks and the system subtracted my calories from days allotment instead of adding calories to use.

This app slaps hard like no other This app is so helpful and I was so happy when I found out I can stop tracking everything on paper or in my notes! There is a premium but I just use the basics which works just fine. It has all the basics you need, it saves so much time and thinking, and helps you the most out of any other app I‚Äôve tried, in my opinion:)

Good Tracker There are a couple quality of life improvements for this to remain up to date with alternatives like lose it. A watch complication would be good, especially if it showed which meals were completed for the day. And there widget should support dark mode, as well as being able to add into meals directly from it. Also, sometimes notifications are hit or miss, and I‚Äôm not sure why. Fix those, and it‚Äôs the best.

Makes it easy to track This app does everything you need it to. In my opinion the only downfall is that it doesn‚Äôt log calories burned for strength/weight training. It only logs calories for cardio. It used to sync to my Fitbit and log the calories from my workouts but it no longer does, unsure of this is due to Fitbit or MyFitnessPal though. EDIT to reduce to 3 stars. The lag time has been awful and I see from other reviews that it doesn‚Äôt sync to any apps anymore which caused my Fitbit issue.

Amazing, easy to use This app is da bomb. I was only looking for a food diary app. This is one of the slickest I‚Äôve ever seen or could imagine: It automates so much that diary keeping is easy, and even includes a barcode scanner to pull in nutritional information.

Login bug Been using MFP for years but it seems to get slower with each update. A couple updates back it would begin to end your session if you had been out of the app for ‚Äútoo long‚Äù or the lock screen was up, and now I have to login every. single. Time. It‚Äôs so tedious to wait for the app to load that I‚Äôve plain forgotten about doing it multiple times (which is contradictory to it‚Äôs purpose, no?) anyway- looking to switch u less these things can be changed.

Track everything and lose weight I track every meal, snack and step.  I love how it pairs with Apple Watch and iPhone for step tracking (I wear an automatic watch during the workday and Apple Watch to the gym).  I‚Äôm able to visualize a direct correlation between consumption, exercise and weight loss.  This app is great and I always wear Under Armour gym clothes too!  They should give us exclusive Under Armour discounts for weight loss.

Love it, but...... My go to app for weight lose. The only frustration is my Apple Watch workouts don‚Äôt alway pair. After doing digging, I found out why. I log my workouts as HIIT on my watch when I do Orange Theory and there isn‚Äôt a HIIT workout title in MFP so it doesn‚Äôt push it over, which is weird since HIIT work outs are a common thing. I had to start using running which isn‚Äôt 100% accurate, when in Orange Theory there is strength training too. Other than that I love the app.

Would be 4 stars but snarky notifications are unnecessary I use the app to track steps and calories burned (likely not accurate, I know), occasionally for tracking meals. Have turned off notifications but will still get reminders to add meals or weigh in and ignore. The devs at MFP decided to shame their users by throwing up a notification that reads, ‚ÄúThese reminders don‚Äôt seem helpful, we‚Äôll stop sending them.‚Äù

Overall good but lots of freezing lately.. Love all of the features on this app and have found it very helpful, however, the app has been freezing up a lot lately. I've tried giving it time to unfreeze, closing and restarting the app, nothing works except closing it and coming back a few minutes later. Not sure what's going on but it'd be nice if that could be fixed!  (And yes I do have all updates installed)

New version is a lot harder to see. I have used MyFitnessPal for years and love the functionality. However, the newest version is much harder to see. I love the part where you can flip your phone over to landscape view and see all kinds of stats about what you‚Äôre tracking. It‚Äôs very customizable. But now, with no color change between the totals and the individual items ‚Äì it‚Äôs much harder to use. I hope they decide to change that in the next version.
From walking train wreck to the best shape in my life. MFP was recommended by my doc six months ago. The toughest part is the setting up. MFP tracks your calories and nutrition for the day.

Definitely Helping I have been using the app for three months and have lost five to seven pounds.  I‚Äôm seeing a downward trend even though some days my weight goes up a bit.  If I stick to the 1,200 calories the weight will come off.  I‚Äôm 65 so the weight comes off more slowly.  I have ten more to lose.  Im going to keep using it even when I reach my goal so I don‚Äôt gain it all back.

The Key to Success The MyFitnessPal has been the key to my success. I‚Äôve now been using it for 10 months without skipping a day and where I am now is due to this app and how easy it is to use. Is it perfect? No. But what it offers and its functionality is enough to keep things moving along. It is not the end all but it is a great way to keep track of your day-to-day.

Recent changes - unskippable ads with sound I‚Äôve been using this app for years, I love how it integrates with so many other applications and has a good food nutrition database. However, recently I‚Äôll have the app open to log meals, and this loud, choppy music comes on from some kind of ad I assume. I say ‚ÄúI assume‚Äù because the video is nowhere to be seen, but is just blaring this annoying music with no sign of how to mute it. So I have to close the app and re-open it just to get the annoying music to stop.

Data Breach? I haven‚Äôt really used it. It didn‚Äôt seem to help with my particular situations and necessary eating habits and restrictions. I got it on the recommendation of my doctor. I don‚Äôt remember when I last used it or when I deleted it. I just got a notification from my credit card company who also monitors my credit and the dark web. They said my personal information was detected on the dark web, including my password. I don‚Äôt remember what information I had on there. I‚Äôm not happy with the makers of this app for not notifying me that they screwed up and didn‚Äôt keep my info safe or ever tell me.

App doesn't reflect updated macros I really used to love this app. I am beginning a new diet.. High protein, low carb. I updated my macros, but they do not reflect in the app when I turn it into landscape view. This is making things very difficult!! üò†

Great but not syncing HIIT Apple Watch workouts. I love the app, use it everyday! My biggest complaint though is it does not pick up my HIIT workouts from my Apple Watch.  Let‚Äôs say I log a Run, that will automatically pop up in my daily journal without doing anything. But the High Intensity Interval Training does not, therefore I have to manually add that workout in.  If someone knows how to fix, please let me know!! :)

It works I did this app faithfully for 5 weeks and i lost 25lbs!! Because i didnt cheat! i put everything in i was eatting even a snack! It made me think 2xs about what i was putting in my mouth and made me make better choices because i only had 1200 for the day! So i would pick high protein choices and didnt waste my cals on junk! I lerned how to eat better and stay full! It works if u are dedicatedüòâ

Do not love the update New update clogs up the app with ads for their premium app upgrade, clutters screen with unusable functions (unless you upgrade) and puts more and bigger ads all over the place. Harder to find where you need to input calories and exercise. I used to love this app and recommend it all the time... I think I may have to change my recommendation. Trying a new app with a fitness tracker. I don‚Äôt need to pay $50/year for ‚Äúpremium‚Äù calorie counting, I can do it with a notebook! Only good thing is the extensive calorie database. I am very disappointed.

Application Restrictions I love this app. I didn‚Äôt realize how much I would mindlessly eat until I stopped tracking it. I had a Fitbit and the best part was when my steps and workouts would sync with MyFitnessPal. Then, I got an Apple Watch. There‚Äôs no synchronization. I slowly stopped logging in MyFitnessPal and that‚Äôs where things go down hill, quick! My one hope for the future is some sort of synchronization with the Apple Watch‚Äôs exercise application.

The goals aren‚Äôt customizable for pregnancy I‚Äôve used this app for over a year and a half and recommend it to all my friends. It‚Äôs helped me lose over 50lbs, but now that I am pregnant my calorie intake is different and I‚Äôm unable to customize it to fit my needs. I would love to give it 5 stars but this is a little inconvenient considering how big this app is in my life. I hope they do an update or maybe have a separate app for fit pregnant women.
Great app! This app has worked great in helping me reach my goal of eating healthy. I love the ability to scan foods and easily input items that might not have labels.

Tracking Progress Daily I love this app! I have enjoyed the large directory for finding foods that I eat. The accountability of tracking my daily food intake has helped me to keep my eyes on the prize. Great reminder for emotional eaters, ‚Äú you will have to account for that snack...‚Äù I just wish I could figure out how to get my friends added. I‚Äôm struggling with that even after countless efforts adding them.

Bad app I used app for years and my local grocery store has items this app claims they have. I ate a salad no idea it nutrition stats and this food tracking app doesn‚Äôt have it. If you don‚Äôt live in a massively popular area with everything in this app don‚Äôt download this app doesn‚Äôt have everything every location has go elsewhere like I‚Äôm. This app deserves to pay me for my wasted time searching endlessly for what food I ate. I do serious food journal wanting exact results and this app failed if your app wants me to stay and give a better review please contact me.

Was great... but now... Not So Much! The app automatically logged me out. After doing what the ‚Äúhelp‚Äù section recommends on the website, I still could not access my account!!  I done the next reasonable thing.. I went and attempting submit a email to the company.
Dissatisfied The app is good for logging food, recipes, etc.

Great App My friend told me about this and I decided to try it. So far this has been great app and has really helped me keep on track with food consumption and exercise. Love that you can scan food for instant additions and tracking. Also great integration with many foods and services like Hello Fresh. Overall this has been a 5 star experience and I'll continue to use for foreseeable future.

Lost 20 pounds in 6 months thanks to MFP! They always say slow and steady wins the race--MFP has helped me lose weight and keep it off! I have always crash dieted, to no success or reverse success, and then I finally decided to try counting calories using My Fitness Pal. They make it so easy with the scanning portion, it's almost like a game. I'm going to keep using this app as I continue my weight loss journey. Thanks My Fitness Pal!

author_name: It was all for the one
review_body: Good App but glitches for iPad I like the app but it quite often doesn‚Äôt respond to me touching the finished check button when I want to add a food and it will very often freeze all together and I need to close the app and restart it to get it to work. All of this is very annoying. I prefer to use the iPad app since the iPhone version you have to turn your phone to the side to check the macros and the desktop version does not have auto fill when you want to add a food.

Probably the best App of its kind. I recently purchased this App and I have to say I absolutely love it. It is very intuitive and powerful! I have not yet read the operational instructions (which I did not find to be necessary because the App is so easy to use), nor about the App‚Äôs full capabilities yet, but so far so! After I have had a chance to fully review and use the App, I will return and write a full review.

Advertising out of control The advertising is out of control. Every time you click now to log an exercise an add comes up that you have to X out of prior to being able to log activity. I think this is extremely deterring in accurately logging. I‚Äôve loved this app for years. I feel now, doing something good is now punishable from bs advertising. And or forcing you to upgrade and pay for premium. I will not be forced to do anything except find a different and or better accountability app. Fix now or you‚Äôll lose more....

Technical issues The app is good, and has helped me lose weight, but it‚Äôs very frustrating at times. In fact lately I haven‚Äôt wanted to track because I don‚Äôt want to deal with the weird glitches.

My new Best Friend... I love everything about this app... it‚Äôs changed my life and my mind still working out again and again thanks for letting me take care of myself and thanks for letting me know how much I appreciate it and thanks again for your help and thanks for your support and thanks for understanding me too... I appreciate this app it save my lifestyle for my family and friends and I.

Excellent app, responsive developers Finding and entering foods is very fast and they build in all sorts of shortcuts to make it easier than any other app I've used. The social aspect of the app is a nice touch, too.

Gentle reminders MyFitnessPal is helping me to keep in control of my calorie intake. It keeps me honest and does not allow me to forget that gingerbread cookie that was so delicious. As long as I log all my meals and snacks, I cannot forget about what I consume. It is not that I feel guilty about the foods in my diet. It is just that my forgetfulness often leads to over eating. MyFitnessPal is like my workout buddy and gently reminds me of my fitness goals.

Horrible Design At first, this app seemed convenient and easy to use. However, after using it for a few days I noticed that the nutrients it was reporting were completely wrong. They underreported the amount of several nutrients I was eating, and over reported others. Some foods must be incorrectly entered into their database, making this app pretty useless. They also try to force you to pick food from your history rather than from their database, which is extremely frustrating. This app also does not allow you to change the serving/portion size of any food you want to enter... Why?!

Needs improvements Bought the full version years ago before it was an app! I‚Äôm willing to buy the app but only after some changes. Net carbs are important to the majority of people doing low carb and Keto. Make it so please! Also on the nutrition breakdown I cannot see the details because everything overlaps the line above or below! I‚Äôd like to see what I‚Äôm doing in detail.
Went way downhill It used to be a GREAT app. I have used it for years.

Completely broken and unusable I‚Äôve been using this app for three years now. The last month, every time I try to log in it crashes the app the first attempt, gives me an error the second attempt and tells me my account is deleted, then works and lets me in on my third attempt. Thought this was just a weird glitch until I decided to reinstall today, updated my password, logged in, and discovered that everything I had logged for the last month had not been saved. What‚Äôs the point of this if it doesn‚Äôt actually function? Fix your bugs.
Easy app to count calories I have been using the free app for about 5 days now and find it perfect for counting my calories.

Keeps me honest! I have used this app for many, many years.  Began my weight loss story before finding this app. (Initial loss of 30 lbs., with an additional 10 to follow).  Maintenance is the secret to weight loss success - for me, this app helps keep me honest.  The food diary/exercise schedule this app promotes is simple to follow and allows me to plan my daily calorie allotment.  I especially love that it tracks my nutritional input.
Amazing App I am a very big fan of MyFitnessPal. I‚Äôve been using it for over a year, and can‚Äôt say enough good things about it. I‚Äôve used it to
Recipe Sharing as a option would be great The app works great for tracking calories! The data base is huge and I‚Äôve never ran into a problem when scanning a food product.

Excellent information & easy to use Tracking food is simple and convenient with this app. Once you build in your daily dinners, it makes it easy when you have that dinner again. I found after the first two weeks that I am so use to tracking my food. The stats available are helpful for tracking trends, and I love how it syncs with Fitbit!

Female diet needs I absolutely love this app. I have used it off and on for at least 5 years and everytime it motivates me and helps me loose weight. I am writing this review because I think there should be a way to connect the app with a period tracker such as Flo to create more accurate predictions for what macro and micro nutrients a woman should consume while on different stages of her cycle, as well as caloric intake (if that is effected).

Loved it till the last update I will start by saying I have been a LONG TIME user of my fitness pal. It is the app I recommend every single time I have a friend ask for a food log. That being said, the last update is awful. The look of the app is not user friendly which i could admittedly adjust to. But the fact you took the totals at the bottom of my day away and only show me my goal and the difference. AWFUL. Talk about not user friendly at all. Needless to say, unless this changes back I will be shopping for another food diary app.

It is super great I wish there was a share feature for the recipes part. I make a bunch of stuff at home from scratch and my boyfriend and I share meals, I wish I could share them so we don‚Äôt have to copy it down all the time. He‚Äôs more into the macros then I am.

Good In Theory; Terrible in Practice I used MyFitness Pal for many years when it still wasn‚Äôt littered with ads. I‚Äôve downloaded and searched for many different calorie trackers but none have as comprehensive a service as MFP. However the UI is terrible. Terrible! It‚Äôs not intuitive and filled with too many pages to hide ads in. I would love it if the ads weren‚Äôt too intrusive and if the interface was more simple. I would upgrade but the price is far too steep. I‚Äôm disappointed as MFP has changed from focus on proper nutrition to corporate gain. Very disappointed.

Literally my fitness pal I can't believe I paid for weight watchers when this app is just as effective. I would recommend this to anyone that wants to get healthy and fit. It does take self discipline to make sure you log your meals and stay within your calorie count. The reminders are a little annoying, but that's something you can turn off.

Weight loss working By keeping daily track of what I put in my mouth I am supporting my weight loss goals. MyFitnessPal is making me more conscious of what I consume and the value of what it is that I am feeding my body. Increasing my Cardio and Weight training coupled with my food tracking has me on a good start for 2018! Looking good and feeling good! My goal is a bikini by Spring Break with my family. I will be 48 in March and defying the clock

Good, but not great. Why are the recipes that pop up in my feed in the data base?   It seems like a no brained that you should be able to add these right from the video in to your food diary.  Also, I rated only 2 stars because the ‚Äúupgrade to Premium‚Äù messaging is too much.   I get it...you want me to upgrade to a paid subscription.  From what I can tell the Premium features are of no interest to me so there should be a way to say ‚Äúno thanks‚Äù to the upgrade and get rid of all the Premium upgrade buttons all over the app.  It‚Äôs super annoying!

Paid, but won‚Äôt access I paid for premium back in October 2017, but have never been able to access premium features. Got frustrated, and gave up. Now counting macros and could really use the app, and even though it says I‚Äôve paid, still not able to access premium features. So frustrated...I did my part and paid...but can‚Äôt get what I paid for. Googled...and it appears this is a common issue.

Love it I have been using this app for over 7 years. I try to track my weight at least twice a week. As I see it creep up, I log in my diet for a few days. The calorie tracker is easy to use. I keep gaining and losing the same ten pounds. But at least it has kept my weight relatively stable. Also great for tracking steps. I‚Äôm a physician and I recommend this app to everyone.

Not at all helpful if II don‚Äôt have a barcode to scan If you make your own food, you better know all the nutritional information for that food you‚Äôve made, because this app doesn‚Äôt have a search function where you can find similar foods.

Best app to keep track & weight goals Were it not for myfitnesspal I wouldnt be 24lbs down and the closest to my goal than ive ever been my entire adult life. this app is great at tracking food consumption with regard to calories and macros, also water intake, fitness, and step counting although its to too accurate in steps. You manage it according to your weight goals and it sets a daily caloric limit.

Dissatisfied So you guys send me an email that my personal information was leaked due to your negligence...I respond with questions and I am completely ignored. I try to delete my account twice now and my password miraculously isn‚Äôt working...twice your site claims to send a password reset email and yet nothing. I‚Äôm thinking this is not a coincidence and you‚Äôre hoping I‚Äôll forget about the email and continue to use your services.

Been so helpful I‚Äôve always had a hard time loosing weight! Ever since I started using my fitness pal, I have been doing just that slowly but surely! Looking up food is super easy and by keeping the journal it really helps keep me accountable. You can do so much on the free app, which normally isn‚Äôt the case! I‚Äôve been using the app for almost a year and it‚Äôs my favorite fitness app!!

Awesome with Gamin Connect app and Fenix5 Watch I got a Garmin Fenix 5 watch last week and proceeded to download the Garmin Connect app and the MyFitnessPal app. They all combine to help monitor my activity, eating habits and ultimately what I need to modify to achieve my health goals. It accurately tracks what I eat by simply searching the food and informs me of progress daily. Definitely recommend and highly suggest a GPS smart watch (Garmin Fenix5) to maximize the total benefit!

Myfitness Pal App I really love this app. It helps me to be mindful of what I eat and ‚Äúremembers‚Äù frequent foods/drinks I eat. I also like that I can see nutrition breakdown, add weight, and get estimates of what my weight would be if I continued on the trend, etc. And the ‚Äúmultiple add‚Äù of various foods simultaneously caused to choose this app over another one. One thing I would add is the option to take photos of a meal. That would be awesome!

I LOVE THIS APP!! This app has been so easy to use and I‚Äôve lost 20 lbs! Even without the premium, this app has made me feel healthy, happy, and be more aware of what I eat and why I should or shouldn‚Äôt be eating it. It‚Äôs also helped my reach my personal goals by allowing me to set and track my micros and gives access to little informational videos. 10/10 I completely recommend!

Get back on track I love using this app when I need to get myself back on track. Sometimes your aren‚Äôt honest with yourself and the calories you consume- this helps you face reality and face facts that what you think your eating vs what they really are. This helps you tack and be honest without self and get back on the right track. It‚Äôs free and so helpful- can‚Äôt recommend it enough!

Can‚Äôt add to My Foods Y‚Äôall have changed something. I used to be able to just flag or mark a food as a Favorite or My Food while I was in the database, at the same time that I save it to the Diary. Now I cannot figure out how to do it. Consequently, every time I search the a database for a food I‚Äôve used a lot, I have to start from scratch to find it again. There used to be a Recent category too that called up foods I‚Äôve recently. It‚Äôs a real pain now logging foods into the Diary. Please fix this.

Only consistent thing in my life. I‚Äôve used this app off and on for several years now and every time I take a break and come back, it‚Äôs like riding a bicycle. Plus I have yet to find a barcode that does scan and pull up the information for that food.

Basic features didn't work...switched to Cronometer I've used this infrequently for several years.  Started again a week ago...literally almost nothing works.  Want to add a custom food item? It disappears.  Want to create a custom recipe based on those custom food items?  Nope.  Also, it doesn't track net carbs (fiber is on another screen). And, it doesn't track micronutrients (vitamins/minerals) that I can tell.  I asked for a refund for my Premium account membership & switched to Cronometer...that thing is awesome, detailed, accurate, and basic features...actually...work.  And, it's perfect for keto (tracking macros).

Precise Location Tracking Everytime you open the app, it will prompt you to give up precise location tracking. Why? Not for any set features but to sell your data to marketers. Enough! There is no option to turn this off completely, only an option remind me later. I don‚Äôt want to be tracked by my calorie counter.

Works great for me This is the second time in 6 years that I‚Äôve used My Fitness Pal.  Both times I lost 15 plus pounds.  I started this year on Jan 7 at 200 and have been maintaining 185 or less for about 6 months.  Takes minutes to enter my data and encourages me to be aware of calories consumed.  I also sync it with my Garmin Vivofit for an even better experience.

Exercise penalty bug It‚Äôs a great app except it adds exercise calories to your daily intake instead of adding them to daily allowance (or subtracting from intake). I have to do the math in my head and it always looks like my intake is over my allowance for the day, which is a bit demoralizing for someone like me, who has a hard enough time finding the self discipline to use the app. Otherwise it integrates very nicely with iPhone‚Äôs health app and the Fitbit app.
Great when it syncs, terribly frustrating when it doesn‚Äôt. It seems about once a month, there are syncing issues between MFP and Fitbit.

Maybe it‚Äôs me I had to delete the app. t I didn‚Äôt enter √† dinner. I entered it the morning after. However,  my entry was attached to today‚Äôs dinner. Afterward, I saw that I could go back to yesterday, but not clear if I have the option of entering my missing dinner.

Great until latest update The last update killed this app. The changes were rather extreme and not the least helpful. Trying to track specific things now is a nuisance and not worth the hassle. I used to be able to be able to adjust what I see on the main tracking page - fiber and sodium was of a couple of them I had for easy tracking. Now I have to constantly go back and forth between the nutrition and the main tracking page to see my overall sodium and fiber intake - it‚Äôs tedious. I‚Äôll definitely be looking for a new app if things don‚Äôt improve.

Reliable, Efficient, and Excellent!! Can‚Äôt say enough about the app!! It‚Äôs user-friendly, detailed, and equipped with great features! I just wish you could change the order of how logged foods show up, like sliding them up and down the list for meals instead of having to remove and re-scan the previous foods (a tad OCD, I know, but still). It‚Äôs a great app otherwise!

author_name: Poor as Rich is taken. LOL
review_body: Weight loss Using this program keeps me on track to lose the pounds and reminds me I‚Äôm slipping when I ease off my eating habits as the pounds creep up. Every time I‚Äôm serious with this program and walking for exercise the pounds drop. I‚Äôm over 50 lbs lighter and much healthier as my BP is in the normal to elevated and without the two drugs I was on for the past six plus years, finally. It is a fantastic aid!

Not as proud as I once was. I normally would have given My Fitness Pal a five star review, but all of a sudden it quit picking up my exercise from my Fitbit.  I‚Äôve done everything trying to get it to reconnect. Disconnected it from the Fitibt App and even deleted it and reinstalled it.  It just is not picking up my Fitbit.  I still use it to count my calories.  If not for that, it would be worthless to me.

I love it! What an awesome feature would it be if we could add a mark, like a rating to every meal - are we satisfied about it in specific way. Maybe its a meal you cooked home and it makes you proud, or you managed to make it 100% vegan or else. I think adding a little star in the line with calorie number will make personal meaning for everyone, I would use it for sure üòä

Great app This app has helped me achieve weight loss that I felt was not possible. Since I no longer have a fully functioning thyroid, weight loss has been extremely hard, even as a physically active and diet conscious person, it has been a struggle. This app allowed me to pinpoint exactly how many calories I could consume in order to lose weight. I highly recommend it.

Change not for the better The recent change for finding food on the ‚Äòhistory‚Äô list could be great, but the default setting is ‚Äòmost recent‚Äô.  I prefer the A‚ÄîZ option.  Every time one adds a food, the ‚Äòmost recent‚Äô comes up, even if you moments before the default had been changed to A‚ÄîZ.  It seems that it would be easy to program a personal preference for the default.  It‚Äôs done when choosing a ‚Äòserving‚Äô for food.  Why not for history?

Love it and a nice tool This has nice features and ease of use. You can sync this app with Fitbit app and will adjust calories based on activity. I did4 stars instead of five because the app use to have a feature of just adding calories and that is longer available. I liked that feature for when an item wasn't in the data base and I could just add the calorie amount. Otherwise a very useful app to support a healthy diet.

Lost 30lbs in 4 and 1/2 months. Started in june and haven't looked back. I weighed in at 195lbs (pretty much all fat) and now I weigh 165. This app counts my steps whenever it's not even on so whenever I'm done with a long walk I see how much calories i've earned. I set my goal to two pounds a week and i've basically hit my goal every week. This app is so easy to use and is a necessity for me everyday.

The best app for weight loss or just good nutrition Starting using the app to reduce my sodium intake. Two years later, I‚Äôm down 40lbs. Now I‚Äôm paying attention to potassium, calcium and fiber. Didn‚Äôt realize I wasn‚Äôt getting enough. I‚Äôm off of Facebook and have made new friends on the MFP app. I check in many times a day to know how many steps I make and how many calories it bought me. Love this app!

Easy to use, lots of foods saved for entry look up Love the scanning option and the nutrition wheel to monitor balance of macros. I also like being able to track my nutrient intake like calcium and iron. Overall pretty easy to use and has a good library of foods available, but the calorie content varies a lot if you have to look something up. That makes it hard to be accurate sometimes, but overall it's a good app.

Great but not perfect This is a great tool to help you with monitoring your intake but not so good on you‚Äôre outtake. It is logged into my iPhone so it automatically take the steps from my iPhone, however my iPhone is not always with me and therefore it does not log all my steps. There is a variety of pedometer apps you can link to, however it does not except mine which is the VeryFitPro. Needs to have the capability to search for various pedometer apps.

Still learning how to use I am on day 3 of tracking with this app and still finding my way around each feature. My biggest issue right now is trying to add my walking as an exercise. The app has prebuilt and has gives no opportunity to edit- such as I walk each morning and usually around 1.5 miles and a moderate pace (so abt 20 minutes). The app only lets me add in the prebuilt which doesn‚Äôt match my routine. And if I try to add it only asks for duration and calories burned! I have no idea how to answer that one!

Food tracker is great! Love the fact that I can scan the product and it will automatically feed in the nutrition facts.  Saves me time from entering it in manually.  And, it also has the nutrition for restaurants!

Great improvements to logging calories but crashes constantly I applaud the improved options such as scanning barcodes, and the larger community has logged quite a few items, which makes things easier. But operating on 11.4.1? Maybe it‚Äôs just my iPhone 8, but this app crashes CONSTANTLY, particularly when I‚Äôm entering a new item for the first time. As a result, I frequently only can enter the calorie count and not the nutritional information, which benefits nobody... Please get this back to basic operating level! I love your app and want it to shine.

Love but.. I‚Äôve been using this app for years and I love it. however, for the past 6 months, the app will randomly slow down, glitch, and shut down. In the middle of logging, making notes, and checking my macros, it will shut down and have to start up all over again so i can see my macros! it‚Äôs very inconvenient! And now, it will not allow me to upload a progress picture with my weight. These things need to be fixed to be an effective app.

Weight Loss 101 This app is amazing, it makes losing weight so much simpler. There‚Äôs nearly nothing to do when you use this app, it does all the work for you. It‚Äôs a great way to see exactly how many calories you eat or can eat in one day!! I haven‚Äôt been on in and while and they‚Äôve made some great changes! It feels good to back on track again!! Thank you MyFitnessPal!! üòä

What happened? Love the app but suddenly it will not allow me to log in. I always logged in previously via Facebook. Now it won‚Äôt connect. Can‚Äôt even connect via user name and password. It wants me to sign up all over again and I‚Äôve been using the app for nearly 6 months. If I have to start over again, I‚Äôll just begin with a different app.

Helps keep me motivated! I have struggled with my weight since I got sick in my early 30‚Äôs. Before that I never had any issues with my weight or with food. Now it seems like everything I eat sticks to my mid section like a fly to fly paper. It‚Äôs imperative for me to keep track of my daily calories in order not to gain pounds. This app makes this task very easy. Highly Recommended!

Steps disappear One of the major issues that annoys me the most is when I use map my walk and it updates MyFitnessPal on the calories I‚Äôve burned, and it decides to drop any other calories I burned with my steps before I went on that walk. I walked 1,500 steps before I decided to go for a walk and track it, but now it‚Äôs saying that those 1,500 steps counted for nothing and dropped the calories burned from those to zero.

Great! Only one complaint I love the app, it does everything I need it to.  The only small complaint is that 30 minutes after I log my meal.  It reminds me that I have not yet logged my meal.  If I don‚Äôt log the meal, I don‚Äôt get a reminder. If I log early, 30 minutes later, don‚Äôt forget to log your meal. If I log late, 30 minutes later, you haven‚Äôt logged your ‚Äòmeal‚Äô today.

Great app. When it works which is 50/50. Several bugs in the app causing it to constantly freeze and crash while adding food, workouts from Apple Watch and wahoo  sync maybe one of every three times.  App needs an update. Bugs fixed, dark mode, better reliability.  LiveStrong My Plate has all the above and works flawlessly. The only thing keeping me from switching is My Fitness Pal has a much larger database of foods. Otherwize I‚Äôd be switching. I hope with the next version I can change my review to 5 starts but for now it a 2 star app.

Convenient All these diet fabs out there never work for me, but I have found out that monitoring my calorie intake is the best thing for me, and being able to put your desired goal and MyFitnessPal telling how many calories you have for the day really helps. So far I‚Äôm down 7 lbs in 4 weeks, just the pace that I wanted from MyFitnessPal. Thank you so much MyFitnessPal, you‚Äôre a blessing.

Need to be able to add calories burned for resistance training Just about everyone these days that uses an app like this also uses some type of fitness tracker like a fitbit or Apple Watch. They are able to track their calories burned through a plethora of different types of workouts other than cardio workouts. In this app, you should be able to add calories burned for resistance or strength training to be able to adjust your caloric intake just as the app does if you add a cardio workout.

Good, but recent bugs are killing it For some reason the app keeps resetting my calories, and other nutritional goals with a mind of it‚Äôs own. I am supposed to maintain weight at 2,350 calories, after inputting my info, goals, and activity level which comes out to 2,350cals. Then randomly after a couple days the app just changes that to 1,850cals, and also deletes the nutritional goals I manually set for certain other nutrients (mono and poly fats) back to 0 grams. Prior to this it was working fine.
Great App but... I so want to give this 5 stars. Ive been using it for years and it‚Äôs truly helped to keep me accountable to myself.

Needs a little tweaking Overall a great app. Takes some time to get around the glitches between strava and garmin device data. At times it will double up the amount of reported cardio so you‚Äôll have to go in and modify manually for accurate calorie and in/output. I would recommend this app for all kinds of use and monitoring if you need the help from a friend, nutritionist, or if you‚Äôre just plain competitive!

Short on features Good for day to day tracking. MFP has helped me lose weight and get better control of my blood sugar. However, want to export your data for your doctor's use?  That will cost you at least $50 a year.  (Seems like extortion just to get MY data!)  Even then only a small portion of the info you have entered can be exported. (The details of food entered for each meal does not export.)  I have used MFP for several years but am now looking for a more user friendly app.

I've been using this for years. Love it. This is a great app for tracking calories. There are user submitted entries that you have to take with a grain of salt but it's mostly a huge convenience to have those in there. The "frequently eaten" tab never seems to work correctly for me, and some of the notifications of streaks seem inaccurate but overall it's excellent.

I used to love this app, but... I used to use this app every day, and it helped me lose 80 lbs. however, since I got a new phone and re downloaded the app, I can't log in. It keeps saying that I don't have an account, but when I try to sign up for a new account it says that my email is already on an existing account. So frustrating. I have tried 4 or 5 times over the last 3 years to log in or set up an account, but it has never been fixed. I would still give it 5 stars if I could just log in, but it looks like I will never be able to use the app again.

Easy to use but difficult to understand some features I‚Äôm having difficulty understanding the negative calorie calculation.  This is a function i chose to enable to get a better read on my net calories available; however i can‚Äôt find an explanation on why i only got credit for 325 calories after a 7.2 mile brisk walk.  Besides that it‚Äôs easy to use & has a huge database of food & exercise available.

Not enough customization The whole tracking experience is tied to brands and I wasn‚Äôt able to find an option to track custom made food like salads or even home cooked food with multiple ingredients which makes all nutrition tracking useless. Example: I ordered custom salad from Sweet Green and wasn‚Äôt able to take advantage of tracking all goodness in it. I would also appreciate better integration with Map My Run, I exercise 5 times a week and it was totally ignored in this app that doesn‚Äôt allow me to track my progress.

Awesome app! I recently quit Weight Watchers because their new format was not working for me. Not only is this app more user friendly than WW‚Äôs, but seeing the nutrient breakdown of foods is helping me pick even better choices for my meals! Oh, and I LOVE how you can import recipes within seconds to your food profile! Awesome awesome awesome! I lost weight & broke my three month plateau my first week using this app! Love it! :)

Great app - one suggestion I love this app.  The only thing I would add to it, since it appears the right components may already be there:  when I‚Äôve filled in my food for half to two-thirds of the day, and I have a few calories remaining, I‚Äôd like an area where I could turn for suggested foods fitting within my remaining calories. The suggested food would also help better align my remaining carbs, protein and fat for the day.  Keep up the good work!

BigEW My daughter downloaded this app and used it to lose over 50 pounds!  In just one week I‚Äôm down 7 lbs.  The breakfast, lunch, dinner and snack section is super simple to use because every brand name grocery store food item you can buy or anything you cook at home from scratch is broken down for you by serving size in cups, ounces, liters and grams.  Makes tracking your calorie intake effortless.

Great app! I‚Äôve been using Lifesum, MyPlate, and My Fitness Pal for a while trying to determine which works best for me. I‚Äôve decided MyFitnessPal has the most features that I use regularly of the 3 apps. It would be greatly improved if they would allow you to favorite foods that you eat regularly for fast tracking. The only way I see to do this right now would be to add each food to my foods, which is time-consuming.

Not tracking my Fitbit I‚Äôve had MFP and my Fitbit linked for about 2 weeks now and yesterday I noticed that it would stop tracking my steps and calories burned like mid day. It‚Äôs really annoying because at work I don‚Äôt know my progress. So, I have to go home, log out of them on my phone and get on the MFP website and unlink them and then get on my phone and log back in and hope it works. Idk what‚Äôs going on or if anyone else is having this issue but it‚Äôs really a hassle.
Crashing! Constantly crashing I am not sure why.. it is up to date and the only app that has crashed.

This app is more about weight loss, not fitness Fitness at it's most basic is a quantifiable approach to health. You can track your fitness by what acts you can perform and by what measurement. It seems this app focuses purely on weight loss. While that can be a good thing, I think in 2019 the focus of a self-described fitness app should be on fitness, including strength training; not diet and weight loss.

Stop ‚Äúfixing‚Äù it I was already unhappy with the changes to adding food it used to be easy to find frequent foods and would even let me swipe to add the previous days lunch. Now searching for food is more complicated and it should be easier I‚Äôve been using this app for years. And now I‚Äôm getting weird audio ads that you can‚Äôt find in order to mute it and it sounds like it‚Äôs more that one ad at once. I‚Äôm pretty much ready to delete at this point ‚òπÔ∏è

Really liking it so far I was kind of skeptical about this app at first especially because it took me a while to get the knack of logging in foods and excercise calories. But I actually found that it made me much more aware of what I‚Äôm eating and how it effects calorie count.  I‚Äôve lost 5 lbs already in a little over a week and I‚Äôm hoping to stick with it and lose more.ü§û

What gets measured gets improved Day 30 of Whole30 today. I don‚Äôt think I was losing weight for first 2 weeks, then started tracking calories and fat/protein/carbs with My Fitness Pal‚Äînoticeable difference in just 2 weeks! I didn‚Äôt know how bad I was eating but now my habits are improving, and constantly being refined to make me feel better. Works great with Map My Run by Underarmour.

My goodness I decided I didn‚Äôt want this app, I just didn‚Äôt feel like I needed it and that it just wasn‚Äôt a good fit for me. When I tried to delete my account it said I had the wrong password even though I signed in using the same password just a few minutes ago. I even reset my password and tried again, and no luck. I tried several, countless times to delete my account. This app won‚Äôt let me delete my account and it‚Äôs very frustrating, if I get trash emails from my fitness pal I will be so mad. Now I‚Äôm angry so that‚Äôs awesome.

Exactly what I‚Äôve wanted To be able to scan food and have data automatically logged takes all of the frustration out of counting calories. The added ability to choose from a search engine also helps for things that do not have nutritional facts. I carry a scale around with me and can easily log anything I consume. I love it.

Love the app Hate the Update Was 5 star rating until recent upgrade. The view is now a homogenous white blob. Was easier to find meals etc with some contrast. All white is NOT easier on the eyes. Some of my foods are missing and many I haven‚Äôt logged in a while are back. Lost Foods on the previous upgrade as well. Frustrating. This is a great app but change just to change when some of it doesn‚Äôt need fixing makes no sense. Bring back some contrast to this. Please.
Make menu easy to understand I love this app but I would appreciate it if you guys made the menu more easy to understand when your counting calories and are trying to eat something.

Easy to count calories This app makes it easy to count calories. You can scan barcodes on packages or simply type in restaurant names and dishes. Their huge database typically has the foods you are eating. Plus if you home cook a dish with a lot of ingredients, the ‚Äúmeal‚Äù function lets you save all the ingredients as a meal so that you do not have to enter every Ingredient every time you eat the dish.

Can you please fix this? Whenever I try to log in , a small pop-up box appears and it says ‚ÄúSorry, we are unable to process your registration at this time‚Äù. I tried deleting the app and downloading it again, and still the same problem! This has been happening for about a week now, can you please fix it??

My favorite health app Before trying my fitness pal, I had used other tracking apps like lifesum and LoseIt. The apps weren‚Äôt anywhere near as comprehensive, and they always made me feel guilty when I fell off the bandwagon.

Would give it 5 but... I would give it 5 stars but MyFitnessPal will not connect to my Fitbit tracker. This is one of the main features I was looking for. I have used MyFitnessPal on and off for years. I thought maybe it was that my phone was too old. I updated my phone and bought a new tracker and they still will not connect. If this problem is fixed I would give it five stars.

Easy to use and pretty accurate I definitely like this app compared to a few others I have seen and that my wife has used.  This one has so many different options and measurements and the accuracy of the macro nutrient make up is pretty good.  I would definitely recommend this one over many of the others out there.

It won‚Äôt even let me login :( I loved MFP a few years back when I started my journey. I switched my diet and I wanted to track my macros, but that‚Äôs impossible since I cannot even sign in!!!! Apparently the app cannot even connect to the server to log me in! And sadly this is not the first time I‚Äôm running into this issue with this! Given its popularity and how many users are utilizing it, you would expect that something so simple as the Log In process would be closely monitored and fixed immediately if there was a bug.

Good, but there are issues This app has served its purpose for the most part, however,  it has been moving very slow, it has also been and freezing up as I‚Äôm entering foods.  Eventually the app just crashes on me. Also, more recently,  the app has been having difficulty connecting/syncing with the server (as it says) and that my recipes will be saved locally. Unfortunately, it doesn‚Äôt actually save changes in recipes. Please fix the bugs/issues.

Could be better When entering my very first meal, the serving sizes on everything I tried to add was ounce, gram, pound, etc.  that's not the way I live.  I want choices like cup, tablespoon, teaspoon, etc.  I do NOT want to weigh everything I eat. Also, the data base is absolutely amazing.  However, since people are allowed to enter items into the community accessible database, there is so much JUNK! it helped me a ton!! From great to frustrating Been using this app for years.
Good, but not great. Good for basic tracking and logging in already loaded in recipes from restaurants.

Rating I love my fitness pal. I‚Äôve used it for a long time now. Great app! I've been using it for several years on and off.  The latest update is really good.  I‚Äôve been trying to lose weight over the last 6 months and I‚Äôve managed to lose 36 lbs so far.
